ENS7h1PvuJfV7E29VW361g.text: Things have recently changed at this Flemings location.  They appear to be taking a cost cutting approach to their offerings.  We usually get nice free homemade potatoes chips during happy hour.  This has now turned into popcorn.  Which is obviously a cheaper way to go.  In addition they are not serving Prime Rib any longer which what high end steakhouse doesn't?   When conversing with the servers, they appear to be very secretive with limited information about the changes.   There is new management is all they were us say. Then they sent a creepy manager over to give us some made up BS story about the changes.. which made it worse.  I suspect they are probably having some financial trouble.  What they don't realize is because of the little things is why people go there in the first place. People on the Westside do have the means to support a higher steakhouse but you've been running us off little by little over the years.  We won't be back.  Would rather go to Arrowhead Grill or to Scottsdale for the price.

GipOHGeni4VSxqPPJO8OCQ.text: The seafood tower is always delicious,  Great wine list and service , you get what you pay for.

KmorNf0zfRUE7u9BvsgqHA.text: My family & I were really looking forward to the Easter Brunch at Fleming's, what a disappointment.  My daughter & I had the Eggs Benedict with filet, the eggs were over cooked, the yolks were solid.  The sides were broccoli & fried potatoes, nothing impressive.  My dessert was Creme Brulee, the sugar was not melted into a solid crust on top, still granulated on top.  I expected much more for $50 a person.  There are many much better steakhouses in Phoenix, I will not be back to Flemings.

kEQNy37LkCZaxSnjK2KzRw.text: We went for our Daughters 16th birthday! Flemings was amazing, they gave her a birthday card signed by the staff, a $25 gift card given by the manager and a gift of chocolates to take home! Our waitress was great, helpful and kind. Not only that but the Food was Amazing!!! To die for- highly recommend Flemings!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. My Daughters Gift from Flemings for her Birthday

wXhKy_AXV2VaIrx5ILzxng.text: Food was OK. One steak overdone one under done. Took forever to get a drinks and be greated. Wait staff was sub par at best. Might give them another shot but for the price service and food should have been outstanding.

-eh2AfPikgqy7III2YguqA.text: Decided to try a new place none of us had been before. Reservations were easy to set and got seated right away. Once seated everything went down hill. We were there for Christmas dinner with friends and family. Our waitress was nice, but was not in tune with our group. She was hard to hear and more often then not did not always understand what we were requesting so had to ask multiple times in order to get it right.   We have always heard the food was good, but once served it was par at best. Filet Mignon was not the best considering the price. We have had better at less expensive places. Seafood was not that good either, have had better fresh Salmon from Fry's Market place.  After it was all said and done and a bill that was hundreds of dollars this place was really not worth it. Not 5 star worthy. Steak 44 or Dominicks will be our next stop.

L5wNUAUNxP15_X4mw-vWYg.text: Dined with my wife and I here before the Fiesta Bowl game. We were amazed not only by the ribeye but the service as well. World class. We will be back again.

bbOpRRl4JSA0dHPqgrHlRA.text: Been here 2x one for Valentine's Day & the other Easter brunch. We enjoyed both visits & the menu was different on both occasions which was a bonus. We really enjoyed the food, service & the cost didn't break the bank for those holidays which usually do if you do anything nicer than Outback. So this place gets 2 thumbs up. The extensive wine list was really great & offered a variety of grapes & price levels. We will be back again & hopefully sooner than later.

6kYBkbtOu6m1nYNSEi0I_Q.text: Great service and food. Nice ambience. The fillet mignon is amazing! There are a few locations around the valley. The asparagus was also delicious.

tovvYqtnev8Oe-UlYXlBOA.text: Great food and their happy hour isn't bad either. However the bar has a fruit fly problem. I was there for happy hour about two months ago and mentioned something to both the bartender and manager about it. During that visit they replaced a half finished glass of wine because a few had found their way in.  I recently went back for happy hour again and found that they still have a fruit fly problem. I can only hope the kitchen is cleaned better than the bar but I won't be taking any chances. There are too many other cleaner places to eat at.

tylJBBALir7pq5zBUkJLWQ.text: My favorite steakhouse. The bone in ribeye is amazing. The chocolate lava cake is good too.

J9F6o3asobXjFYkUyiYF1w.text: We just celebrated our 31st anniversary at Flemings and had the best meal. Our waiter, Daniel,  made the evening very special. We will  always request him in the future.

FfBlUNnqw0FxpwnrjyUUaQ.text: I heard a rumor that the happy hour menu at Fleming's had changed.  It had been a long time since we had gone, so I thought it was time.  They have changed a few menu items, but my favorites are still on there.  We ordered two burgers, which were delectable.  The patty was so juicy and the bacon was perfectly cooked.  I had the beef carpaccio like usual.  It was great!  We decided to try the pork belly and grits. The pork belly was pretty good, but the grits were just a tad bit dry.  We got complimentary chips with our meal.  Free is always nice!  I wish I remembered our servers name.  I believe she was expecting, or I just insulted her.  But anyway, she was wonder.  She was super friendly and attentive.

mL-_AWCzDOmZqmX2yyaFBw.text: this was my third time hare but I tried fish I know fish is in a steak house is dumb I had the Mai Mai the fish it's self was dry  it the sauce was amazing just make me a soup with that and I'll be happy my son had salmon he thought it was the best that he ever had I tried it put my sauce on that and it would definitely be the best salmon ever but next time I'll stick with the steak oh the butters for the bread no words to describe how good it was for service was friendly not to pushed only reason not for the forth star was the portion size was to small for the price like 4oz fish

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States

1esIDX3aePnvJgMEsAtmhA.text: My husband, adult daughter and father-in-law went for the amazing happy hour hamburgers and drinks but what we experienced was soooo much more. Matt Spier is hands down the best server I have ever had the pleasure of experiencing! Many servers bring you a treat on a special occasion but Matt MADE this occasion special. He is incredibly personable yet professional, intriguingly communicative yet kept on point and brief, joined our celebration yet gave us private family time. He engaged each one of us, thoughtfully answering all our questions and humbly offering advice. He discovered through conversation that it was my daughter's birthday, it was our anniversary and that my father-in-law lives by the rule "you're never to full for ice cream." Matt took our low-key happy hour and turned it into a full on celebration of our family honoring, with heartfelt words, a young woman turning 25, a couple celebrating 34 years together and the creed of a 89 year old. The hamburgers were delicious, the drinks Matt suggested were delightful and the party Matt threw us was extraordinary!

rbdZL3Mu82nBypyg-H7hDQ.text: A fantastic meal served by attentive, friendly, and professional staff. The manager checked on us a few times and was very welcoming. The steak was done to perfection as were the other dishes that we had. The Lobster Bisque is the best I've had anywhere. Thank you Paul, our waiter, and everyone for a fabulous evening.

cFFnKT9s_MmyReqdjvBgPg.text: Visit again this past weekend with all my nieces and nephews. You can't go wrong with the ribeye steak, the food is always great the service is always excellent. The staff is very patient with my group of teenagers who have not a lot of fine dining experience

AUnua4uUOn7Jzfy5H9cYaA.text: I was hoping to give a five star rating...but there were a just few complications. Let me start by saying the service was fantastic, we had a party of 8 for my Dad's 60th and we got sat right away at a fantastic table. The hostess was very friendly and explained that we had a tablet with an interactive wine list on it. Very cool! While the atmosphere is a bit loud, we couldn't really hear one another unless we raised our voices a bit, but that didn't bother me since my little girl can get a bit loud at times and it didn't seem to bother our neighboring tables. We ordered two appetizers, the Sweet Chile Calamari which was spot on and the Roasted Butternut Squash Ravioli which was smaller than I expected but still very delicious!  The manager came to introduce himself and thanked us for coming, he gave my Dad a Gift Cert for his next visit (unfortunately we're all from other states, so he gave it to my Grandmother) and made sure we were doing alright.  The back waiter came to clear out appetizers and accidentally spilled my Grandma's water on her lap and oxygen tank...poor thing felt so bad and apologized profusely. They came to clean the mess up and brought a change of cloth table covers and extra cloth napkins for my Grandma. They were very quick and efficient!  The Caesar Salad was exceptional, by the way...I highly recommend it for all you garlic lovers! Our food came and everything was spectacular! They did buy the table two desserts as an apology for the water which were both fantastic and very thoughtful. The waitor took a complimentary photo of our family, although a little blurry, it was such a nice touch to the end of a meal. They printed it out and brought a box of truffles to my Dad to take home, which was very sweet!  I highly recommend this place and look forward to visiting my Grandma again so I can write a five star review next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Lava Cake

VFgXTx1ILS8lSJJBzgn2ew.text: Flemings never disappoints and that's why it has remained in business for many years. The service is always exemplar. A quality experience.

uDjPGBRrUYYeZEFmpHqmSg.text: So we are just leaving dinner at Flemings.  The food was good. Medium well is actually medium but very tender.  The crab empanada was yummy. What you pay for is the service and Steve Wilson was worth every dime spent.  He made our dinner better than it was.  It was as though we were at his home for a dinner party.  We would come back just based on that.  Thank you Steve....Flemings keep this guy!!

k-2DsKPu3EqgWKPiZGJqzA.text: 15 women had a wonderful meal before going to Theater Works in Peoria.  Everyone praised the food, Susan (our efficient and outgoing waitress), and the chef, Marcos.  Flemmings is aiming to please and they did!

OuQNq0ye39s50sEtEZwAjQ.text: WORST. FLEMINGS. EVER.   I pride myself on being an easy going customer, since I too, am in customer service. So this was absolutely a blood curdling 2 hour experience.  We had reservations for Easter brunch.  40 minutes for appetizers. Why? It had not gotten busy yet. The room was empty. ALSO, since it was just a SLOPPY bowl of ONE inedible strawberry, ONE inedible blackberry and about half of an old Fiji Apple from the reject bin.  Ordered the Steak Benedict w/broccolini. No more broccolini (at 12:30 on Easter Sunday? Odd), but I'm simple, & understanding. So I was told asparagus would be substituted.   We waited SO long. We were getting ready to leave. But we already committed to 1.5 hours, and had the appetizer from the $40/ person 3 course meal.   Once served (1.5 hours later), we were delivered over cooked, cold, green beans instead of the asparagus.... Huh? And then this cold, Benedict with "sauteed arugula" aka unseasoned, bitter, pre cooked 12 hours ago, arugula.   We missed our Easter plans for the afternoon, since we were there, waiting on food, over an hour longer than anticipated.   I just wanted to leave. But dessert was included, berry cobbler. Literally, a bowl of cooked down fruit w/sugar and MAYBE some Aunt Jemima's syrup. With a dollop of ice cream...   We received a complementary $25 gift card for joining them on Easter. I will sell this to anyone for $1.50. Just kidding. I'll give it away for free. Maybe even just throw it in the trash, because i would be utterly embarrassed to refer someone here.    This location is a franchise embarrassment. The other Flemings' we've been to puts this one to SHAME.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. This is not cobbler. It is old fruit, sugar, and aunt Jemima&#39;s syrup....
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Raw potatoes. Overcooked green beans. Old disgusting arugula.

IJ5xv6Z0yHxC3xwgh7MQ5g.text: It's pricey, but everything we had was the very best, so it was a good value.  We went there for our 47th wedding anniversary and shared a starter, salad, filet, and desert.  They were very accommodating about splitting dishes.   Timing of delivery of the dishes was perfect.  Service was extraordinary.  I've had carpaccio in the best restaurants in four countries and Flemings is the very best (period).  Atmosphere is good, especially not very noisy like a Texas Roadhouse so it's perfect for a romantic evening.  The only thing missing was a pallet cleanser, and the little brush used by the server to sweep the crumbs off the table between courses.  Would have been a nice addition but didn't detract from the experience.

VGOXrGHidSpTUgyk2sXZ9g.text: It was okay. The food was tasty but pricey, we knew this going in.   The service was good but not exceptional. The server carded my two much younger friends and then asked if I wanted her to check my ID too. I am obviously way beyond 21, I thought that was ridiculous. She explained that some of her patrons get upset if the whole table is not carded. It was an awkward conversation.   Our drinks on a few occasions were empty. I thought it was usual for a server to wait for a glass to be empty before asking if we would like to order more drinks. I also happened to order a coffee with desert. I finished my coffee and I asked for a refill, but the refill never happened.   I wasn't wowed so this establishment goes on the list  *if there's nothing else around and I am feeling extra spendy * (not often).

Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States

fVBP8K7JVKtEqL2cLhbgcg.text: My girlfriend and I stopped by for happy hour.  Charles our waiter was outstanding!   He recommended a wine and thought the burger was big enough to share.   Appetizers, hamburger, wine  and a Cosmo...  topped off with Birthday  Chocolate.   We had a great time.

iK_KIMROjVhqytwQo3kXXg.text: Another wonderful experience at the Flemings in Peoria. My mother and I both indulged in the Sunday/Monday Prime Rib dinner deal. Which includes a salad, prime rib, your choice of a side, and a dessert of your choice all for $35. Such a great deal and a huge amount of food.  The prime rib was cooked wonderful and was packed with a lot of flavor. It is also accompanied by three dipping sauces: horseradish, some mustard sauce, and an au jus. I choose the chipotle mac and cheese which is my absolute favorite, best mac and cheese by far. For dessert I got the signature molten chocolate lava cake, to die for. My mom got the carrot cake which is also divine, comes with a bourbon caramel sauce that puts it over the top.  I'm a regular at this location and every time we go it feels like we're visiting family. The staff is always so kind. Alex was out waiter tonight and he did a great job.  If you're looking for a great dinner with amazing service head here. They are also amazing when it comes to special occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Carrot cake. Best I&#39;ve ever had. Ask for extra bourbon caramel sauce.
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Molten chocolate lava cake. To die for.

Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Prime Rib Dinner with dipping sauces. Chipotle Cheddar Macaroni &amp; Cheese, Crispy Brussels Sprouts, and Fleming&#39;s Potatoes (not a fan).

PN7ynpGSlNDfurtvuyD-YQ.text: Everything was fantastic. Service was a little challenging, most likely due to the size of our group, but far more positive to point out than negative. The filet was incredible and cooked to perfection. The blueberry cheesecake melted in your mouth. It's a definite must go for a great steak dinner that won't disappoint

VJZpicWJKkjXJgu_1EG0Uw.text: Absolutely the best dinner in town. Started with a Fleming's Salad, 20oz Prime Bone In Ribeye with Jumbo Lump Crabmeat - my wife had the Petite Filet Mignon with Breaded Jumbo Shrimp. Mouth watering delicious & the service is impeccable!! White Glove Restaurant worth every penny!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Petite Filet Mignon* with Colossal Shrimp
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Prime Bone-In Ribeye* Jumbo Lump Crabmeat
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Fleming&#39;s Salad

XgE9J9DrzJmsJIrrVISEHQ.text: My favorite steak house I've ever been to and I really love trying steakhouses. This place has ruined me though. Nothing I've had since has compared. That 30 day dry aged ribeye is to die for and paired with duckhorn merlot...let's just say I can die happy now.

hZM4zZL7swMZahkgs2-KHQ.text: Okay so we went back for happy hour as the general manager recommended and WOW!!! Everything was so good. We got a burger, the pork belly, and the burrata. The burrata was so creamy and they gave you quite a bit. The pork belly was served with cherries and arugula salad. It was salty and delicious. The burger was cooked perfectly and came with bacon and cheese. The happy hour prices were awesome! I will return for happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Happy hour menu

_i4DzhuRDZc6Y792AkDrXw.text: I have been to many steakhouses from Chicago to Phoenix, however Fleming's is by far the best steak I have ever had in my steakhouse experiences. The main fillet mignon requires no chewing, because of it being cooked just right the steak melts right on your tongue. This place knows how to cook good steak!!

po-n9Vt50FAb4FzInfCBFA.text: Perfect, perfect, perfect! Courteous, polite, appreciative, and acknowledge detail. Food delicious. Never mind a few one star people that complain. Sounds like entitled individuals. We're all lucky we're not living in a country, eating whatever we can to survive. Instead some try to bash a good restaurant. Hello, there's a lot of moving parts to a restaurant, no ones perfect. Other than perfection, is  maybe took a little long with my meal, but I understand what it's like to be good, and iN DEMAND. I was patient as I understood. When I ate it was worth the wait. Great wine selection.

ZOhqgI999-u2SZV_7QPWbA.text: Very disappointed with my dine in today. I always eat at Flemings with my family and friends but this location is new to us so we decided to try it out. The food just all came out very salty to us. I told my husband this is just too salty I wanted to send it all back but he's the type not to make a big deal out of it but I will because this is a very high in restaurant and for them to serve us salty food there's no excuse! I won't be returning to this location.

1pmVTYiKGm4xhkNctL3vRA.text: They don't need my review. My business isn't going to make or break this place. But they still served us like it would. It's about the service here. Trained and knowledgeable.   I can go get a streak anywhere.   We can caveman grill it at home and save a paycheck.   What brings me back here is the people. Here they don't let you forget Service is an industry of talent.

_uAI6Msfy08vWdLKcepiYQ.text: Good evening everyone in the west valley of Arizona I've lived here for 10 years and I spend a lot of time traveling and going to some of the finest restaurants I first eight at Flemings about five years ago because of the chain and the name and I had an amazing dinner!..  however and I mean however why don't get your hopes up yet???? Wait for it wait for it...  I went there last July for my birthday with my daughter and the food was average I got home an hour later I was sick on the toilet and I'm sure you can imagine how that is!!  That way it gets better... it's now Easter Sunday and I wanted to take my daughter out for Easter dinner and I thought I'd try Flemings again!..   The service was great as usual the wine tasted good however I asked the waitress for the lamb chops if every good restaurant sells lamb chops with either mint jelly or a mint jelly sauce I can't believe that this restaurant does not have any kind of mint  jelly for lamb chops who would've thought when you pay $65 for a meal and you can't have MINT jelly!!  Oh well I guess I decided to order the lamb chops anyway because I just wanted some good lamb chops so they brought me a whole rack of lamb and I ordered the medium but when it came it was almost on the rear side!.. there were so much garlic in the meat so much garlic's in the potatoes so much garlic in the bread I think the garlic was to hide all the screw ups I guess but after the third lamb chop I wasn't sure if I was getting a bad taste in my mouth or we just heavily seasoned!!!  You got it once again an hour after I left the restaurant I'm on the TOILET!  Now I could've been a little easier and as all of society is now running of politically correct or you shouldn't say this or that I spent $200 and an hour later I'm on the toilet yes I could say I'm in the bathroom or indisposed but who wants to spend the next three hours on the toilet...

_jKz-hmKDWDsw9XoDFOUGw.text: I wish I could leave a review of the food but unfortunately we sat at Fleming's for over an hour with no food. The waitress was nice enough but they seemed to be under staffed and at capacity. For a $100+ meal I would expect service to be well above standard. They took our drink order, we waited 45 minutes with no drinks after already sitting for 15 minutes waiting for the drink order prior. Not worth the effort.

GJ6J761QUmHcKRBZkKmg6w.text: We always have great food and service when here. Tonight we came for happy hour. The burrata was awesome, super creamy, lovely flavor. The bread that came with it was buttery and had basil on it, yum. The calamari is my favorite, I have it every time we stop by. Always super tender. The sauce is sweet and spicy. I love it!! We both had burgers. You get your choice of cheese, super wonderful bacon also is topped on it. The French fries are the shoe string type which are great. 2 apps, 2 burgers and 2 mango ice tea's for $40. I think that's a great deal for the high quality of food. Our servers were very attentive and very friendly. Always a fun place to do happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. My favorite calamari.
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Burrata. Creamy cheese spread on delicious bread!!
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. We love happy hour here!!

uP6aEXVkURYbtMpV6d56Hw.text: Let me start off by saying that I loved, loved, loved our visit to Flemings! I decided to surprise my husband on his birthday with a visit. It was awesome that from the time we walked in until the time we left they made his night special.  Our server Rory took great care of us and anticipated our needs. He was also extremely helpful with the menu and wine selections.  We both ordered the bone in ribeye which was excellent and cooked to perfection. We shared the Fleming potatoes and sauteed mushrooms and both were fantastic. The bread and spreads that were served before dinner were super good as well.  We will definitely be back hopefully sooner rather than later.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Bone in Ribeye. Delicious!!
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Seafood tower. Amazing!! King crab, jumbo shrimp and lobster.

jb9dOjONtGYlHXtV5k5CWA.text: This Steakhouse was a great experience for me and my partner anniversary we were treated well by our waitress mckennal Darchied. She admitted that she was new at this restaurant however I would have never known because she understood the quality of the food she  knew the ingredients she knew great selections to choose she knew her wines and she kept us engaged on what to expect she surprised us with an anniversary gift treat box that made it very special for us being there and we really appreciate it her time spent with us that we felt to give her a luxury tip amount if you ever attend here please ask for our server she's very polite and poise the atmosphere was very romantic very cozy the greeting from the Chef & The owners made you feel appreciative of spending the high quality price of the meal I really enjoyed my time and the value of food small portions but very tender and bursting with flavor it's a great experience and I believe you'll enjoy your experience here too
