w2i7lj3g-EF3GDBhcNKvUw.text: First time ever. I had no idea what to expect. We are part of Dine Rewards and this restaurant was one of the locations.   Wow! Amazing food. High price point but worth every bit. The service was unbelievable. This was our 1st wedding anniversary. We were so glad we chose Flemings.   They always used our names and were genuinely friendly. Even the general manager, Marc, came by to welcome and thank us. He gave us a nice gift too.   We ordered steaks and Flemings potatoes along with desserts. We were very pleased with our meal. This is gong to sound crazy but we couldn't stop commenting on their ranch dressing. I could have poured that on my dessert. Must be lined with crack or something. It was creamy and perfect. Best wedge salad ever. Bacon was a little odd tasting. I have to mention the blueberry lemon drop. Delish! My husband commented that's the 1st time he's seen me finish 2 drinks at dinner. I could have drank another.   Service...where do I start? Great group of people. The hostess lady was friendly as can be. Gianni was our server and she was amazing. She knew the menu well and gave recommendations with confidence. Even the busgirl, Betty, was friendly. When was the last time a busser has addressed you and struck up conversation? I was impressed. She made us laugh. They really have a good team of people to take care of their guests.   I can't figure out why we haven't gone sooner. We are always in the area. Rest assured, we will be back!  They really went above and beyond our expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Great anniversary gift.

_Imp-ZkRX206pZvLAoOE2Q.text: I had a much better experience this time. We came for happy hour and sat on the patio, the waiter was very attentive and accommodating. The table tried the happy hour prime burger, flat bread, calamari, ravioli, and several salads. The calamari was a large portion for the cost but the ravioli came with only three to an order. The flatbread was the table favorite and was loaded with steak. I find a lot more value in happy hour at Fleming's then in their dinner and would come back again for it.

goDpG7l8jYaw_YnUGWwCdQ.text: Went to a company retirement party here, just appetizers and drinks and it was awesome! Too bad the wait staff herded some non-company related customers through the room while the guest of honor was giving his speech.

y3PFQtGubsd0DDkMojpPrg.text: Excellent meal and atmosphere.  From the time we handed the front desk our reservation confirmation we were always addressed by name.  We were celebrating our 40th anniversary and had many congratulations from the staff.  The truffles and the gift card were a very nice surprise too.  The filet special was buttery tender and the sides are huge.  We ordered 2 sides, but easily could have only ordered one.  The lava cake was a perfect ended to a very nice evening.

Y8BcSLnWfJwenC_-oVKqbA.text: I'm going to review first, then decide on stars. First, the service by Gina was 5 star! Wine List was 3.5 star but pricing was way too high - give it 3 stars. Petite filet mignon, medium rare was 5 star!! Creamed spinach was 3 star, as was the loaded baked potato - neither had much flavor.  But the caesar salad was worth 4.5. OK - overall, I'll say 3.5 star.  Since I can't do that, a 3, because the total experience just wasn't a 4 I've not tried Ruth's Chris in Scottsdale, but my experience with Ruth's in other cities has been better than this

ULyODSUOtfhsa6QkYhNwUA.text: Oops. This review is pretty late. I came here with my family for New Year's Eve! I was excited to try a steakhouse in the West Valley, in hopes of having a steak option close to home. Unfortunately, I don't feel like I'll be going back. The filets my family had were dry, tough and salty. It probably didn't help that we had dined at Mastro's for Christmas Eve (amazing!) so I think our expectations may have been on the high side. My dad ordered the lobster tail, which was small and also dry and tough. The cheese in the French Onion Soup was not fully melted, and there was A LOT of cheese. For dessert we got Creme Brulee. It was the highlight of the meal for me since I have a huge sweet tooth, but not enough for me to want to go back to Fleming's any time soon. I will say, that though the food was subpar, the service was great.   **If you do decide to go here, check out Costco for discounted $100 gift certificates!

VLDRSqjVZJZX7qnScfUylQ.text: We took our daughter out for her 21st birthday and we were all treated like royalty. Everyone greeted her with a 'Happy Birthday' - she received a gift card and box of truffles with a candle. We all felt very special. Now to the meal - OMG - my husband and I ordered the steak - it was cooked beyond perfect. The filet was so tender I didn't need a knife to cut it. Our daughter (a picky eater) had the swordfish - which was the first time she had tried it - and LOVED it. The green beans were wonderful too. For desert - which we hardly ever get - we decided on the chocolate lava cake. There are no words...that cake is AMAZING!!! Our waitress - Tiffany - was excellent. She even offered me a black cloth napkin - instead of the white - because I was wearing black pants and she didn't want white fuzz on my black pants...talk about paying attention to detail!! We didn't feel rushed at all, she answered our questions about the meal. We will definately be going back again. Although it is expensive - it was so worth the trip for a birthday dinner.

s8FwiViXqBfCKLJwx-tMtA.text: Impeccable service, delicious food, and beautiful ambiance. What more could you ask for?   What I enjoyed best was that we brought our kids and were still treated like royalty. My children are perfectly behaved and I've received compliments everywhere I go because my kids are so good you hardly know they are there. That doesn't keep some nicer restaurants from making you feel like lepers. In fact, the reason we went is to celebrate my 11 year old's Honor Roll achievement and from the waiter to even the manager, the staff made a point to come by and congratulate him on his hard work.  The food was wonderful. Although my steak was a little short of medium, the Flemings potatoes always make up for that. And the chocolate lava cake at the end? OMG. But my favorite is the chantilly whipped cream. I could eat a bowl of that all by itself.   So I'm looking forward to going back to this Flemings and I really do appreciate how kind they were to my son on his academic achievement. They didn't have to gush so much, but they were genuine and very sweet.

v5WbGjsovLoMvi55V8_yVw.text: My boyfriend & I went to Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar last night before the Phoenix Coyotes hockey game. We wanted to take advantage of the '5 for $6 'til 7' menu at the bar, as well as, the Spring Break Celebration dinner.  I can honestly say that we had an absolutely amazing dinner and that we were so happy we chose to go here before the "big game." The food was delicious, our bartender was attentive and personable AND we got a great deal!  The highlight of our night though was the Baked Oysters Rockefeller appetizer. We ordered a half dozen oysters that were cooked to perfection and had the right amount of spinach, bacon & cheese. (I think what made these oysters so great was the creamy spinach used- I think it is the same as the 'Creamy Spinach' side you can order off the menu.) Highly recommend!  We, also, ordered the Spring Break Celebration which was a choice of The Wedge Salad or French Onion Soup. The entree was the FIlet Mignon & North Atlantic Lobster Tail. The side was a choice of either French Green Beans or Fleming's Mashed Potatoes. We got all this food for only $34.95. What a great deal!  I chose The Wedge Salad which was a perfect starter to my meal. The lettuce was crisp and the tomatoes were fresh. The Filet Mignon was an impeccable 'Medium Rare' temperature and the North Atlantic Lobster Tail was generous. Also, I chose the French Green Beans as a side because I am trying to watch my carb intake. The beans were fresh and the mushrooms were a great compliment to the side dish.  Also, as I stated above, we sat up at the bar and I am sure glad we did because Adam, our bartender, was very sweet and took care of us. I never had an empty glass of wine ;)  Overall, my boyfriend & I typically do not like, for lack of a better word, "chain restaurants" but we believe that Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar in Peoria does it right! They have an outstanding FOH & BOH. Keep up the good work!!

QwqOAJEe0O-aS2BMufii0w.text: AMAZING steaks. Aged and cooked perfectly. It's not too often we can splurge on meals like this, but we were so glad we did. Our anniversary is coming up in April and we will be going to Fleming's for sure. My husband loves their bleu cheese steak and the filet is fantastic. It's so hard to decide on side dishes, but you can't go wrong with any of them.   I was also very impressed with their service and the ambiance is perfect for a romantic meal.

XUmXxsIne6qkC25aUA9OKg.text: I have been to a few Flemings but came here with my boss for dinner. I have never been disappointed with them. Service is always great as well as the food. If looking for a good meal and service this is a place to go.

cAoS8AO2z1MSa7986K1lWA.text: Amazing doesn't even touch it. First off the staff? Fantastic. Everyone from the busboy on up were attentive without hovering. Personable without being too familiar. Perfect. Now the meat of the issue: the food. There was not a bad bite over three courses. I started with the Cesar and my husband had the clam chowder. The Cesar was perfectly balanced. Normally I really don't like clam chowder but I tried a bite of his and it was delicious; not too fishy. He says, "it was thick and amazing. They didn't skimp on anything. It was the best I ever had" Perfect. We caught a prime rib special and this was not the church's prime rib charity dinner! This... it taught me the difference between fat and gristle. This melted in my mouth. I've had butter that wasn't as good as the fat on this beef. It was as served with 3 sauces a standard but not over salty aus jus, a  horseradish that only makes you cry for joy, and... they called it a mustard but...Husband doesn't eat mustard and he loves this. Neither of us could pick a favorite. The Flemings Potatoes are my favorite. Don't let the jalapeno scare you they won't burn you. Dessert is a sinful mystery you need to discover for yourself. The End.

x9stU9XfNR_8uLDp2gTEyQ.text: Tonight's dinner was far above past visits to Fleming's (which is really saying something as they have all been mostly very good to excellent). Our server Aaron and the bartender (drawing a blank sorry!) gave us the best service we've had in a long time. Great recommendations on wines and foods.  Really engaging person and spot on knowledge. The greatest "rocks" Manhattan ever to boot, and a rib eye that I'm still thinking of hours later. Seriously, a meal so good that it lingers in your mind for quite some time afterwards; even though I'm still completely full. That's the mark of a wonderful evening out.

EbhQMRwuk3AQINuS4MxYDw.text: Spent New Years Eve having dinner at Flemings in Peoria Az(attending the Fiesta Bowl)The place was alive with people enjoying a great atmosphere.The service was world class as well as the steaks.

MqcXLtvjKAZFp8hOeoWkdw.text: My wife and I delayed our birthday dinner (ours are just a couple weeks apart) and finally went last night.  It's been a while since we've been to Fleming's so we were both looking forward to it.  We had reservations and were seated promptly.  LeAnn was our server and she was awesome.  She recommended the Eponymous Cab.  It was pricey at $20 per glass.  But worth it.  Nice, well balanced cab.  We started off with the toasted mushroom ravioli.  Delicious.  Filled with tender mushrooms with a butter porcini sauce.  How to get all the sauce?  How about that mini loaf of sourdough they bring you!    We both ordered filet.  My wife ordered the porcini crusted filet and I had the main filet.  Both medium.  We ordered the garlic mash and roasted baby carrots.  The steaks- cooked perfectly.  The manager came over a couple minutes after we cut them to make sure they were to our satisfaction.  They were.  I had a side of peppercorn sauce with mine as well.  Fantastic.  The sides- the mash was nothing special.  But those carrots?  WOW!  Don't think of grocery store carrots when you think baby carrots.  Not even close.  The carrots were roasted with golden raisins and slivered almonds.  Those could have been the best part of the meal if I wasn't such a steak lover!    LeAnn gave us a complimentary box of chocolate truffles as well.  The food was fantastic but the service was above and beyond.  We will definitely be back!

WO0-vIDRY8i_ZAbUZcoGXA.text: I'm generally not one to write a negative review and I'm cautious to judge a place based on negative reviews. I must say I'm not very impressed. I'm giving 2 stars based on the food alone. While the food was delicious the service was poor at best. We went with friends from out of town for a birthday dinner and all of our plates got mixed up. Not just the plates themselves but each of our steaks was with the wrong item. So we couldn't just switch plates because my medium rare steak was on my friends plate with her crab cakes. So all plates had to be sent back to pair the steak with the right "turf". Once that was fixed one person in the party didn't get their food until all of us finished our meals, we would have waited but then all of ours would have been cold. For a restaurant on the spendy side I just couldn't believe how bad the service was. Again this could be overlooked if they were busy but we were there for an early dinner and their seemed to be plenty of staff to support the amount of seated tables.   Aside from taking our order and bringing our food our server didn't check to see how we were one time. While the food was tasty I was shocked to leave a place that charges $50 for surf and turf hungry. I figured the portion would be decent and a side might be too much food but that wasn't the case. That was just our experience there. Had the service and circumstances been better, I could overlook leaving hungry given how good the food was but there were just a lot of let downs that left me feeling embarrassed I picked that as the restaurant to take our friends to celebrate their birthday.

wngSPSsFamBz52v2XhvJRQ.text: So I have a couple things to say. #1 My boyfriend called a couple days ahead of valentines day to make sure the bar was open for happy hour and the hours of operation were normal and he was told that on valentines day that it would be normal hours. When we got there at 4:30 the bar was full and had an hour and a half wait because they actually opened at 4 that day. We waited, got a spot at the bar and were served..#2 The bartenders were so amazing and accommodating. They made everyone's drinks fast, and delicious. And they were on top of everything. Had an amazing dining experience(other than the hour wait).

n_9sM0FV1UMFtfqV6_fg8A.text: While looking for a gift for our tax accountant, we came across a recommendation to try this place out.  After parousing their website, it turns out they were doing a special Easter Sunday Brunch.  We decided to book and check the place out.   My friend Stan Reinhold, a world renowned chef here in AZ, let me know this was a great place to go so I was happy to have the reservations as soon as we made them for such a popular holiday.  Our reservations were for 12 noon, just 30 minutes after they started service for brunch. It ran through 3pm and there was not a free table to be had.  As soon as one was vacated, it was dressed and refilled before you knew it.  Its very dark and intimate, probably a great place for an anniversary or private moment with friends or loved ones.   All dressed in black, as were his counterparts, was Kevin, our waiter.  A pony-tailed boy off about 25 who appeared eager to take care of us. We started with a glass of the house Chardonnay and a Mimosa, which was one of their brunch special cocktail.   The full Sunday Dinner Menu was also available for those not looking for the brunch fare but we came for that so giving the regular menu its due, we opted to do brunch as planned.  This was NOT a buffet as are most high end establishments and their brunch offerings.  It was a set menu, with several choices.  We both had the same palate so our selections were identical.  Starting course was a fresh berry plate with a Sour Cream-Vanilla-Honey sauce that was very nice.  Beautiful fresh fruits and plenty of them.    Round two was a Crab Frittata made with Swiss Cheese, Mushrooms and Asparagus.  It was also served with a crispy Hash Brown, 2 sausage links and a Roasted Tomato half.  Interesting presentation, a good portion and quite tasty.    Dessert offerings were three....New York Cheese Cake, Creme Brulee' and something else that was unmemorable.  We opted for the Cheese Cake and its additional side of sweetened cream along with a piping hot coffee.   All in all, we were there for the better part of an hour and a half.  The service was paced so that nothing came out until it was supposed to, which was nice.  There was a moment or two where it seemed to have gotten so busy we were left unattended to and our waters were in need of refilling for a bit too long.  (Kevin, you were nice, but your stock is plummeting)  Also, the tag-line Kevin used repeatedly when checking on us was getting old...."How's that working for you?"  Time to come up with something new.  I hate to think my dinner is "working" in any capacity.    So, the bottom line is this.  Go on payday as there is nothing inexpensive about this place.  Morton's or Ruth's Chris it's not but certainly trying to get there. Plan on spending some time and don't think you will just zip in a zip out, its not that kind of place.  The food was delicious and you should expect nothing less. Would I go again?  Absolutely!  Would I recommend it to a friend?  Without a second thought.

Kp8UgwRr13_2IKHMx5ePvg.text: The first time we ate here it was unmemorable.  We thought we would never be back.  I try not to rate any place by a one time visit so we decided to give Flemings another try. We have been here a couple times now.  We both had filet cooked medium and it was great.  I dont remember what we had for appetizers or the sides...once again unmemorable.  The Molten Lava cake was awsome and definitely memorable.  I really wouldn't recommend this place to my friends.  It was good, but just keep forgetting what I had.  Whenever I eat at Mastro's or Ruth Chris I seem to never have that problem.

i8beoMsaBOX3gaJdgsEraQ.text: It was as good as it gets! Wow. Our steaks were tender and moist, our sides were corn and salads, both were excellent.  Service was perfect. Flemings is a great place to treat yourself to a wonderful meal.

B6n6HbDOOJ--04qZcc-tIw.text: Not the usual dining experience tonight. Typically we sit in the main dining room, but tonight was my boyfriend's birthday and the Steelers were on, so we asked to sit by the t.v.'s. We had made reservations and noted that it was his birthday and none of that information got transferred to our server, I had to tell him when my boyfriend went to the restroom. We ordered from one server and then at the start of dinner, realized she had left us with another server, which honestly ruined the experience. No mention of her leaving, no manager visit, it took a while to realize someone else was taking care of us entirely because we were looking for her to order another round of drinks, which we never had the chance to. No one asked how dinner was, which mine was overdone and his was underdone. Our new server cleared the table when I was still eating and therefore I couldn't finish my meal. He didn't even notice, nor ask. We asked for a box, and typically they box for you, but the box was literally thrown onto the table as he walked by. I was looking around for a manager but none could be found. When leaving, no one was at the host stand to talk to either. It was such a disappointing experience from somewhere we've been before and choose to spend lots of money at. The food doesn't make up for the lacking service, so we likely won't be back. My recommendation is to sit in the main dining area, where service for us has always been great. The bar area drops the whole Fleming's experience.

UyPOIfzaNeyXAjDqNT95BQ.text: I giving them 3 stars not because of the food quality, preparation or price (although I find them a little pricey), but because of passive and mediocre service that didn't reflect the ambiance of Flemings. I was asked to join some friends as a single in a group where they asked to separate checks. Most had a pleasant experience as they shared plates etc. The waiter seemed to ignore me for the most part. It seemed that he realized that I would be the lowest tip. My tea drink was empty that he noticed but walked past. My entree arrived without the potato and vegetable that I ordered. He didn't notice or check as it was served.  The manager came by and I explained my problem. He went to fix it but most of the group was at least half done when it was resolved. They all had to wait until I was done to consider deserts. When it came to pay, I told him that I had a Dine Rewards account and gave him my phone and account #. (which in the past has been ok to receive credit in other of the Bloomin Brands chains) He never processed either but gave me a new card which is useless to me, unless I want to start over earning credits. Little things like this bother me. As some of my staff and business partners dine there, I sending out a memo today asking them to report similar Dine Rewards and service problems there. The next step will be stopping corporate reimbursements of entertaining there.

OzBqFuB1dc2Pxdr5COJB8A.text: Four of us had dinner here last Sunday, we all had the prime rib special. The service was outstanding, just what you expect from an upscale steakhouse. We each had a different salad and all were excellent. The prime rib was cooked perfectly and the Flemings au gratin potatoes were enjoyed by all, and large enough to take home. Dessert too was excellent. But overall the service is what we most enjoyed as not many places still have service at this caliber.

UYkwjJ5DfrZhY2iSfoP2zg.text: I've always heard of this place but never tried it because it's very pricey. My wife and I were told about there happy hour, so we decided to try it. They start you off with some chips that were delicious perfect flavor. The drinks were the only bad part had a summer shandy which wasn't good at all but I gave it a shot because it was the special of the day, my wife had a blueberry/strawberry martini like drink was not good in my opinion and she said she wasn't a fan. Now let's get to the best part, we both had the prime burger, hands down the best burger I've ever had, cooked to perfection and didn't even need any condiments on it. Overall I recommend this restaurant and will definitely being going here again. $64

cwQHzy66C9Rvb5LHuydokw.text: Although pricey, food was delicious and our waiter knew his stuff with wine. Very friendly, light hearted and prompt service. Would recommend to eat here if you are looking for a little bit nicer if a place.

hFTiGkMkDMf0rNMAszSH7Q.text: Went to have dinner for our 2nd year anniversary. Our waitress Nicole was completely awesome she took care of us in every way possible. She knew her menu she knew her items she even took a picture of us and printed out and brought it to us for memories and then as we were leaving she brought us a parting gift of a box of truffles. The manager Marc was awesome we definitely enjoyed our experience at Flemings and will be going back

mkVALtCX-gu4DWeOa8NQig.text: I can't believe I lived right down the street from this restaurant and never tried it. I feel like a complete fool.   The main dining area is an open spaced area with appropriate dim dinner lighting. Even sitting at a table, I still had the feel of privacy because of the lighting. The people I encountered were extremely friendly and (easily seen) truly proud of their restaurant.   LeAnn, my waitress, was extraordinary.....more on that later   They brought out bread with two types of spread. It was delicious but, since I was dining alone, stopped after sampling each type of spread. Both were delicious.   I started with a gin martini (as usual) and the lump crab cakes. What a treat - mostly crab and light on the fillers....perfect for a light appetizer.   After I was finished the manager, Mike, came out to great me and check on the service so far. Very pleasant and happy to welcome people to the restaurant.   I ordered the bone-in ribeye over the fillet (which I definitely need to try) at the recommendation of the waitress. I paired it with the Kenwood Cab. It was everything promised. My concern was that the steak would be over cooked. Usually, when I order steak out, I need to specify "on the rare side of medium rare" to make sure it is correct. I really shouldn't have worried. What you order is how it is prepared. It was juicy and tender as promised.   I finished with the carrot cake and a cordial. I must note that all the deserts are made in house and not frozen. Again, the dessert was perfect.   Before the dessert came out, I was greeted by Scott, the Operating Partner. He was clearly proud of this location and the chef. He was just checking on the service and ensure I had a good evening.   SUMMARY:   All in all, and those who know me know that this is a VERY RARE SENTENCE for me to commit to writting....but.........I have absolutely nothing bad to say about my experience at the Peoria Fleming's.   The waitress was attentive but not intrusive. The timing of the meal presentation was perfect with a steady flow of food and appropriate breaks in between. One of the problems I find most insulting at restaurants (feeling rushed or getting your next item before finishing the previous) is something no one should ever feel here.   One recommendation for improvement (to make a 5+ rating in my book) would be to have the wait staff remark on the local chef's creations. The "specials not on the menu" are the local chef's creations......maybe say something to remark on the uniqueness of these items not on the menu......"our local chef has prepared a few items you wont find at other Fleming's" or something to that effect....I know, minor, but there is always room for improvement LOL.

ftJCTlgZn8kClEj9SehzjA.text: I've been to Fleming's twice now. The first time for my birthday dinner and the food and experience was absolutely amazing. Service was great and my steak was fork tender.   The second time I went was a little earlier in the day on a Sunday. Had the prime rib. The service was like they had better things to do than deal with us and the prime rib seemed like it was made a couple days prior. Just not very good at all.

nGO23EgB7doFDUhrHXO1VA.text: First time to Fleming's.  Heard so many great things about the food.  The filets were perfectly cooked. Ordered a bottle wine. So our bill was going to be about $200. When we received our bill, she didn't charge us for the wine. So when we told her that she didn't charge us, she said ...."Oh....sorry bout that". Not even a thank you. I guess we figured she would be a little more grateful, since it would probably come out of her check. We will definitely go back because of the great food.

cVqz2qJYzuI6g4TIpfC_0Q.text: This place was pricey, but worth every single penny! Honestly, from the above and beyond service to the amazing food, this steakhouse was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had in Phoenix.

ix9a6XmaAVbz5ftnWL7LSg.text: Enjoyed a wonderful meal at Flemings. The service was superb. And we even received a wonderful birthday gift of chocolates and a gift card so we may enjoy another fabulous night at Flemings.

ymd3ImRd1HHOI_QTfvw4Tg.text: The meal was pretty good.  Good quality food.  Good service.  A little pricy, but for a special occasion its great.

x2VgcoFvYskYstlhiFesWQ.text: Excellent all around.  Delicious entrees, solid wine list, lovely service.  We sat outside which was very nice.  High end priced, a tip is to sit outside and do the A La Carte bar menu for dinner -- fantastic dishes and you will pay 1/3 the price versus regular menu.  A lovely surprise for us during our vacation, we will be back!

CCQjJ9UY8d3IVM6VjwHkSA.text: Absolutely great steak dinner. I had the dry aged Ribeye w/ Kona coffee rub and it was very tender/tasty. From the appetizer to desert, everything was delicious. The flemings potatoes are a must have.

okdiHg82GPALBs-rfiSbXg.text: It's alright, but that is all that can be said.  Steaks were good, not great.  Service was good, but not great.  For the price you're better off at Ruth's Chris .

4oyuKxJ4ysSIUALRY-fkRA.text: I would give this place 50 stars if I could! They deserve it for many reasons!   1) hands down the best restaurant service (consistently) out of any venue in the state! They great you by name, and will make just about any request you like happen.   2) The steak rivals if not beats any steak I have eaten anywhere in the world. I have eaten at some of the nicest steak houses in the country and Let me assure you, they know what they are doing here.  3) online ordering. You can show up and just start being served without having to bother with menus at all if you want.    4) super fancy! Their wine list menus are ipads.

czHdvA-afmzGWt7CgiWerQ.text: We've been coming here for years and the last couple times - in April 2016 and again in June 2016 - it has been less than impressive. The most recent time in June was on a Saturday evening and the main filet was delivered under cooked and was a poor cut (lots of veins and impossibly hard to cut - I even asked if they used meat glue as the cut was that poor). The main filet was ordered medium well, but it was delivered medium to medium rare. Yikes! Not a fan of bloody meat personally. Additionally, the ribeye steak that was ordered by another in our party was over cooked and not prepared with the rub as ordered. The first manager had the kitchen cook the filet more, however ignored that there was a decent portion that just wouldn't cut. So I had to ask the other manager if I could get a petite filet as the last 1/3 or more was inedible. The second manager apologized and agreed that steak should not have been sent out. So long story short, I finally got a somewhat decent steak I could eat but ended up eatting alone as everyone had already finished. They were kind enough to remove the main filet off my bill and replaced it with the petite filet on in its place which I am okay with as I did eat the steak. It was just disappointing at what it took to get a subpar steak for the money spent on it. The total time it took for soup, steak and coffee was over two and a half hours - so be prepared for a long dinner if you go. I plan to make the drive to Ruth Chris in Scottsdale in the future if we are wanting to guarantee a good quality steak in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States

kmiUYhmnT8dLrWKz9h8iwA.text: Great west valley upscale steak house, the atmosphere is wonderful and the service was awesome.  Zac was our waiter and he was very professional and good at his job.  He answered all of my friends questions (and I think he had 20)...he probably felt interrogated but handled us well.  I ordered the filet with Gorgonzola and the wife had the fish special (no idea what it was since I am not a huge fish guy).    My steak was fantastic and I also ordered the creamed spinach which was also very creamy and delish.  We did not order desert but had plenty of alcohol and then we pretty much closed out the place before heading to the new Toby Keith's and then Sandbar to close the night!  We dropped about $400 for all 4 of us which is pretty standard for an upscale steak house.

02uttHub75KlXOl7SC9j6g.text: I really enjoy Flemings.  From the bar area to the dining room, this place is great.  We started with drinks - I enjoyed a couple Ten and Tonics.  The service in the bar was prompt and courteous.  For appetizers, we ordered the Flemings Potatoes (starch, cheese, jalapenos) - what could be better?  We also tried some green bean and asparagus.  These didn't survive the trip around the table.  I skipped the salad and concentrated on my fillet and baked potato.  Other than one of the servers spilling my client's steak on the floor, the service was great.  I'll still give them five stars.  No sweat.  He was very apologetic and they turned around another steak very quickly.  Their creme brulee is awesome!!  If Fleming is on your list to try, don't wait.  Great food and atmosphere.

LwrP4pOkb7V_-SfjnXPRBg.text: Fleming's is at the top of the list when it comes to our favorite places for a perfect steak. My usual is the ribeye with Flemings potatoes and grilled asparagus for sides.  A must try if your looking for the best steak in town.

S6O8ouO2zZTJ81cJzmK5Tw.text: Went here for out 17 year Anniversary. Simply amazing!!! It is expensive. Our bill was about $300 with drinks, but their filet was the bar none the best steak I have eaten in AZ. I will be back soon. Highly recommend.

t7jhn90O9epoGd25kAqulQ.text: My family and I had dinner here last night for my birthday celebration.  We have been here many times and have always received excellent service and have never had a bad meal.  This time though the service was sub-par.  Our waiter was nice enough, but not very attentive.  Several times we were looking around wondering where he was.  This has NEVER happened to us here before.  When we were served our food, my son's girlfriend did not get her soup, so we had to ask for that.  We had ordered some mushrooms to go with out steaks, which also did not arrive and had to be asked for.  We also would liked to have ordered some wine or other cocktails, but our waiter was nowhere to be found.  When it was time for dessert, we were not offered coffee (although we could have asked for it when we ordered). After dessert was brought to us, we thought we might like some coffee, but our waiter wasn't around.  After we finished we waited for quite a long time and finally my husband had to find the manager to ask for our bill.  If this had been Sizzler or Outback Steakhouse this wouldn't have been such an issue, but this is Flemings.  It should have been awesome.  It wasn't.  This is the only time we have not had attentive service here, so we will likely give them another chance, but this was disappointing.  For a $600+ meal, we expect excellent service.

kFVPE6K0ONAWP3NA0mCktA.text: Flemings is awesome! all of the steak is great - sides are equally as great.  It is kind of fancy, can be expensive just bring money and enjoy!

_-BqnTB_G6zlEmgwWR3Eag.text: A group of 5 of us came here for dinner on a busy Saturday night. There was a huge party in the private area, so our entrees took a very long time. The staff did come over and let us know why the food was taking so long. I ordered the special that night which was sliced fillet over mashed potatoes and shrimp, it was amazing and worth the wait. I cant wait to go back and have more. The steak basically melted in your mouth, it was perfect. We had the chocolate lava cake for dessert and it was pretty damn amazing. Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States

0NFLFOCm7_fvnbLQfZ93lQ.text: We took friends to our favorite Fleming's location this past Thursday to celebrate the birthday of our neighbor and friend and all the meals were delicious!! They were very impressed! It was very, very busy and our waitress, Ze (not sure of the spelling of her name, sorry) was very attentive. We have been coming to this location since they opened and we met Chase when he started as a bartender, now manager and he has done a great job and greets everyone with a smile! The employees here are very good..we frequent this restaurant at least 3 times a month.

XvEOK4ZifTdrBwE7n6r-zA.text: What can I say perfection comes at a price and delivered here at Flemings.   This review is purely for the West side venue but I have been to all the Flemings around here now and all surpass expectations.   Very busy on Friday nights and I recommend booking tables which was easy with their website.  Steaks, fish &a seafood are cooked to perfection.  Side dishes range from the traditional to the adventurous with jalapeno mash and oven roasted Brussel sprouts.   Wine selection is huge and you can get a bottle from 30-$$$$ if you so wish!  This is the only place I have found Duvel beer served here in Phoenix.   Shout out to Randy for helping to arrange a surprise for our anniversary as well as making sure we were all taken care of throughout the night.   TIP: Costco members.  You can get $100 gift cards for $80 figure that's a 20% discount on the bill or the tip!.  Ideally figure $100 a head spending.   Get on their mailing list and they sent out $40 gift cards occasionally

hGaeJE5Ap_FIkt89dabDMg.text: If you go to a steak house please order a steak!  This steak house stays consistent with the quality of their beef and their sides.  The tomahawk steak is king here!  Talking about makes me want to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Tomahawk steak, 32oz beast!

cHsLUK1PDsyuDKnuF-jKpA.text: Service at bar and table we're excellent, however, where did you get your hostess? Do you intentionally hire people that hate their job? The hostess is the first person you meet when you come into an establishment and you expect to be greeted with a smile especially at a high end resteraunt. I have been there numerous times and the same blonde hostess looks like she hates her job and she is doing you a favor by getting you a table. Management needs to seriously check her attitude!

g_XNZ94z8QkYnjuHBJPfsQ.text: Great food and Great Service which is a fabulous combination.  Would recommend to anyone who wants a perfectly cooked, buttery tender steak. Located in the West Valley and also a convenient location for those attending an event at the State Farm Stadium which is close to the restaurant.

KEWjpt9QuafGu3HHOOgRrg.text: Was somehow accidentally thrown into a separate customer's huge Roaring 20's "Flapper" Costume Party- we had separate reservations and (long story short) the host messed up, putting my wife and I into this crowd of people, many of which bearing the title "Great Grandparents." It was one of those "old people" parties. I knew they were out there, I just never saw one before. It was awesome, I can't wait to do that when I'm older- and that's precisely the reason it was so awkward. We were clearly strangers in this huge group.  The Queen Bee of the group has huddled with some of her friends, they're gawking- pointing. Clearly confused on our being there.  Finally a busser comes by with water and chokes on the palpability of the awkwardness. He asks what the hell was wrong with us, and after realizing it was all just one big misunderstanding, tells us that we can move to another area. We ended up moving, and having one of the best meals we've ever had in our lives.   Fleming's cheese potatoes are one of the best things I've ever eaten and the steak was comparable to my amazing experience at DK's Steak House in Waikiki Beach. The service was incredible and it was all worth it.  Would definitely recommend for special anniversaries, important business meetings, and fans of Flapper costume parties.

5Lwnerkkyp8USDtyhM3j5w.text: Great service here, only issue was undercooking filet. When we asked for them to fix they should have made a new one. They however through it back on the grill. Not good for $50 piece of meat. They did end up not charging us but we had to say something. Server was pleasant however.

zWhTtzQUce2ik4jXyYrQBg.text: This steakhouse excellent. I believe it to be better than other steakhouses in its price range. Filet was incredibly good and cooked just right. The Brussels sprouts and bacon is good enough to bring me back - next time I will order two servings. The real key, though, was the service. Anticipated every need while remaining unobtrusive. Our waitress, Megan, was thoroughly knowledgeable of the menu. She turned a great dining experience into a top notch one.

XU4HsVwLH2139b8q2C8whA.text: My husband and I were here about a week ago with 3 other couples! Great food! Everything was tasty and had great presentation! The service was awesome. Each table has 2 to 3 servers & they are definitely on top of things. We had an appetizer called the Seafood Tower. Superb! The meals were equally amazing! We had the 3 course meal which was prime rib on a bed of mashed potatoes with a side dish, I got the Caesar salad. They do serve the side dishes family style, which I enjoy, cause then I get to taste a little bit of everything. The desserts are equally delicious! I had the creme brule' & it was so light and fluffy! My husband had the carrot cake but only had half cause he ate his whole meal but one negative, (which was small) was when the server took my husband's carrot cake to the back to pack it to go, he brought it back stuffed upside down in a round styrofoam container! Horrible presentation! I am not a fan of having any of my food removed from the table to be packaged in the back! I always ask for them to bring the container to me. I wanna know what & how my food was handled & by who! Overall it was a great dinner! Definitely going back soon! And maybe it'll be a 5 star review! ;)

FLnH5JU-NY0j7uI8_xGitw.text: Our visit was great. We enjoyed unrushed drinks in the bar and when we were ready they carried drinks to table.  We were celebrating birthdays and the complimentary dessert was a great touch.  Dinner was perfect only a slight disappointment from our dinner at Arrowhead Grille which was phenomenal and less $$. We will continue to be repeat customers.

D0F7TdCnu2K5ATcqekfOVg.text: I am basing this review on last nights food alone.  Other visits to Fleming's have been fabulous.  We went specifically for the Prime Rib.  The Prime Rib we received was nothing like those pictured in other reviews.  It was small, it was thin and had a significant amount of inedible fat.  To be honest with you it looked as though it had been warmed up, not fresh.  The only spice you could taste was Rosemary, no garlic, no salt, no pepper.  The Au Jus was also very bland and lacked flavor.  The French Onion soup, the Fleming's potatos, and the Creme Brulee dessert were delicious. We were there early, not sure if that would have played a part, but we were disappointed.  Will surely go back again, as I don't believe we have ever had a better Rib Eye anywhere.

ENPUEYuutD2s7EiHsRa0aw.text: Good for the value, overall. It's a good crowd for a Sunday but got in right the way with reservation. The kids like it - steaks and side dishes. Fancy place! Tips: it's about $50 per steak. A couple of sides to share, a bottle of wine...a good family bonding time later, you can do the math for four. Again, the kids gave it a kudos! I like the happy hour better. Smaller portion, twice the wine tasting, and triple the fun with friends. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Filet Mignon...It&#39;s rare! That&#39;s the only way!

-GTWgzRgnzhj7AjgV7_2YA.text: Food was good but the experience with service was unacceptable. I really do not have the time to list everything that we did not like service wise.  Hostess was friendly and we were seated promptly (we had reservations). Our server was very nice and friendly (that was not an issue) but the service overall was terrible.  May I add, even if our bill had been comp'd (which it was not) we would not come back to this place.  Just a sample: From the very first round of drinks, one person in our party did not get his drink, for a very long time.  For almost everything, we had to ask multiple times to different people, even the manager (or whoever goes from table to table asking about your experience, this includes drink refills, bread, bread spread, butter for the crab, the sauce they offered with the steak, etc). My husband had ordered the bernaise sauce and they forgot, he did not want to start eating until he got it, but it took so long that he gave up and had half his meal without it. Some of the stuff we got after asking several times, some of it we just stopped asking.  When we got the butter for the crab (again, after asking multiple times), they brought it in one of those containers with a warmer, but the warmer was not on.  I do not think I had been to Fleming's ever before, but we go to Ruth Chris' (Scottsdale) a few times a year and I was expecting a comparable experience. Service there has always been superb.

2-p0CCAb7S0X75gcvXk10Q.text: I was expecting more when I came here. We waited 20 minutes even after making a reservation. The server was friendly and gave us the Happy Anniversary card for the table. We got the shrimp appetizer. The horseradish was a blob on top so we had to mix it. My shrimp still had shell. It was ok. I got the lobster tails. They were rubbery. Once again, ok. We got the creamed spinach and it was runny, pretty much spinach artichoke dip minus the chips. The server was nice and took it off. The potatoes were sticky almost like boxed potatoes. My husband got the filet minon. It didn't melt in the mouth like it should being medium rare. We've had better at Durant's and Arrowhead Grill never disappoints with any of their steaks. The manager went to all the other tables around us and never once stopped by us. I dunno, maybe we didn't look "rich" enough lol. We wore nice jeans and nice tops. Definitely don't have to dress up to eat here. Other people said they got gift cards for their anniversary. Yeah not us. For 2 people we spent 250.00 which is what we expected but for the price it was not worth it. We will stick to Arrowhead Grill from now on.

IOk6f29KV8CTQBDnHhyghA.text: Definitely was very satisfied with the service and the food. Our cocktails for happy hour were served very promptly with the accompanying chips which were delicious. The burger was juicy and you could tell it was no ordinary burger. The house made burrata was a nice display of tomatoes, salad and bread. The bread was really the perfect texture (not to hard or soft). The sweet Thai chile calamari was superb! Overall very satisfied!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Happy hour cocktails
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Blueberry lemon drop
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Sweet chile calamari

azWkuwXcGOc685gr9wiZEw.text: Not to pleased with the quality of the steaks. They were dry and over cooked. Texture was like more like a sirloin. For over 40.00,should of been able to cut with a fork. Service was great

03Cfol44D2RmuA9zPESmIQ.text: Just to give you some perspective. I'm a family man with one child under 7 years of age two older kids in the work force and I'm in health care as a director of nursing but I still look for deals and quality... That being said Fleming's was an accidental booking for me when I felt the need to try something new with my family over the weekend ... We go out 2 x per month I would say because quality food is truly hard to find. So while at Fleming's I ordered the seafood tower because I'm tired of Red lobster being the main stay in AZ. I was beyond impressed with the freshness and quality of the presentation. I'm from Long Island  NY where seafood means something and this was as good if not better then the food I enjoyed in long island or Manhattan. We also had the Fleming potatoes.. all I can say is OMG!  There's nothing else to say folks.. please try them. My family had a simple filet mignon and again very very nice. The check was on the high end but it was worth the outing to say the least. If you need to impress someone or simply treat yourself look no further... It's not a place I would go to every weekend because of the high end bill but I truly never thought about the bill after the fact. I simply look forward to going back there very soon..

WOtgtdIjCvPHoGVnPWve2A.text: Well so much for their previous 4 star review. I Made reservations for Valentines day 2018 at, get this, 4 pm because by Jan 27th this was all that was available. We thought why not, early dinner and the evening to ourselves. Plenty of parking at 4 as well and we hoped the place wouldn't be packed. 21 open tables and they seated us basically in our own section! AWESOME!! We were rejoicing. Very quiet and private, BUT WAIT FOR IT.....Here comes the hostess with another couple and she parked them right next to us!! 21 OPEN TABLES!!!!!! I could smell the guys cologne better than my wife's perfume. He was not happy as well, as noted by the rolling of his eyes. There wasn't room in between our tables to fit a good sized waiter. I decided I would have a word with one of the "Operating Partners" what the ---- is that? He looked the situation over and asked if WE wanted to move. Are you serious? What are the people who just sat on our laps going to think if we up and move now that they showed up. Not well versed at his craft, he did nothing and said nothing to his hostess' as they kept bunching people up with plenty of open space, it continued for the next hour.  The food well that's different, always awesome no matter what we order, never a disappointment and the wait staff are top notch otherwise I'd have rendered 2 stars. I Decided to give Fleming's a very long break while I search for a better organized eating experience. Been here 5 times at least. This type of seating situation occurs an awful lot around the Phoenix area. I guess we're supposed to get to know our neighbors and sit close enough to eat off their plate.

PXcprT7O7HJoMfnVixgLFA.text: Absolutely fabulous.  We shared a prime rib with Fleming Potatoes and it was amazing.  We had the cheesecake for dessert and it was absolutely amazing.  The wine tablet will pair your meal, wish I knew that before ordering wine but no one pointed it out to us.  Other than that it is awesome.  Expensive, but awesome.

Cwu6dzM8vUAAx47HguShqg.text: We took our good friend Patti to Flemings for her birthday dinner.  We were seated immediately (love that!) and Patti was offered champagne on the house for her birthday.  She declined as she doesn't drink, but what a great policy! Makes me want to go there for my birthday.  I do drink so I ordered a cosmo and it was eh.  We all went for the filet mignon's with a side of creamed spinach.  Absolutely delish.  I was disappointed that the mousse I was so looking forward to wasn't on the menu, but made do with the molten chocolate lava cake which was only so-so.  Patti had the fresh berries with chantilly cream and loved it.  Flemings compted the dessert for the birthday girl.  The service was superb.  All in all a wonderful evening.

sXHlxsav_3J0AfZj7bJ_AA.text: The food was good but, for the price, there are a lot better steak houses.  For this price point, I would suggest Donovan's or Mastro's.

HsgcKceYeku5b8eBnPHZTg.text: Attended a private party but needed to leave early for a red eye flight.   Staff went out of their way to make sure I received my food in time to catch my flight.  I had the BBQ Salmon, it was prepared perfectly.  Next time I make my way back to Arizona I will be coming back.

evs09iQ7ucrOWeD4HzTp_w.text: My third Fleming's in three cities and it wasn't a disappointment.  Service was outstanding, and everyone in my group five loved it.  Ribeye was perfect M.R., and the Fleming's Potatoes (with cream, jalapenos and cheddar cheese) were amazing.  Definitely share them or you'll end up eating them all!  Grilled High Country Asparagus was excellent.  Wine list, and the waiter's knowledge, was impressive.  He suggested a full body Pinot, Cambria, that was on the mark.

XeaQUV5wT3GZXb4f5nVPnA.text: Absolutely AWFUL Experience.  A group of us went out for a nice dinner.  First we waited an hour after being seated for our food.  When I received my Cesar Salad it had no dressing, no croutons.  The Braised Shortribs HAD A STICKER ON IT THAT SAID MADE IN CHINA!!!  I told the waitress who said I would get a new plate.  It came back with an inch cut off the rib, and reheated.  And I was charged the full amount and a very lame Sorry. If our group had not been in a hurry, because it took so long I would have complained to the Management.  As it was I paid the bill and left.  Absolutely ridiculous treatment and quality from an expensive restaurant.

xnYSJKnghrHKvZQdOYnOvw.text: Highly recommend for perfectly savory meal..your taste buds will thank you!!! We ordered the split chicken ( can easily share), asparagus, baked potato,salad, and the bread with outstanding brie butter. Everything was superb!! It is a bit pricey but well worth it!!

H5n7LSPYe9uw9yhhIw6s-A.text: enjoyed the food and atmosphere - friendly staff - located close to the arena and football stadium - right off the highway easy access -

jmigHDSI632zxIpvl4ZXRA.text: Easter brunch was nice, but NOT near as good.  I will go there, but not for Holiday Brunches...not for the price.  It wasn't bad at all, but not great.

Vp1jSK5PgAqEbCBrBQxXYA.text: Quality of food is top notch, service is always great.  Yes, it is a little spendy, but you get what you pay for.  If you want great food cooked perfectly this is your place.  Ambience is nice as well...

Y7k-A_Bj_SYT2CDGK72Rsg.text: My boyfriend and I have eaten at Flemings many times and a couple times at this specific location. This location has always been decent but we have still slightly preferred the Scottsdale area however we both live close to this Glendale location. We were in shock with our visit this past Friday. When you think Flemings- you think classy and high end- unfortunately, this time around, that perception was gone right away as we walked in the door and saw how the hostess was dressed. First impression is everything and we walked in and she was wearing a very tight, very short leopard dress or skirt with very revealing cleavage. We thought for sure her dress was going to ride up as she walked us to our table. Very inappropriate and not up to Flemings standards in our opinion. As far as the food goes, last time we were in, everything was fabulous, the steak couldnt have been cooked better. This time, that was not the case. The steaks came out much smaller than they usually do, kind of rubbery on the edges and very under cooked (they took care of the under cooked steaks immediately) Over all- Flemings is fantastic- we were just very disappointed this time around. When paying that much money- you want everything to be great from start to end. We will still come back- we just hope next time the staff and food is up to par.

U49DYcnzu06T2gPcT1u58A.text: Was looking for a nice dinner place in Peoria to send my mom and step-dad for a birthday celebration.  The people at Flemings were wonderful.  They took my request over the phone and made sure they had a lovely evening.  Mom raved about the service and the photos she sent made the food look fantastic!

-uCajIy6S7ljeYfCrkrhLQ.text: Great wines by the glass and the new management has made this the stop on the west side.  Excellent happy hour and great staff.

WJHC6B01cxwkvXnLfU-riQ.text: Best steak I ever had. And great service. Oh and I grew up in Montana so I know my steak!

6P8ebTM9DnvPDmCOlsKDfg.text: At all Fleming's the food is good, but not exceptional.  For the money, Mastro's and Eddie V's are much better choices.  We were in the area at the time and this Fleming's seemed to be the best restaurant in the vicinity.  We both ordered the French onion soup to start.  i tried about 4 spoonfuls and found it to be so salty that I asked the waiter to take away.  Given that it hadn't been very long since we received the soup and the bowl was still pretty full, I would have expected the waiter to ask whether or not there was a problem.  But no.  Finally, I informed him that it was way too salty.  His response? "Oh?" No "I'm sorry", "Can I get you something else?", "I'll let the kitchen know.".  Nothing but "Oh?"  Since their steak portions are usually too big for me to finish, I decided to try their braised short ribs.  It was so dry that I asked for more au jus, but that didn't help it.  My husband said, "Wow that's really bad! Don't eat it." He ended up giving me some of his steak, so I wouldn't starve.  What was the  waiters response this time?  The same.  No offer to deduct the soup or offer a complimentary dessert.  Nothing.  We've been to other Fleming's around the Valley as well as one in Chicago and have never had such a bad experience.  Hopefully, this is isolated to just this particular Fleming's.

OEMVGvbkpdNQy69ZJfMw5g.text: A little pricey but the steaks are wonderful and the service top shelf. My filet was cooked perfect and the wine list is exceptional. This is my favorite place to eat steak in town but can only afford it on special occasions especially if I want a few sides which are priced extra.

4XS1ZjlHhiqFWAHu9-RjfA.text: We took our dad for Father's day. We had a great dinner. The steak were delicious, juicy, cook correctly. My dad had the prime rib specials which he loved by the way. Our server was friendly, clean and they work in team he had his very own helper which was great . My sister steak was just a little under cook for her, they took it and corrected it right away. After the end of dinner the manager came to our tables to see how was everything then gave dad a gift certificate for $25 a gift for dad. What a great idea. Great touch Fleming . We will be back .

_7U3LhWGm7r40VTUXbbdUg.text: I love this place-food is wonderful, however..........tonight my hubby&I sat in on a seminar by Stuart Spivak on financial planning and one of the servers "rubbed me the wrong way". Idk maybe he was trying to be cute or funny but someone at our table asked what the salad dressing was for the wedge and he says " uh blue cheese?" in a question kind of  way as if "duhh" - then when my hubby asked for Italian instead of his "blue cheese" he said in a sing songy kind of way, "oooookkkkkaaayy" as if we were being too particular. This guy was about 40 I guess, short, with glasses. It seemed like he had been employed longer and knew the ropes more than the gal (Charity) or the Spanish guy. Did not care for his attitude at all! It was almost as if he thought we were getting a free meal why should we get it exactly like we want??!! Charity (I asked her name)/ on the other hand was most gracious, most of the time "silent service" was very professional. She went to get us go-boxes for what we couldn't eat, kept our water&tea glasses full, and gave NO attitude at all! Didn't expect to need any cash for tonight! Otherwise I would have tipped her!!! not him-the food WAS fabulous! The surf and turf was served and I had the double chicken breast. The brulee for dessert was wonderful too! However, when we speak to Stuart again we may comment on this experience.

b7lk2fr4RC0x2TkpCt-UlQ.text: My friend invited me to his company dinner and I was very excited to eat here. We were seated in the private room and had a couple of drinks and snacked on the complimentary bread before we placed our order. The bread was good and they served it with butter and an herb spread. We started out with calamari and oysters. The calamari was a little too rubbery for my liking and the sauce they served it with was just okay it tasted like sweet and sour. I don't eat oysters but my friend said they were fresh. For my main course I ordered halibut with shiitake mushrooms with creamed spinach. I wanted to order the chipotle macaroni and cheese and mashed potatoes but I didn't want to get too carried away. Luckily the couple next to us ordered those sides and shared it with me. The macaroni was to die for and the potatoes were really good they topped it off with a parmesan peppercorn butter. The service was great and the food was excellent its worth the price even though I didn't have to pay!

baPdFHLasS0OK1RuSLF-Kw.text: We have eaten at this Fleming's location about five times, and every time is has been wonderful.  The most recent, I took my Mom out for her birthday here.  The server (Daniel) is probably the best one in the place, very friendly, knowledgeable, helpful, etc.  His service made up for my steak being over cooked (for the first time ever), also the meat is so perfect, it can take the beating.  I like my steak medium (their Filet is the best I have ever had), and it was probably a minute of two over that, so it wasn't ruined at all, just not exactly the way I like it.  I refused to complain.  My Mom had the seafood bisque (recommended by Dan), it was mind blowing, she couldn't fight me off it :)!  Their creme brulee is the best I have ever had as well.  I just wish they had an original potato al gratin, instead of a southwestern one.  I adore the crab cakes, and get them every time I go.  The drinks from the bar are always perfect (Mojitos and Margaritas are what I get).  We love this place!

NaDQDf-SRZAJd2sIVCNZKw.text: This was one of the best places we've been since coming back to Arizona from Kansas. We just did happy hour, and it was amazing! Matt the bartender was awesome and everyone that worked there acknowledge us and was very nice. It was a bit expensive however I'd recommend this to anyone! You truly get more than you pay for. Can't wait to do happy hour again here!

id8H26vTgjXgHEjedynAhA.text: We came to Fleming's for my parents 50th wedding anniversary. The service was wonderful. The staff went out of there way to make us feel special. The food was very very good. The butter for the bread was heavenly. My parents had a special night.

ytqarJBO6FuQeYgmv_1lPQ.text: The service was fantastic at Fleming's and the food is prepared in an artful and creative way.  The dining room is elegant, relaxing and enjoyable.  I like the attention and service provided at the restaurant.  I ordered clam chowder soup, Flemings salad and the barbecue Scottish salmon fillet with creamed spinach and spicy Thai green beans.  I like the bread and spreads they bring out.  I thought the meal was prepared nicely and the salmon was cooked to perfection.  I have had the steaks at Fleming's in the past and enjoyed those too.  I was just feeling like some seafood during this visit.  I will mention that Fleming's is extremely expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Scottish Salmon, Creamed Spinach, Spicy Thai Green Beans
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Clam Chowder
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Fleming&#39;s Salad

zLGnbz7pztMx8W8ixpP0dA.text: Went here after my wife received here U.S. Citizenship. It's a great place for special events. I am sure it will be our "Special Event" place for a very long time. However, I was told that night that they are an upscale franchis of the Outback chain and I could not get that out of my head, because they are pricey and the wine, though really good, is more BevMo selection than Wine Spectator, if you can understand what I mean? but still, great (almost over-attentive) service, they take part in sharing the emotion of your special event and do little things to make the night a great memory. Try them!!

7IJWq-wAvJH4JFp8JvTpvg.text: Happy New Year!!! Goodbye 2013!!!  I came here for the last 30 minutes of 2013 to do a champagne toast with my date, brother, and friends. I am glad I made the trip to this very exquisite establishment. Very elegant and ritzy feel here. Now I see why Fleming's is held on such a high pedestal for so many. The place is amazing for the simple fact that you feel important and worthy while you're within their walls. Cool way to welcome the new year!  We did not have anything off the food menu. Only came to do a champagne toast and left once the ball dropped.  I cannot wait to come visit this fine dinning place again!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Happy New Years Toasting!!

WvfulgXG4J6aHp1beBAbMw.text: Made reservations on open table.  Lost trac of time and we're going to be about 5-10 min late.  I called them and they were so nice and told me not to worry. We were seated right away when we arrived. Our server, Arthur Leary, was a seasoned waiter who thoroughly enjoys his trade and proves it with his eye contact and attention for details.  My wife and I split the NY Prime Strip, not the aged one.  It was done perfectly.  We had a baked potato and charred Brussels sprouts.  All excellent.  After hearing Gordon Ramsey likes Molton Lava Cake for dessert, we had to split that one too.  So good.(see photo which did not include the bowl of fresh whipped cream).  Complimentary valet parking was a breeze.  It was pretty cold in the Restaurant, and we were glad we brought our jackets. No hassle or charge for splitting everything for us.  Dinner W/O alcohol, 20% tip and $3.00 for the parking it came to ~$130.00 for dinner.  Money well spent!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States

JRvUS3HL-Bq2wMT0S3HSmw.text: We just moved to AZ three months ago and I heard that Flemings was the best restaurant in the West Valley. We decided to try it out for my husband's birthday and needless to say we were quite disappointed.  The food was marginal, the prices were exorbitant and shockingly they did absolutely nothing special for his birthday. I had heard that other locations they give desert or discounts for the number of years you're celebrating. We got absolutely nothing. even low end restaurants acknowledge special occasions and I would expect a well-known Steakhouse to do the same or something even more special. They did not provide us with any reason to refer them to friends or even to go back.

aDRtOy5FsnvKltmli5Wf8g.text: OMG!!! Totally impressive, top notch all the way. We went there for our 30th Anniversary and were treated like King and Queen. Over the top service, Charles was Spectacular, even the Management came by our table with a special Gift, totally unexpected. They even gave us a Card signed by all the Staff. Will definitely be back. We have never had such Top Notch/ awesome service and when we were done there was a Taxi waiting as requested for the ride home.

9z18FSzm6MiUdjPJBtH5zg.text: Some if the best quality steaks you can find in the Phoenix area. The decor is classy and still laid back. Great location in the west valley, no longer do I have to venture too far to get a quality steak.  And the fact that you get a gift card w your meal towards a future purchase is always a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States

O31tFbcXF3EMaJnWiTm6GA.text: My dinner was described as two large prawns and a 6 oz. fillet on a bed of risotto.  It was delicious and also had baby beets and the risotto had bits of vegetables.   Even though they said the fillet would be sliced, I don't like my meat sliced at the price I paid.  My husband's strip steak was sliced also, and he said it was rather grisely and tough.  All the side dishes were delicious.  Our friend's fillet was undercooked.  Service was fantastic.   All in all, it was less than what I expected from Flemings.

NcHsF-aUyGKraECMhapplg.text: Make your reservation well in advance...consistently good service and high quality food & drink.

BoZzP-ZkLrXqXSk8Rlss3A.text: Absolutely one of the best experiences I've ever had at a restaurant. I took my family there to celebrate my mom's birthday, and from the very beginning, everything was amazing. The waiter, Steve, was the sweetest and super helpful. Then we had several employees come by to wish my mom a happy birthday, including giving her a card, a box of chocolates and a gift card. She felt very special and enjoyed the unexpected surprises. Then the food...oh my gosh it was all amazing! I'm a big ribeye person, and it was the best ribeye I've ever had, accompanied with the Fleming's potatoes. The desserts, the chocolate lava cake and the creme brulee, we attacked by everyone and devoured within minutes. Thank you so much for making this experience the absolute best. We plan to celebrate all of our special occasions here.

Z9cMLyLHcRvsnB2RqxGm4A.text: How unfortunate. The food was stellar. The service, not so much. We went on September 15th for drinks and light fare. We had never sat in the bar area before.  The bar was packed, the dining room almost empty. To note, I am not used to being treated like a second class citizen.   Nonetheless this is how we were handled from check in with the hostesses (no smile and an attitude- not surprising for most 18-year-olds, but surprising it is allowed in a restaurant such as Flemings) to checkout.  They had opened dining tables as the bar was full but limited choices. Staff acted as if we were inconveniencing them when I inquired if there was another seating possibility as my friend has back issues.  It took her several minutes (leaving us standing in the middle of the dining room amidst strong dining waiting to see if there were other tables) before she returned and said no.   As we watched the dining room, it was apparent staff was being gracious and accommodating with the majority of the patrons, just as we have experienced every single time we've ever come here.  It was highly embarrassing as I had brought a friend you would never been to Flemings and I had been raving about how great it was. Unfortunately this was not her experience. In fact we never ordered dinner after the four appetizers and drinks and left.   Every other time we have dined here, the manager generally walks the room and asks if everything is agreeable, the manager was walking throughout the restaurant but he looked very serious and not exactly happy. He never came to our table nor did I see him go to any other tables to check on their experience. I missed this little bit which we had become accustomed to.  Our female waitress which started the evening, was not very friendly.  I pointed out a dead black bug on our table when we were seated, she just wiped it off the table. No change of the linens, no manager, just swept it off the table.  However in the middle of our experience, she left and a young man took over who was much more friendly (unfortunately we were already leaving at that point.) Flemings get it together with your staffing. I've never had such deplorable service while being charged hundreds for a meal.  Disheartening.

JoncQDqONBJLK_1LuRoOUw.text: A huge thank you for the excellent service we received. My father has some memory issues and is easily confused. Our server, seeing how we'd been interacting with my dad all evening, chose to walk him to the restroom when my dad asked where it was rather than simply pointing to it.   Three of us  had the filet specials, and the steaks were perfectly cooked. My mother didn't realize there was a sauce on it, and they quickly replaced her steak for her. My dad had the short rib small plate, which was the favorite item of the night. We also loved the calamari appetizer with the sweet and sour glaze with pepperoncinis.

v8NFyj7d0T-yprlvER5tng.text: Wonderful atmosphere and ambiance! The service is amazing and the filet mignon was the absolute best piece of meat i have had to date! Definitely more on the pricey side but worth every cent! A must try for fine dining!

VbAngq99RB85neOIDnBTng.text: I took my parents here for their 47th wedding anniversary. This restaurant is supremely elegant and the food was spectacular! The price is outrageous but worth it for special occasions. I would recommend this to family and friends.

CSlHSoc_oS6-6kf8HyuB6A.text: When you walk in the ambiance looks great however after sitting down that's where the greatness ends.  Service was mediocre. The ravioli app was under cooked. The steak (medium) was way closer to rare, flavors were just okay. With the prices being that high it should be much better. For my money Durant's    is a finer dinning experience.

W1lAOLfuwE_3xJ6cnRf42g.text: I have now been to Flemings in Peoria twice. The first time,  it was massively busy. But we were seated quickly and had the full attention of our server, Trent, in about a minute.   Our server, as with the bussers, the other waiters, etc. were all attentive, polite,  and fast.  As it was a holiday,  I was pleasantly surprised by the amount of attention we received.  Trent was fantastic,  attentive,  and fun, as was warranted by our manner. However,  I never judge a restaurant by the first visit.   So, I went back tonight.   We were seated in a different area and had Rachel as our server. She was very good.  Fast, attentive,  and responsive, and again nearly everyone who passed our table checked on us.  It was another busy night,  but at no time did I feel rushed.  I was able to take my time and delight in the complete meal.   The meal was delightful.  The wine selection was superb. The price was reasonable for a higher end meal.  I can recommend Flemings without hesitation.  A fine experience that I am glad I had.

RnYDFcbe-gTru5rB26BJCw.text: Would have liked to rate this better.  But they closed before the closing time, and as I pulled the door for my wife, I discovered it was locked.  Someone looked at me through the door, turned and walked away.  Not even a "we're closed", probably because they knew it was before 10:30.  This was on June 26.  So we didn't have an opportunity to eat there.  And it's unlikely we'll come back.  Actually, I'm quite sure we won't.  So we made the best of it and went next door to BJ's, and had a fantastic dinner there.   Granted, it was our anniversary and we were eating deep dish pizza, but we've been together long enough to roll with it and our waiters there was fantastic, personable and offered great suggestions.  I'm sure the West Valley will have more steakhouses soon, and we'll try those out as they arrive.    Really poor show, Flemings.

lRHtjwXyHVQtCPbBqRPL_Q.text: Flemings has a great Happy Hour. The wine is good, the burgers are great and the prices are reasonable. But, it is packed. Get there by 5pm if you want to sit down. Have not been there for dinner yet,  I am sure it is very good as it does look like a lot of high end steakhouses I have been to in the past. But, for now, I will give it a 4+ star for Happy Hour.

MkXajRwydYgHgiG2HW5PKw.text: Came here for a date night and it was a great experience. Waitress was top tier in customer service. Food was really good.  We came on a holiday which is discounted, I understand that is also the case on sunday - for prime rib. For a special night, it's a good time.

e6QBE8i_h-TpHeq3fB9Qrw.text: We come here often - in my opinion not often enough - and every-time they make the visit special. We have had the same server on the last 2 visits. Rachel is absolutely fantastic  - Fast, attentive, and responsive. She even remembered us from our last visit. We will be requesting her from now on.  The meals are awesome, steaks cooked exactly like you want. On an "over the top" experience during one visit - they do not carry celery in the kitchen, and my wife ordered a Bloody Mary with celery. Rather than say no, they went to a neighboring restaurant and picked up some celery. That was an exceptional "be our guest" experience, and they continue to WOW us every-time.

ul80NTCwZWFGwncpeYWJjw.text: Came out to celebrate my significant others birthday and Arizona Restaurant Week.  Service was excellent and the food perfectly cooked.  Will definitely be back soon!

Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Great dinner out with the lady.  Will be back soon.

QKFO3F6odTnuIM6j9fUvOg.text: We started with the Valentine's Day cocktail. It featured strawberries and basil and was so yummy, even though I can't remember anything else that was comprised of. For appetizers we had the chili calamari and the crab cakes. Both could have had a bit more crispy-ness to them. The crab cakes were a bit soggy for my taste. The calamari was good despite the lack of crunch and I really enjoyed the variety of bell peppers in the dish. I had the wedge salad which was fantastic. Nice plump tomatoes, crisp iceberg lettuce, thick bacon and Chunky bites of blue cheese. I had the lobster and my partner had the Ny Strip. We shared a side of Brussel sprouts. The Brussels were absolutely delicious! The strip was like butter. Melted in my mouth. The lobster was good. A tad over cooked though I'd Say. We skipped dessert as we have a Valentine's Day cake from San Francisco via Whole Foods at home. All in all Everything was wonderful. Pricey, But would probably Return.

Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Valentines cocktail I&#39;ve forgotten what was in it, but it was very good

RTgluMV6jkFxfHiEOwrSSw.text: We checked out dining in the bar tonight. I had the mushroom farro burger. It comes with arugula, tomato and goat cheese on a pretzel bun. A jalapeno aeioli sauce was delicious and served on the side. I chose onion rings as my side. The onion rings were outstanding.  My spouse had the cheddar, pepper bacon burger with fries. There was pepper on the bacon. He will try the California burger next time.

1Ulfg9g5jKFrmhV4gDz6Rw.text: Hubby brought me here for an early Mother's Day dinner. Sure it helped that we had a $50 coupon, as it is kind of pricey, but it's a nice place to go for special occasions. We decided to splurge and start off with the chilled seafood tower. I seriously could have just made that my entire meal and been happy as a clam! It contained four jumbo prawns, two lobster tails, two crab legs, and a bowl of ahi tuna with avocado and wonton chips. Hubby really enjoyed the light citrus sauce on the ahi tuna and I really enjoyed the side of mustard sauce with the crab. They also start you off with a loaf of fresh bread and two different spreads. One tasted like a salmon and the other (which was my favorite) was Brie with champagne. For my entree I chose the Miso Glazed Sea Bass and it was exquisite. It was served on a bed of wilted spinach and garnished with pickled onions. Hubby chose the ribeye and he enjoyed it immensely. Both of our entrees were cooked perfectly and we had no complaints. For our size we chose the Flemings potatoes and the brussels sprouts with bacon. The Flemings potatoes were really good and reminded us of au gratin potatoes with a slight hint of jalapenos. The brussels sprouts were braised perfectly and finished with a balsamic glaze. The crispy bits of bacon really finished them nicely. Our waitress was very kind and attentive and we left fully satisfied with leftovers for the next night!
