Xw1R9hxocDOHGX1w073eWQ.text: "No, you can't sit there. We have a wait list for the bar."  "Ok, no problem."  15 minutes later... "Hey, I just want to check in and make sure you know we are waiting for a table in the bar area."  "Yes, we have you listed right here."  25 minutes later:  "Umm.... we've been here for 25 minutes; why have you seated all of these other couples before us?"  "Ummm...hold on....oops... we will seat you next."  5 minutes later, at our table in the bar area:  "I'm the manager and would like to give you an appetizer for your wait and troubles."  At least they made up for the incompetence of the host staff. Overall the food was good and the evening was good.

utXt1TDyuHRqmfiOW8OGLw.text: We recently had an enjoyable experience dining at this Peoria steakhouse, and thought the impeccable service and ambiance was worth another future visit. We arrived before dinnertime and were seated immediately. The restaurant's layout consisted of a sizable patio for outdoor dining, and a dim-lit interior with full bar, small candles, thick white tablecloths, and a cozy dark wooden decor.   The Colossal Shrimp Cocktail ($20.95) was a wonderful starter. The shrimps were humongous, fresh, and meaty, with a memorable texture. The horseradish-cocktail sauce was balanced, smooth, and refined. It was addictive. I could eat these all day long.  The 12-ounce Main Filet Mignon ($49.95) with Truffle Poached Lobster ($13.95) arrived with a thick cut filet mignon cooked to rare. The steak was easy to cut into, but the center was still a bit raw and cold. The caviars were marvelous, but the lobster appeared smaller than the shrimp cocktail. I wished I had ordered something else besides the lobster. It was not worth the add-on.  The Barbecue Salmon ($39.95) came with sizable filets of New Zealand salmon and our choice of Sauteed Mushrooms ($11.95) on the side. The salmon was very tender and tasty, accompanied by the hint of black pepper, sweet barbeque glaze, and textured earthy beech mushrooms. Moreover, the Sauteed Mushrooms had varied tender textures that came with a nice chew. The natural earthy flavors were incredible. I would definitely order the mushrooms again.  The Chocolate Lava Cake ($14.50) was made with a chocolate cake, hot molten center of Belgian chocolate, vanilla ice cream, and chopped pistachios. The chocolate cake was good, but I thought the use of ice cream could be more creative. The warm lava could be darker with a hint of bitterness, but the chopped pistachio was a good difference maker. I had higher expectations for their dessert, and would likely go with the Carrot Cake on the next visit.   Service was attentive, incredibly warm, and knowledgeable. Our server refilled our warm basket of bread on several occasions, and the side of Brie butter and Parmesan peppercorn butter were truly outstanding. I usually don't use butter on warm bread, but these were so worthwhile and addictive. Overall, interested diners can expect a wonderful dining environment, decent food, and very attentive and knowledgeable service. I would be interested in returning to try the Chilled Seafood Tower, Bone-in Mignon, Mac & Cheese, and the Carrot Cake with dark rum caramel.

TDNXu9m0hfQS0bIMY4CZrg.text: Took family here for Thanksgiving.  The restaurant was full, but we were seated and served promptly and courteously.  The turkey dinner was superb.  The only item that was somewhat below par was the stuffing.  It was served in a block, more like a quiche.  The turkey, I had dark and white meat, was succulent and tastily garnished with gravy and cranberry, orange and cinnamon sauce.  The sweet potatoes were creamy and delicious. The pumpkin cheesecake was the perfect sweet finish for our holiday meal.

rwjeap-Ohhv4lBgCUQMy9w.text: I joined a group of 7 for a Mother's day brunch celebration yesterday.  We arrived at the appointed time, 1:15 reservation.  It was a fixed price menu, $47.00 for three courses.  I was really looking forward to a nice meal.  They start with biscuits that come with butter and honey.  The biscuits were stale.    Everyone enjoyed the first course, salad, soup or burrata, all tasty and fresh.  They offered several versions of eggs Benedict so I tried the one with crab cakes.  Underwhelmed...the poached eggs were virtually raw, more like coddled.  By the time someone came to ask we were halfway through our meal.  I asked for some scrambled eggs with veggies instead and the waitress was happy to oblige.  They discounted my meal to 16.95.  Others in my party enjoyed their food, the sides were great.  Desserts were ok.  Overall, it was just ok.

vRIdtE_Q8hvEaT7dwuibwA.text: I generally don't like franchises but Flemings is one of my favorite steak houses in Phoenix. The menu is pretty standard for a steakhouse. Generally get the calamari which is excellent. The bone in filet is tender and the meat is delicious. My steaks are always cooked the way I order them. The staff at my last visit was attentive and very friendly. Sides are quite large and can be shared with two or three people.  Def my goto steak house when I'm in the mood for some red meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Bone in filet

eW4EQDHIo1H5Eho8MKd4yg.text: I came here to Fleming's to take my best friend and her parents out for a thank you dinner. I've only heard of Fleming's but had never dined in for dinner. I decided to try this steakhouse out being that it was within close distance to the house.   I made reservations for 4 for 6:30. We were running a few minutes behind so I called and asked to change the reservation to 7:00, the lady said it was okay.   We arrived around 6:40. The hostesse(s) said it would be closer to 7:00 for seating. I don't know how they managed to fill our table within 10 minutes but it was fine. One of the hostess came and told us there was a booth seating available but it was next to the bar. We went to sit and decided it wasn't what we wanted. I asked how long for our normal table and she said it would be at 7:00, again that was fine even though I didn't understand why the long wait.   We were deciding on a bottle of wine to chose from. Our server was anything but helpful. He was more trying to up sell me. That was an instant turn off for me towards the service and restaurant. My best friends mom likes red Zinfandel. I asked what varieties they had. Our server pointed out one red Zinfandel but insisted we wouldn't like it and said he believes we would like these other two different kinds of wine instead and insisted on bringing those two instead. I was very irritated and insisted he bring the one I asked for, also. You can tell he was very hesitant and irritated but he brought it.   I had my best friends mom do the wine tasting. Like I figured, she enjoyed the red Zinfandel instead of the other two selections of different wine that he insisted on.   Upon ordering it seemed as if he hadn't even tried any of the entrees and again was trying to up sell us. My best friends mom asked about one of the small plates, he instantly suggested about getting the steak instead of telling her how the small plate choice she asked about was.   3 of us decided to go with the 6oz filet minion and my best friend decided on the double chicken breast. I ordered all of us the side of lobster and we also had the shareable sides of asparagus, sauteed mushrooms, and mashed potatoes. We also ordered mussels for our appetizers.   Our dinner was delicious and cooked perfectly. I can't complain about the food. We also ordered another bottle of wine and had creme brulee for dessert.   There were different servers coming out bringing our plates but none of them asked how everything was or if we needed anything. The plates were extremely hot, too hot honestly, that my best friends mom burned her hand and she had to cool it off with the ice water. They didn't even apologize for that. Also, my wine glass had a bug in it. I told our server and he inspected the glass hesitantly and didn't even apologize for that either.   You would think after spending hundreds and hundreds of dollars you would get 5 star service but that wasn't the case here. I guess if you want 5 star service, it's best to go to a 5 star steakhouse which this place was clearly not. If you're willing to spend hundreds of dollars and want good service, go elsewhere! Very disappointed in the service. Mastro's it is next time!

Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States

_h8pGoW1dwopgco9iJmewA.text: Ate dinner here the other night. Made reservations and we were sat with perfect timing. It's was slower at first but as our dinner went on the place picked up. Early dinner shouldn't be a problem without reservations but looking for prime time, plan ahead. I was able to book same day on OpenTable. Food was good, the filet was cooked to perfection and melted in my mouth. Crab cakes were tasty and loved the mushrooms. The husband was obsessed with the butter that was a great pairing with the bread. Where the 3 stars comes in was more the service. The waiter was nice enough but for a $200+ meal I expect excellent. Over all atmosphere could use some desire. For west valley I'd recommend Arrowhead Grill over Fleming's and to make the drive Mastro's City Hall a better option.

rlHRBLt4EyZir_mn_H3z-A.text: We were a party of four and had an amazing experience here. We made reservations on open table for 7 pm but arrived 30 mins early. Manager accommodated us early despite the place being packed. Food is definitely shareable as the portions are huge. We started with the lobster bisque soup (one serving plenty for 2 people) followed by had the bone in ribeye with shrimp diablo over the top, with shareable sides (family style) of lobster Mac, carrots, and Fleming's potatoes. Our waiter, Tommy, was awesome and patient answering all our questions and making great recommendations when asked. The steak was cooked to perfection. The sides were awesome. Specialty drinks very good and great wine selection. For dessert we tried the seasonal pumpkin cheesecake and creme brulee. Both were awesome although I prefer my brulee warm and this was not. We will definitely return.

9BulLdR2q4JKUwS5bz-duA.text: Great reverse happy hour. They have a great selection of burgers and a great bar atmosphere for a night out. The main side is very fancy, I like the bar side.

2VVdg349s4ij68KO8NQmpA.text: First time at Fleming after trying the majority of the Steakhouses in phx/Scottsdale. I brought my wife here for her birthday and must say their attention to detail is incredible. The steaks were a 4/5 I would still say A Different Pointe of View at the Tapatio Cliffs is a better steak. However, the steak was still very good. Service was overall outstanding with multiple ppl stopping by to assist with dinner flowing smoothly. Our main server was very dry and didn't show any personality at all. She also didn't seem to have much knowledge about wine whatsoever which is a little shocking at a place like this. The lobster tail was par for the course and nothing spetacular.   The ambience is pretty perfect for a romantic dinner with that special someone. They brought my wife complimentary truffles for her Birthday and they were delicious! They made sure to wish her a Happy Birthday numerous times and even provided her a gift card for a return trip. Overall a very good and worthwhile experience. If the steak was a touch better and the main server more personable the 5 stars would have been an easy decision.

_cYhWIXe3l9fIefnzF07cQ.text: My husband and I went in my birthday... great customer service all around. My food was very delicious and my husband loved every bite of his steak. Even though this was our first time, it won't be our last. I really enjoyed my birthday experience.  They gave a small private  celebration with out the silly shouting and a four cake present. She even took our pictures.

nKAWQ75b7EYa202ilm-HZQ.text: Service was great! Food was great! Our waiter was friendly and humorous! Our glasses were never empty and the food was just right!

mVpRKT1VWRSf3fTZvKFWDQ.text: We have been here many times to celebrate birthdays, anniversaries, Christmas work parties, etc. Last night I was celebrating five years of being cancer free and Ivan, our waiter, made sure the night went super smoothly. The food and drinks were delicious as always and I felt they took extra care of us knowing the milestone we were celebrating. Couldn't have asked for a better way to celebrate. Thank you, Flemings Peoria and Ivan!

qKG7F0kBOF1bdLoe-Jzv4w.text: I received a gift-card for Christmas and didn't know much about this restaurant but assumed it to be like any other steakhouse.  I was absolutely completely wrong!  i was out of state in Arizona visiting my Girlfriend and we decided to have a date-night and check for locations, and to our surprise there was one in Arizona.  I would say everything about this location was just "On Point".  Everything from the dinner, to the host, to the customer service.  The ambiance was upscale, no kids, and fine dining all the way.  The portions were very appropriate, the steak was delicious, lobster was amazing, and the cheesecake was superb!    It is pricey, but for a well and fine dining out this is well worth the price.  Again, it is fine dining so please leave your kids at home and bring your manners.

ckWcDsn7veeCuKlTgwjsnQ.text: This place is fantastic.  I came expecting an average steakhouse in the Glendale/Peoria area.  The bartender was fantastic and made a tremendous Negroni (not the one on their menu, which isn't actually a negroni at all).  The Caesar salad was very tasty and the small plate sliced filet was the most perfectly balanced and seasoned dish I can remember eating in recent memory.  There was so much going on in that dish - but everything was balanced and picture perfect.  I can't recommend this place enough.

Lop1HwqdiPzL_XoxsPFn-Q.text: I treated myself to their seasonal selection and each item was fabulous from the lobster ravioli with caviar to the straws steak. The only thing missing was favorite person to spend my birthday with tonight.

qJEhpja0LjvDO3IX_E5xrA.text: My god thats a good restaurant.  Went there yesterday to celebrate my gf bday. We had the sunday spacial. Prime ryb, mash potatoes. Ceasur salad. And laba cake. Dishes are bog. Service is extra ordinare. And food taste divine. You can tell the chef is a stakes expert. Highly recomended!!!!!

Ghjvh3_GGWutP4dpaSA7ZQ.text: Creme de la creme experience!  The 5 for $6 happy hour at the bar is nothing short of fantastic.  What does 5 for $6 exactly mean?  As I found out, it means they have 5 options of food or drinks for $6 each.  Happy hour ends at 7pm.  The drinks and food are superb.  I tried the burger and brie puff and they were very tasty and filling.  The service was also exemplary.  I am an instant fan of Fleming's and will be a return customer.

aTE6ov5J_bSGiS0b-agXEg.text: I have been wanting to try Flemings for awhile, so when a group of friends suggested the restaurant for Arizona restaurant week, I decided to jump on that chance. We made a reservation for 11, and were not seated too long after our reservation time. We were greeted by the server within minutes of sitting down, but that's when things started going downhill. Although I do understand the restaurant week menu provides a less hit to our wallets and therefore the server may not be expecting as much of an earning from our table than regular tables, I did not expect it to make much of a difference. I have gone to plenty of fine dining establishments for restaurant week without an issue. However, we didn't receive our appetizers (soup or salad) until about 1 hour + after we were seated, which I find a bit ridiculous. I have worked in the restaurant industry for 7 years, and I know it's common sense to update your customers on the status of their food if you expect it to take a little longer than usual. The server had an hour or more window to do so, and yet we received no updates or apology. Instead, we decided to remain polite and feed ourselves with water and bread. Although the wait between the main entree and dessert was not nearly as long, it was still surprising to me how long everything took. I know we had a large table, but 1 hour for appetizers is quite excessive. Although our two servers were polite, one of the servers made us feel slightly uncomfortable. He tried making jokes with us, but it registered as an odd vibe. I gave Flemings 3 stars because the 12 oz filet was seasoned and cooked well, and also the manager came by to thank us for coming. However, the spinach and potatoes were not satisfying to say the least. They tasted almost as good as those microwaved frozen dinners you can buy from Costco. The cheesecake was okay, but the walnut turtle pie that some chose to order was terrible. It was covered with more walnuts than actual pie. Walnut after walnut. I'm lucky I did not choose that dessert, and I felt sorry for those who did. The cream that was on my cheesecake was even better than their entire dessert all together. Needless to say, I most likely will not return to this establishment, as it was neither worth my time or money.

0b3DDjwfnJhFXauqVv_7WA.text: To make this short, great interior, wait time to be served was awful, waitress knew her menu.  We got our appetizer with the complementary bread and cheese.  Great? Not really.   I order the main filet mignon mid rare ($45) and the , she ordered the certified Angus beef.   Filet mignon was bland, not enough seasoning, small.  Potatoe was way too hot and mushy inside.  The Angus beef had way more flavor and it had some type of crunchy tortilla underneath.  In total the price for the food does not overcome the taste.  I wouldn't recommended it to anyone. Way too expensive for the mediocre service and food.

so2rY70KhJzsOZswQVckJA.text: This was my four visit here and I felt it was about time I wrote a review. I always make reservations and I'm usually say within a minutes of arrival. I made reservations today and wrote a note saying it was my wife's birthday (Actually on July 4th). As soon as we arrive, the front desk people are wishing her happy birthday. There had to be about six or seven people wishing her a happy birthday throughout the evening. It was as if the whole place knew about it - she was so happy. My steak was cooked exactly as I requested it (Medium, because I'm manly) and the food arrived in a timely manner (As always). Our server today was Charles and he was nothing short of magnificent. Every time I've come, the service has always been great, but Charles went above and beyond. I absolutely love this place and will be back many, many more times. These lovey folks get a solid five stars from me. Thank you for making every occasion special, Fleming's.

oo_dfrKmxwIOsSIg93pkbg.text: I attended again after getting a gift card from the manager after my previous review and situation. We were seated promptly at 5 pm when it opened on Wednesday. Our waiter was Curtis and he was fabulous. Honestly, my daughter even said she liked him and she is super shy! He was very knowledgable. He explained the wine selection perfectly! He was a bit confused on the menu though after being gone for several days, we put in an order but then came back to tell us that it was no longer the special. So that was a bit werid. But he was very nice about the whole process. He checked on us frequently which was appreciated. When we got our meal I was cutting up my daughters chicken strips and found a huge string. Curtis was right there and said sorry and took the plate away, apparently a dish towel had fell in the fryer! We asked for another veggie plate so she had something to eat while we were eating. By the time my husband and I were done with our meal hers came which was a bummer because she was full on carrots. The kids meal was nothing to get excited about the fries were very greasy. We ordered the mint lamb chops which had tons of mint on them, it was overloaded. We also got the special of scallops and the steak which was perfect completely. I think you really need to stay with meat at this place, they know how to make it! We did get their great lava cake for dessert again which is fabulous. We did tell them we were there for our anniversary and they gave us a box of truffles to celebrate which was very nice. When we got the check we were surprised that we were charged for the kids meal but then once my husband paid the manager came and gave us a $25 gift card because of the issue. I would have been happier if they would have just taken it off the bill. I had a better experience but still a bit surprised about a towel falling into a fryer for how upscale this place is supposed to be!

35Fy7-76nB1aEcwpuf9NIw.text: Atmosphere nice very casual, food had great presentation, but the quality of the food was mediocre. Prices are high... We ordered a glass of wine, which we enjoyed, most of the wine on the menu you can find at any grocery store. We also had the baked Brie the apples were crisp and the salad was very tasty with a light balsamic but the Brie was a poor quality.

YXxB-labK8m3vCiSw7Zq9A.text: Great place to have a steak: but be ready to spend some cash here.  Want to save a little I know Costco carries the $100 gift card for 79.99!  Every bit helps when you are in the $30 range for 1 steak!  No sides just the meat.  I try and save cash by going here during lunch and enjoy the bar specials. A steak sandwich sometimes curves my steak craving.   I would rate this the full 5, but have been here a few times and not impressed with the service for the $$$$.

KuKttJ9vjnLswA5E0xnyYQ.text: I am a huge Fleming's fan and I found myself a little let down at the West Gate Fleming's. The service is always perfect here. We had a larger group and I think they did an amazing job making sure we were all happy.   The Food: We started with oysters as our appetizer and they weren't too far off from the best I have ever had. Ice cold and flavorful! Shoot away. I usually pass on salad or soup. I get salads elsewhere. This is my carnivorous place. I ordered the filet mignon med rare and it was cooked to perfection. I prefer a nicely peppered, salted steak cooked to perfection. I am not the soaking in butter steak guy. Go to Ruth Chris for that. We ordered the Fleming's potatoes and asparagus as our sides. The potatoes are a legendary staple and the asparagus is always slender and delicious.   The Drink: Here is my one downfall. Almost as important as the steak are my Martinis. Usually you will get the best martinis at steak houses. They shake them a little longer and the bartender usually knows how to properly use vermouth. Well, my first martini was more like a half of a martini. It was also slightly chilled. My second was a full martini, but was so over vermouthed that I almost gagged. Slightly chilled as well. When you pay more for a steakhouse martini, you kind of expect more.   I will always make Fleming's one of my steakhouse go to's. May just have to give a little more direction on the martinis.

-SIA4tyCWueqTwoSTU2cJA.text: We can not say enough good things about this restaurant. We come here for most of our special occasions. When recently trying I decide where to spend our anniversary dinner we decided on Flemings because of the always impeccable service, very consistently amazing food, and warm, cozy atmosphere.  We were seated on time with 3 well wishes for our anniversary from various staff. We were seated in an awkward table but asked to be moved right away and they seated us in a close by booth. (We later saw 2 other tables ask to be moved from the same table so we are thinking it would probably be good to rethink that table location)  We had the Oysters Rockefeller 2 years ago and were still thinking about how wonderful they were so we asked if they could be made because the weren't on the current menu. Our server graciously told us they could make us some.  They were amazing just like last time! We each had a fillet with the Flemings potatoes and asparagus. As usual the steak was fantastic and all sides were perfect. We finished it off with the creme brulee and coffee. It was another perfect meal with excellent service. Before leaving the manager brought over a $25 gift card and house made truffles with well wishes for a happy anniversary. We will definitely be back to celebrate as soon as we are able. Definitely recommend this restaurant for a wonderful experience in both dining and service!

a_B8yMTs65VtobQsHpLqoQ.text: Really a nice steakhouse. I had the Filet which I would definitely order again. The potatoes are a must try as well.  Good wine list and the service is top notch. It's pricey but nothing that you wouldn't expect at a nice steakhouse (think Ruth's Chris).

R-XItsJSc6LCS_Bv3P-6Hw.text: I have to write this down immediately. And I am going to do something I typically don't which is include personal information about myself. But in order to give full comprehension, I will be talking about my family. To me, it's worth it in my book for this one...  My wife and I don't get out much. Busy lives, work, family, etc. We have been passing over anniversaries, birthdays, unexpected (but wanted!) pregnancy, and all other special occasions because of time. We recently purchased a home (buying a home and moving=no time) and after spending somewhere in the neighborhood of a quarter of a million dollars, the builder gave us a $50 gift card to Fleming's. Finally! A chance to go celebrate all of these passed over dates of significance! Ship the daughter off to grandma's, pull out some extra cash, and make the reservation.  We arrived at our reservation time and were seated immediately. The hostess was friendly and politely chatted with us as she seated us at a nice table pretty much in the middle of main dining area. Comfortable chairs, nice lighting, fairly intimate setting. We knew what the menu held after reviewing it online first so we knew we were starting with the crab cakes. After ordering the crab cakes, my wife and I started to slow down and get into the date night vibe. The crab cakes were moist, flavorful, and served in a very savory butter sauce. I couldn't put my finger on the spices in the sauce but it was delectable. We are off to a good start. I ordered a boneless ribeye with king crab and mashed potatoes while my wife went for the petite filet with asparagus. The steak was outstanding. Not too salty, medium rare to perfection, juices still inside and on the plate. If I were a cow, I would be honored to be this steak postmortem. The accompanying crab was also sumptuous. My wife was gracious enough to let me try a bite of her filet and it certainly didn't disappoint. Typically I would finish what she started but my lovely better half is very pregnant so I no longer enjoy the luxury of counting on her leftovers. As a matter of fact, I lost some of my potatoes in the ordeal. Easy sacrifice to keep all of my steak. All the food was impressive.   But this is when things went from impressive to outstanding. One of the managers stops by our table and drops off a $25 gift certificate because our hostess had gleaned the purpose of our night out while she was seating us. She relayed that to the manager which prompted the gift certificate. I elaborated slightly on how it was actually making up for several occasions and he was on his way after a gracious conversation. At the end of our meal, our server then brings us a small box of chocolates with a candle on it and two cards. One card was for the anniversary we were celebrating and the other was for the acknowledgement of our impending new child each signed by the staff. The server then lights the candle and thanks us for celebrating with them. We take a small bite from the rich chocolate delights in the box and saved the rest for later.  I felt special this night. I truly feel like the staff of Fleming's appreciated our visit and were happy we chose to celebrate at their restaurant. The entire night my wife and I were looking at each other in awe of how efficient and caring the staff was. Whether it was how they constantly were topping off our drinks or the management stop by's to check on us. But when you go that far out of normal to deliver hand signed Congratulations cards, you just outdid almost every establishment I have ever been to. One might say this should be expected from a finer dining place such as this, but I have had much less expensive establishments create an experience such as this one. This type of service transcends money. Well done Fleming's. You made the customer number one in your service and meals. My wife and I had a night that we will remember for a very long time to come.

3O-kPQ0U5nEhZ07QXFn3sA.text: The mushrooms with crab weren't that great. The filet was pretty good but the sides were kind of lame. And for the overpriced tab I'm sure we could do way better.  Nothing special besides the tab. I've walked out with that kind of expense in way better places in AZ.

q4d430Xl-v5Q0fdiIosFpA.text: For a $240 bill, the coffee should have been hot and not lukewarm, the baked potato should have been hot and not lukewarm, and we could hardly hear each other sitting side-by-side in our booth with all of the noise from the clattering of the dishes and pots and pans from the kitchen.

0gEka72QDh5OA1dpBxoQLA.text: My husband and I celebrated our 43rd Wedding Anniversary at Flemings in Peoria and from the moment we entered the door and was greeted with "Happy Anniversary!" by the smiling receptionist, our whole experience went North from there! The wait staff wishing us Happy Anniversary, our server, Jose, paying particular attention to our needs, the manager presenting us with a gift card,  Jose snapping our picture and bringing over the "memorable moment" keepsake photo, the gift box of chocolates...oh wait...did I mention our perfectly prepared dinner selections?  I cannot say enough good things about our experience. We were treated like Royalty and I want to share our thanks with everyone who made our night so wonderful!!!

ZN0YKT7zrBl8LpS4Z0EHsQ.text: Let me just start with OMG!!! This place rocks! From show up...to us paying the bill, we were treated with show much respect and kindness. I would give it 10 stars if it would allow me. The girl that that first took our names and clarified our reservation was so nice and funny. We then sat at the bar for their happy hour and was kindly met by the bartenders while we waited for our table. We ordered and had drinks within seconds. The service so far was awesome!! 5 minutes later our table was ready, in which Alex seated my wife first while I payed our tab at the bar. The busser met us with bread and had a great sense of joy while doing his job. Alma was our server who so helpful and made sure we were taken care of during our entire experience. One of the managers, Marc came over and checked in on us and chatted for about a good five minute and clearly stated how he cares about his customers. I thought that was pretty amazing! Now keep in mind, you get what you pay for. Dinner for two will run a minimum of at least $75+. We racked up about $160 :-)  Great service from start to finish and several people had wished us a Happy Anniversary which on that note the manager (Marc) had given us a $25 gift card to say thanks for choosing them on our special day. My wife and I will be back and I hope their team reads this review. I can't even write enough about this place. I literally was "wowing" the whole way home!!  Thanks Flemings!!!

DhHQUjnx4qa0WCy-07iy5g.text: Came here June 8th for a family members birthday. I wasn't impressed at all, I've worked in the service industry for over 6 years and the lack of service for what you pay here is astonishing. Not only was service an issue but the restrooms were dirty and smelled of urine with dirt caked around the edges of the walls. I was also surprised at the music choice which didn't fit the ambience at all. I'd like to assume flemings considers themselves upscale due to the prices on the menu, but there were specific events that occurred that will not have me coming back. First, there were many people tending to our table but our drinks seemed to remain empty for long periods of time. Second, with our large party we received 1 complimentary bread and had to continuously request more (I understand it is complimentary, but enough should be given for the size of the party, especially when paying $30-$50 a plate), Third, one of the entrees was served with completely raw shrimp. Last, something that bothered me terribly, we asked a man that had been to our table several times what one of the sauces was and his reply was "I don't know", without offering to go find out or send our server to inform us he left us with "I don't know". This to me is completely unacceptable especially at a "fine dining" establishment. I hope Flemings can train their employees better in customer service to avoid losing anymore business.

ShL7yeNKTKS9gjQIqUStNA.text: Outstanding service.  The wait staff was terrific. They are a real asset. Of course the food was delicious and perfectly cooked. Incredible deal for the steak and lobster combination.  44.95 per plate is reasonable for a 4 star steak house.. Overall experience for the evening was completely memorable  and we can't wait to return to this place!

hLvMPyVDEfgl_GDrhOkKiw.text: So I have been to Flemings in Scottsdale and liked it very much. My husband had not been. We made reservations for a 10pm dinner at Flemings on Northern for our first visit. Upon entering I was concerned when I saw they close at 10:30. I asked the host if it would be better to come back another day. He assured me that they were accustomed to late night diners.  To begin with, we were seated in the bar. I was not overjoyed about that but our bartender/waiter Shaun was extremely nice and took excellent care of us. The food as well was outstanding.   However... Our experience was not one of linen table service, but instead, a big screen tv with football and kick boxing as well as a parade of trash cans being pulled and ushered out past our booth.   Not the romantic dinner I had hoped for with my husband. I guess my feeling is that if you are going to advertise your serving hours until 10:30, and expect your clientele to pay $300 for dinner (without wine); then you keep your dining room open until 10:30 and  don't start breaking down until your customers have enjoyed their meal.

RvfgX6GcihQNmlaBuiB6OA.text: My wife had been given a gift card for Flemings. It was our anniversary so we decided it was time to use the card. I knew they were basically a steak house but did not look them up on line to see what they had to offer. All the main dishes are meat. If you want something with your meat you order it separately. This will escalate the cost of the meal by more that $16.00 to $20.00 per person.   I have struggled on how to rate them. The food was excellent. The service was excellent. Cost was... Lets just say very expensive for what you got. We got an appetizer, salad, bowel of soup, ice tea, coffee, split a dessert. Ordered coffee for my wife and expresso for myself with the dessert. The coffee and expresso was delivered 10 min before the dessert. These should of been delivered at same time. If you drink expresso you know it has to be drank on serving. Taste changes as it sets and it needs to be consumed when hot. Cost $100.00 + the tip. If we had gotten a meat dish and a glass of wine the cost would of been $80.00 per person. I don't have any problem paying over $100.00 per person if the food, service, ambiance warrant the cost.  I rated them 3 stars. The food, was good. It just wasn't good enough to warrant 4 or 5 stars.   The server John deserves a 5. He was excellent. Very attentive and helpful. It  was a pleasure having him and his staff of 3 different people that made sure we were taken care of.   Would I go back?? No. There are many good steak houses that serve as good food for much less cost.

H39e9PMo02dpwzhJ8slWHQ.text: Fabulous experience. Definately a special occasion restaurant. Great steaks. Delicious.

GD2C4T243cxTGAnK4laq0A.text: For an upscale steak house I am not happy with the inconsistency of the food we have been at least 10 times the steaks are always good and they should be at $40 to $50 dollars with no sides, other items are just average with sky high prices last visit I had Lobster tempora it was over cooked and extremely greasy they need to do better at these prices.

OQ0JDhUqntIG9eIbSjD3BA.text: Bad service can define your dining experience.  The food was fine, the service was NOT!  I wonder if it's too much to expect professional friendly service anytime you visit a higher-end restaurant, a little consistency?  We had a Food Server with a very condescending attitude. Unnecessary snide remarks about everything! Very disappointing. :(

KcjeCIzQ7-LznVRJ7k4nUw.text: The food is always great here. I have been at this location a dozen times and always had a good experience. The only time where the food wasn't up to par was during restaurant week which was odd. I enjoy the New York strip and wife loves their creme brulee. Highly recommend!

sPtwGLyVegsOVmz5LLcEpg.text: So glad there is a Flemmings in Park West! Not many high end restaurants on this side of town. Our first experience there was not lacking in any way I have to say it was everything  I expected and more. The food was great! I really liked that there are choices in the sizes of steak that you can order. I was a little worried when i saw that the creamed corn had jalepeno on top ( not typically a fan of that) but to my surprise it gave the corn just the right amount of zip. The combination of sweetness and heat was delious!  Our server Kurt was very attentive  and  gave us all the information that we needed to make our selections. We will definatley be returning !

4xfBLWEeRVGvLNsdqcqT0Q.text: At the prices they're charging (only a little lower than Mastros) they should be a lot better.  Good service but the food is not worth the price.

sraDaVZlGThheWz61gzPYA.text: The food was amazing! Best Prime Rib I have had in a long time.  The customer service received was also great.  I have no complaints.

lU-gq1TUyQeAyPxbD-TDsw.text: Thank you Flemings for a wonderful night. I arrived a couple hours before my reservation to set up a proposal, and all of you were amazing in your roles when the time came. We had a fairly intricate plan going and you pulled it off perfectly! My now-fiance is so happy with the proposal and I am very grateful to the staff. We loved all the cheering from the kitchen. A lot of fun and a perfect memory. Oh and of course the food, drinks and deserts were great as always!

3XdbvIPm0IIBvRQJVgmXwA.text: "We've run out of ribeyes, sorry".  Really, are you kidding me!  I wish i was a food critic...hold on, I am.  No excuse for running out.

STGeP7xxHyT3MlkbW4VEmA.text: Prime rib eye steak bone in rare is juicy and tasty. Do not order any side dish cause the portion is approx 14 oz. Perhaps share a salad.  Service is excellent. During the course, waiter checks in many times to refill drinks.

_Yxi54efPi1GokX01pjXuA.text: All 5 stars are for their happy hour. This particular location rocks because of Sean (the head bartender). Drinks are awesome all the time and food, especially the prime burger that never fails to impress. Happy hour is Mon thru Fri from 5-7!

NhqYPzvu5ZYd5TaLyz499Q.text: Delicious food, but very rich & buttery. Started with the seafood tower & the calamari, both were very good although the lobster seemed a tad tough. Cannot go wrong with any of the steak options for the main course. The service was amazing, from the timing to the food descriptions, they were perfect. Excellent bar drinks as well and you can even see all the options on an iPad!

pqCJOa6HmwYyn_cIZSTZ7g.text: The food was sub par. My rib-eye was covered in salt and spices, could not even taste the meat. my wife had their signature Chilean sea bass, it was soaked in teriyaki and ginger. could not discern if it was fish or chicken. not flaky at all. the service and atmosphere were good. We will not be returning.

v3rbAwmFDG6LtzNEqwcjdg.text: The food is amazing, the service is amazing, and the ambiance is amazing! Even better than Ruth Chris! This is our new favorite restaurant for special occasions... Like Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday... Well, pretty much any day of the year!

sVR_kdJeAm76jGZ3uStLGg.text: The Main Man and I are Flemings fans; as in, we go there quite a bit, several times a year in the main dining room and almost monthly in the bar area. We are not at all impressed with the 'upstairs' overflow area... So this review might be tainted...  Our last visit was on October 21 for a big deal dinner. The reservation was made more than a month prior yet when we arrived they tried to seat us in that awful side room that makes one feel as if they are seated at the kids table during the family Thanksgiving meal. MM asked for different seating and despite open tables visible in the dining room, they stated everything was reserved. When we said we would wait for seating in the big people dining room, the hostess was visibly annoyed and went whispering who-knows-what in the co-hostesses ear. A few moments later, after they had their crisis meeting with management, we were seated in the big dining room, among the multitude of open tables that mostly remained open during our 1.5 hour meal.  Now, having been smitten with Flemings for years now, it pains me to say that the quality of service had dropped significantly and the food had taken the same route. Or maybe I have become that much better a cook... When we drop $200+ on a meal, I want the meal, the service, the ambiance, the whole experience to feel extraordinary and this did not. It was just a meal and the desert that they make a big deal about, the chocolate lava cake, is quite disappointing! With a 20 minute prep time and all the buildup, I would think the thing should knock my socks, or other undergarments, off. It didn't... It was tasty and we finished it, but I won't order it again and it isn't something I will find myself craving down the line.  As for the service, it was quite generic and seemed lacking in the refinement we have come to expect from Flemings. The hostesses were borderline rude and unprofessional. The manager, knowing we were displeased with the original seating didn't visit our table until the end of the meal and then only did so sheepishly and quickly. The appetizer and the steaks were fine, not spectacular, but fine.  Of four visits this year, this was the second disappointing visit. After the first one they said it would get better and it did, but not all the way, and not for long... Pull it together!

HYnNJ4B-pgjQqa96jjFbGw.text: Working in town and I can always count on a great meal at Fleming's.  Sat at the bar and received great service. I did the small bites, big pours specials; Cab Sauv with Short Rib & Spinach. Just right! One disappointment, no beer on tap at this Fleming's. I can only dock a half star for that and always round up :) Keep up the great work.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States

Wajz2yzYukz-iwTjSHWa7g.text: Went to Flemings on a Tuesday night and I was surprised to see there were only a handful of tables in the entire night. I ordered the Caesar salad and the Prime NY for dinner. My steak was cooked to perfection but the salad was so salty and I had to return it. Overall the service was great and I would go back.

Y_8Wd2PnrPzUfbhBz9aVyg.text: We had our Valentines Day dinner and the rib eye was amazing, the service was first class, we never had to ask, the staff anticipated all our request.  We ended our meal with a delicious desert, a beautiful night!

03hQwoGhMDdA5-nd7UVQRQ.text: I ordered the filet mignon.  It was pretty good.  I don't know if it's worth $53 though.  It's not that good.  Wine by the glass here is around $18-$30 each for decent glasses.

Oq5pWFpljcrdV2jYWPFGPA.text: This Fleming's is one of my go-to restaurants. I've had many dinners here and can say that I have yet to have a complaint about a single meal. They have a great drink menu and their overall menu has options for just about anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States

5rJ19JfFX_v5tx998Lo-ZQ.text: Absolutely my favorite Fleming's so far. Compared to the Fleming's in Palm Desert, Rancho Cucamonga, and LA Live, this location has amazing servers and the food is perfect. Upon arrival, we greeted nicely. The young hostess asked for our name and if we had a reservation. Of course we had a reservation. Never go to an upscale restaurant without a reservation. Within 2 minutes, Orel Hershiser approaches my son and introduces himself. Mind you we had just come from a Spring Training Dodgers game at CamelBack ranch which is about 10 min away. My son was in amazement. The location is great. The server was very friendly, very attentive, and kept us updated with the approximate arrival of dinner. The manager came over and welcomed us to Arizona after learning we were visiting from California. I wish I could remember his name. All in all, the portions were huge, the meats were perfectly cooked, and dessert was the final touch. We will definitely return to this location when at Dodgers Spring Training.

3lTdCMlixrpnYZih3pv7uw.text: We just finish eating here and we loved it the service was really good to start . Food was amazing , we pretty much had a little of everything . My favorite stake house on the west side for sure

Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States

0WGDuojNBnyi6w_O4P1Shw.text: My husband and I went about 2 Years ago and while the service was outstanding the food was only so-so.  We tried it again on May 5,  2019 and BOTH the food and service were excellent.  I can't stress how good their service is.  Impeccable!!  If you haven't tried them recently...you should!  They will treat you right!

WCYmwh7OcNsjC7ksbtHIow.text: My Wife and I just had dinner at Flemings in Peoria.  It was exceptional! She had a Veal chop and I had a 12oz Filet Mignon.  Both were cooked perfectly.  Service was excellent.  Our server Jeremy was super.  Best carrot cake I have ever had.  I haven't eaten here for a year or so and was very happy.  I usually go to Ruth Chris but this visit changed my mind.  I will be going to Flemings for any special occasion including just wanting a GOOD steak.

HhpoWiqJRq71QrbNLsRsiA.text: They had the best steak that I have had in a long time I ordered mine medium rare like I usually do and it was divine, it was actually better than my favorite place where I usually get my steaks and that place is the old west Steakhouse in Mayer. But of course the price the price again was a little stiffer than it is over at the old Steakhouse. So I really enjoyed this place and we will definitely have to come back here

uRe36PdYe887tC3gKrN8sQ.text: Best Restaurant experience in my life! Ambiance, cleanliness, friendly servers, food was EXCELLENT and management super attentive!!! My new favorite place!

ogIegfqYRkWNya2cpvi_ng.text: Pretty good, service is great, Prosciutto app was amazing but entrees just didn't have that POW factor-   Steak- cooked great Chicken cooked great  Sides Max and cheese amazing Fleming's potato's- mediocre   Food was good but not worth the price because that lack of flavor in entree.   Had to add salt to steak.

GYTmb5mGLRZFxJTamjckPg.text: What can I say? This place is amazing. Food is always 100% and service is always very good. Bf and I spent our Friday night here and ate off of their 567 deals which is 5 items of cocktails, 5 wines, and 5 appetizers starting at $6 until 7pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Chocolate Lava Cake

u-dynSqLPOfN3fcyBT6oXg.text: Wife wanted to go to Fleming's for her birthday. We have gone numerous times b4 and had an enjoyable experience ,that came to a crashing halt Sunday night. We went with the filet and "colossal king crab legs ". Not only was the word "COLOSSAL "a complete lie but it was closer to a average snow crab leg- really wish I had taken a picture, but a manager saw it . Also it was precooked and obviously sat under a heating lamp for god knows how long. It was rubber and cardboard thin. My wife s and guests were the same. The manager brought me a fresh one which was 100 times better but No where near "COLOSSAL ". They really need to take that description off menu.  Gave 2 stars because steak as always was fabulous!  Not going to rush back to this location. Really disappointing dining experience.  Wouldn't recommend this location,just hope other locations are still good

xbV3e4cuuxeWWm6xbYWNSw.text: Megan our server did a super job as we had a party of 4 adults and 2 children. She was super attentive to the 2 young adults and they loved it. Food was spectacular as I would expect, cocktails were spot on as I would expect. Great place to celebrate a special occasion as you get treated like a king.

jJfKVICzSDeYE8vwKh1jbg.text: Prime Burger is soooo good. Worth a visit to try it out. Great service. Awesome bartenders.

rsbT_7uGt5TeKiJGeO-95A.text: Excellent service. Excellent steak and sauteed mushrooms.  Will definitely make a return visit.

BSHEvKTO5vDWJq-CnlxJcw.text: Excellent Experience tonight. Steaks were perfect. Paul and Chase were great. Will be back.

Gc6xDyO8Ffbjf9luzCmpQw.text: The understated exterior and dark interior tell you that Fleming's is upscale, so get ready for good service, great steaks, and corresponding prices.  There is no tap beer available, which for our party was a "WTF?", but they had wines available that are hard to find elsewhere.  Besides, there's more profit in wine, so that makes sense for this type of restaurant.  But it reduces my likelihood of returning since I'm a beer expert rather than a wine expert.  The salads were pretty ordinary, and seemed like courtesy add-ons to their menu for the main course, beef.  The prime filet mignon was superb, about the best I've ever had.  Perfectly cooked to our order.    It was not a busy weekday evening, so service was excellent.

ab3LBt1cCIEsf5IAVHezAg.text: Beef. It's what's for dinner. That was the slogan for the Beef Advisory Council way back when I was an ad agency media planner. I saw Cybill Shepherd on a commercial shoot, and she took one look at the steak on the counter, admitted she was a vegetarian, and marched to her dressing room. Gee, that has nothing to do with Fleming's, but it's funny what sticks with you all these years later when I was at a company outing in Phoenix. This was the place our CIO chose for our group dinner, a generous gesture as the dinner reflected the dishes the restaurant chain are most renowned. After taking advantage of platters of appetizers including the Sweet Chile Calamari and Bacon-Wrapped Scallops (photo: bit.ly/2kOAy0w), we were all seated in the private dining room. We each got samplings of two salads - the Modern Caesar with fried capers and proscuitto chips accompanied by Parmesan toast (photo: bit.ly/2kZSVSp), as well as the New Wedge with slab-cut bacon, blistered cherry tomatoes, and crumbled gorgonzola cheese (photo: bit.ly/2ksZyJz). Both were quite satisfying with the wedge a nice translation of the steakhouse staple. This was followed by a quartet of scrumptious sides. Fleming's Potatoes is a decadent house specialty - scalloped, molded like a brick, and heavy with cream and cheddar cheese with a bit of jalapeno (photo: bit.ly/2lqva6X), and the Truffle-Parsley Mashed Potatoes, saturated in cream and butter, made it a double header of artery-clogging starchy goodness. The Grilled High Country Asparagus and Sauteed Mushrooms made a valiant attempt to offset the potatoes but to little avail (photo: bit.ly/2ksVLvW). The main attraction was, of course, the steak, and the 12-ounce Main Filet Mignon was tender, iron-crusted and drizzled with melted butter (photo: bit.ly/2kayDkJ). Quite a treat. As if we were not wallowing in enough self-indulgence, there was a triple helping of dessert. The Walnut Turtle Pie was gooey good with housemade caramel, walnuts, and chocolate (photo: bit.ly/2kVaBPi), and the New York Cheesecake was classically conventional with its graham cracker crust and blueberry sauce (photo: bit.ly/2kao6pV). My favorite was the Creme Brulee, a large serving of Tahitian vanilla bean custard served with fresh berries (photo: bit.ly/2kaByda). Stuffed, uncomfortably so, but it certainly made me amenable to a return visit to a Fleming's near me on my dime. Even if Cybill disapproves. FOOD - 4 stars...definitely a high quality steakhouse even if it is a chain AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...very manly place with a lot of wood SERVICE - 3 stars...even though we were a big party, it did seem exceedingly slow TOTAL - 4 stars...a near-classic steakhouse experience

GXHqLSh5qS_eC5ph-VxRKg.text: It's been several years since I've been to Fleming's, and this was my first visit to the Peoria location. My husband had a gift card and, as serious steak fans, we decided to splurge for a belated birthday dinner.  I knew something was off when we walked in and were met by three hostesses who seemed absolutely miserable. Now, I used to work food service - at a steakhouse, no less - and I've worked many a difficult night, so I brushed off the lukewarm reception as a fluke.  Our waiter was quick to arrive and seemed a bit nervous, but he was more than happy to answer questions about the menu and didn't try to upsell any particular item, other than the salads - he seemed very insistent that I order a salad. Again, we didn't think much of it, but we were both pretty hungry and excited to get to the protein portion of the meal. We started with the shrimp cocktail, which was five magnificent prawns, expertly deveined, with a tangy sauce on the side. My first drink was the California Jam Jar, a light, faintly herby, and pleasantly refreshing vodka drink. My husband ordered the Old Mexico, a smoky rum number with a hint of poblano syrup served in one of their delightfully oversized wine glasses. The waiter asked him several times if he was okay with a spicy drink, so I was expecting some real kick...but it was a rich, warm, and bright drink. We were off to a great start.  We had settled on two steaks, the Fleming's scalloped potatoes, and the sauteed mushrooms. The food took quite some time, especially considering that it wasn't terribly busy for a Saturday night, but we were enjoying our drinks and conversation. Our waiter didn't return until our food did, even though it was brought out by another waiter, both of whom were trying to talk to me at once. I was ready for a drink that could hold its own alongside my filet and upgraded to a Manhattan, served up.   My filet was a solid 8oz with very little fat, and the bernaise was appropriately subtle with notes of parsley and shallot. I cut into the steak and was shocked - I'd ordered rare to medium rare, and the outside was grey. Oh no. I cut into the middle, and it was a grey-pink, a solid medium well. My plate was searing hot, and the steak was continuing to dry out by the second. My husband's bone-in ribeye was slightly overcooked (he'd ordered medium rare, and it was medium) but the tenderness was preserved by the bone, so he wasn't bothered. He did enjoy the herbaceous horseradish glaze.  Because our food had taken so long to arrive, I wasn't about to send it back and wait another 20 minutes, especially given how late it was in the evening. Besides, the waiter didn't bother to ask how it was until another three passes later. I decided to dig into the sides - I was really looking forward to these mushrooms.   Sadly, I was disappointed again. The Fleming's I remember offered a variety of creamy mashed potatoes with nuanced peppercorn and whipped butter. These were slathered with cheddar and an oil film on top - it looked like they had been sitting under a lamp while they cooked my filet to death. Meanwhile, I found the mushrooms a bit undercooked (poor moisture to seasoning ratio) and terribly overseasoned with huge chunks of pepper that we kept finding in each others' teeth. The sheer amount of salt in the meal left both of us with indigestion.  The waiter could tell I wasn't thrilled as I sawed through the leather on my plate, but made little effort to really ask me about it, which was a shame. He seemed more interested in speaking to my husband, and I was getting the distinct impression that he thought only men preferred good steak and stiff drinks, and that I was just there for show. When I remarked on how excellent my manhattan was (complemented by two luxardo cherries, a luxurious touch), he remarked "that's because you like strong drinks!" Uh, yeah? I also like good food, none of which seemed to be found at the table.  Even though it was getting late and the dining room was starting to empty, the waiter tried to sell us (well, my husband) on a dessert. I was over it and focusing purely on my manhattan at this point. The total came to over $200 before tip, which was just depressing - there's much better food to be had for far less! The waiter did refill my water before disappearing, so uh, thanks? We never saw a manager and no one bothered to thank us or say goodbye.  I'd be remiss if I didn't remind the ladies out there to watch your step as you enter and exit. The polished wood flooring in the entry area is slicker than a basketball court. I'm one of those women who can easily run in 4" heels, but I was having a hard time keeping my balance (even before I had a drink, thank you). I saw another review from a woman who took a tumble, and I can completely understand why.   Based on the quality of the food and drinks, I might consider a return for a happy hour drink and an appetizer on a lazy afternoon... but at a different location. All in all, a shame!

HK04JMgYbtBgnrWJYvl-EQ.text: Chase offered us a complimentary meal due to an unpleasant dining experience in December...... oh boy am I glad we gave them a second chance!  Our server, Daniel, was so attentive and personable .... the food was AMAZING and our dining experience was relaxing and pleasant.  Note to self:  restaurants (like humans) make mistakes but should always be given the opportunity for redemption!  Thank you Chase, thank you Daniel, thank you Fleming's!  We will definitely be back  FYI... the Chef will make you an amazing vegetarian plate if you are not a carnivore

CQa_9bVWCaNk8gXEhuGrKQ.text: Amazing food, great service, nice atmosphere. Hard to really say much more - you pay for it but you get what you pay for! Steaks done perfectly - grilled foods are just spot on. Menu changes now and then, chef specials too!

MDYbtcptAcqj4N4fh_b49Q.text: My roomates and I got a reservation at Flemmings for her Birthday. We arrived and were seated upon arrival. Our waitress was very nice and incredibly attentive. She also gave my roomate a little birthday card. That was very nice. The bread starter was delicious. We really enjoyed the two dips that came with the bread. We then recieved our salads. The salad was very good. We enjoyed the lemon vinaigrette dressing that came on the salad. Then came the entrees. My filet mingon was cooked to perfection and the portion was perfect. My roomates also enjoyed their meals. At the end of the meal we got a delicious chocolate lava cake dessert. We shared it between the three of us and it was delectable. The waitress also gave my roomate a box of truffles and another manager (im assuming the owner) gave us a $25 off gift card which was also very kind. We really enjoyed our experience at Flemmings and we will be coming back.  UPDATED: Went to Flemmings to use the $25 gift card. Again, Excellent service. Although I was kind of upset I was not allowed to order mac and cheese with my filet again, The food was outstanding and the filet was cooked to absolute perfection. I also tried the lamb over carrot puree.. delicious!!

jTGK_43qAe19aDlY7ka-yw.text: This is the best Fleming's in the valley!! Great service and great Steak!!! Thank you so much!

xjmbtB1rwejJekklIjT_0A.text: We always come for happy hour because it's totally affordable and so delicious!! The staff is always so attentive and helpful! We also just tried the carrot cake. Mind blown.  it was the best of the best. Now we're sad to try any other carrot cake because we know nothing can top this one.

yIzMTETQ6pMnN41fbTM3SQ.text: We received and email with a $25 dining credit so we chose Flemings over Ruth's Chris on this occasion. We were not disappointed. We were greeted by name when we arrived for our reservation and seated immediately. The prefix menu that featured filet, salmon and scallops along with appetizer and dessert was delicious and a great value. The sides were large enough to share and simply delicious. We had the chipotle mac n cheese and Parmesan mashed taters. The steaks were cooked perfectly and the service was awesome! We celebrated a birthday and they took our groups pictures and provided us with a framed photo before we left along with a gift if delicious truffles. The carrot cake is a great finish to the meal along with the managers checking in throughout the evening.

G7ruEPGqGIbmWgFXaAvMEQ.text: WELL here we go!!!! Every time we go to a restaurant something gets all messed up with my food.. I am a picky eater. My husband loves Flemings so we decided to go on a Monday night. Our waiter Trent was great. We ordered the special of PrimeRib. IT WAS AMAZING. Served hot and delicious. My potato was hot. My husband got the spinach and he loved it. We had a margarita each. Other than a little small for the price, it was good. THE desserts were great. I had leftovers. So other than the guy forgot to put the delicious roll in there EVERYTHING was great. The price was the best. We will be going back. Thank you...

HEnfkQ5SSo5EFbL3E3-FBQ.text: Dark Maroon Leather, and Thick Wood Handled Steak Knives. (not even necessary to cut through the buttery thick steaks this place fires up)  Amazing Service, and Steaks. The Rib eye medium is perfect, completely perfect.  Seared on the outside on their 2000 degree grill locks in the flavor and taste like nothing I've ever tried.  The Flemmings Potatoes are a cheesy cream filled sensation, and to boot they have the best Lava Cake on the planet.  And seriously even the mints you take with you to go are amazing!  LOL.  Quality from the bottom to the top.    Im not a "fine dining" kind of guy, nothing makes me more pissed off than spending $50 on a meal for one and having to hit burger king on the way home cuz Im still starving because they gave me a 3 ounce "french delicacy" cut, draped in butter truffle crap, with a sprig of asparagus and a mint leaf.  Those of you who've ever tried to impress a girl know what Im talking about.  Flemmings is not this kinda place. Be prepared to drop over $100 for 2, but its worth every dime!  I'm a superfan!

em18dqgsCQqFyAvfcL06Xw.text: I went here based on the yelp reviews and the 3 dollar signs thinking that meant expensive but not absurd.   My co worker and I went for dinner and we walked in and they asked if we has reservations. The place was empty so I didn't see why that mattered. We said no and then they asked for my last name and then first. I was so put off. I don't see a need to give out that info to have dinner. Do you want to do a background check as well?  We were sat by our hostess dressed in a slutty black outfit, like the others there. Out waitress attempted to say hi by using my last name I gave them which isnt all that hard but she slaughtered it. She asked if we wanted wine but we told her no and that we wanted water, coke and lemonade. She ignored what we said and then asked if we wanted water and soda... ugh.   We were in shock when we opened the menu and saw the ridiculous prices. $45 for the filet by itself, with no sides. $10 for a baked potatoe....We were here on money from work so we stayed. If it was my own money I would not have stayed. We ordered our meal and out waitress again was clueless and ignored what we said and had to repeat our orders several times.   The food was brought out and I was expecting the most amazing steak I have ever had. The steak was fine, not worth $45, maybe 20. The baked potato was pretty decent but again not worth the money. I dont know how they can charge that much for mediocre steak. I ate everything but wasnt all that pleased.   My low rating is due to the strange vibe I got from the staff and the crazy high prices for standard food.

uZizUVccXWQbt-kdgSVAog.text: We were staying overnight in Surprise, AZ for business and got into town late. Feeling tired but really hungry after the long drive we decided to try out the nearby Fleming's restaurant after checking into the hotel.  As we were one of the last patrons to arrive, most were already leaving,  I must say they gave us exceptional service. The three of us ordered the scallops, petite filet, and New York strip steak.  All of our entrees were delicious!  The presentation of the dishes alone was on spot.  We all shared a bottle of red wine the server suggested and it was a perfect match with our food.  They even snapped a picture of us and handed it to us in a little cardboard frame when they brought us the check. (We now have it displayed on our mantle).  Too bad we don't live in the area because this was one of the nicest, not to mention one of the tastiest, dining experiences we've had.

guWDjn41SdWjgJv2ru-GnQ.text: Service is good, the food is great, but for a $50 steak it need to be cooked more carefully. Wine is insanely overpriced even for a classy restaurant. The interior is boring and dated with garage sale quality 'wine art' throughout. Drinks are not poured in the proper glass which is insulting when your 1/2 glass cost as much as a full bottle. 2nd time going here, probably won't be back. There are other attractive options nearby.

sNqOAmysDNqbM2dXWTBmOQ.text: We were so excited to eat here as our family gave it such great reviews. Our waiter Alex was awesome. He was so polite and professional. Randy Canada, the operator partner, was extremely unprofessional with the way he handled our situation. Halfway through eating my salad I noticed a screw in my salad. I could not believe with such a classy establishment that a screw was in my salad. Although I was completely disgusted I understood that accidents can happen. With that said there should've been no questions asked that the entire meal should've been comped. Randy came to the table and I made it clear that this was unacceptable and our meal should be comped. Much to my surprise only half was comped. Randy came back to the table after hearing our concerns and was very patronizing. I explained to him that I could've choked on the screw or chipped a tooth and he said "yeah but you didn't." I could not believe he said that not to mention the fact that it was a dirty screw in my food so who knows what kind of nasty bacteria was on it. We will never eat here again. What should've been a fun night celebrating Valentine's Day was left with us being extremely disappointed!!

glkdpZBpCW4hVF7aZjYolw.text: We celebrated my husband's 83rd birthday at this fabulous restaurant the other evening.  Having never been we were unaware of what we would experience. From the minute we sat down till the minute we left we were treated like their only customers. Steve went out of his way to describe in detail the complete menu for us and was one of the most attentive waiters we have ever had. There are absolutely no words to describe our meal. Never had we had prime rib cooked to perfection like we had at Fleming's. It just melted in your mouth. Was wonderful to have three difference sauces for dipping and the salads were huge.  So very happy we picked this restaurant and we look forward to many visits. We were even visited by Marc, the manager who was as professional as he could be. If I could give the customer service and meal a 10+ rating I would. Absolutely the best meal we have had in a very long time and the best prime rib we have ever had. We cannot wait to try out their wonderful steaks in our future visits. My husband even received a birthday card signed by the staff. What a nice touch. Our compliments to Marc and his fine staff for allowing us to have such a fantastic experience.

u5o3NBQ3yXE1HXq5pmIEAQ.text: The porterhouse dinner for two was massive! We couldn't even finish it. It comes in this huge skillet with filet and new york strip steak cooked to perfection. Carrots, potatoes, and cauliflower. The cauliflower is covered in some sauce I can't describe but very creamy. The bread and spreads prior to the meal are divine! There is a gouda white wine which was my favorite and a jalepeno cheddar one which was good as well.  Would definitely go back!

EmSHFCOGR-HnKPQzJJWkCA.text: Very good evening. Wife had the Sea Bass and I had King Crab Legs. Our friends had steak. All were well prepared and tasty. We chose to eat outdoors, a bit noisy but very pleasant. Service was good. Wine selection was also good. I keep using good because that is what the evening was.

WYR7Qhq13DLnv2w9jIe2nQ.text: We have been to Flemings before so we knew it be $$$$ but worth it. However, the trip last night was disappointing. We were a group of 4 and decided to start with some wine flights. It took FOREVER to get those. Our server seemed liked she knew what she was doing but it took 4 requests yo get some olive oil for the bread. When taking our dinner order, she failed to mention the specials. We found out about them after overhearing another server tell his table about them.  When we mentioned to her the many oversights on our service, she just kept saying the wine flights really confused her. Really?? You work at a wine bar! Overall, this was a very disappointing visit.

ewECk3Qyj3BM7m9mODGvxQ.text: Went here with my wife for our anniversary dinner. We were immediately seated and promptly served by a polite and attentive waiter. The service was great by all the wait staff who worked together to stay on top of any needs.   Food wise we were delighted from the pre-meal bread to the very delicious steaks we both ordered. Flemings is certainly on par with all the other premier steakhouses my wife and I have experienced (Morton's, Ruth Chris, etc.)   Knowing it was our anniversary they were very nice and gave us a gift of a box of chocolates and a coupon for a future visit.   The only negative thing I can say, about this location anyway, is we went there for a romantic type dinner and there was a full bar with flat screens and football on. Trust me, I am a huge football fan, but I didn't like the negative effect it had on the ambiance of the whole restaurant. You can't have a fancy steakhouse and a sports bar. You can have a sports bar that makes a good steak, but you lose the feeling you're looking for when wanting a romantic night out.   We may come back here, but it won't be for an anniversary dinner.

-TAkq_bGiBw3eQ-Czf9L5w.text: Amazing service and amazing food I thought it would be packed this weekend with Valentine's Day tomorrow but there was only a 30 min wait they were fast and efficient!!

JeF-SP_Q9V2kegQlSpAa3A.text: This was my husband and i's first time. We are rarely without the kids. When. You first walk in there is a ton of wine on the walls, which always makes me happy. We ordered the sweet chile calamari and it was really good, sweet and tangy all at the same time. We both ordered the prime rib dinner. I got the truffle mashed potatoes and my husband the jalapeno mac and cheese. Both of our dinners were amazing! The prime rib was so tender and with just the right amount of Rosemary and the mac and mashed were to die for. Did I mention that our waitress was a doll and the manager was very nice too? Well, they were! The icing on the cake was when we were checking out the wine list and we saw the Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir! That is actually the bottle of wine my husband and I had on our honeymoon! Overall a 5 star experience and we will be back.

qQh9JYPTBn6UKgayfftWdQ.text: Food is always amazing and pricey, but a great place for special occasions. Staff is always nice and efficient.

Tz78Vj_jaqwi6Z2YnOcZMg.text: Delicious. Steak melts in your mouth, and the mahi mahi I got was cooked perfectly. Highly recommend the Flemings potatoes, as well. Overall, everything tasted fresh and was well seasoned. Waitstaff was very knowledgable, which I always appreciate.   Good service, make sure you tell them if it's a special occasion as well -- we got some truffles as a gift for our anniversary. Highly recommend!

JF_Kh6IjztZCW-CmHXpEaw.text: I've eaten here before and had a great experience, though tonight, the service was far from mediocre. Enjoying a nice date night with my husband and sat in the bar. Ordered several cocktails, a couple of appetizers, an entree and a bottle of wine, but the service was some of the crappiest I've ever experienced in a restaurant if this caliber. Food was great, but continually waited for refills when drinks ran out #NotAFanOfRunningDry. Even told the sever when he finally returned, that I would've liked dessert, but it had taken too long and we needed to get out of there. Oddly, wasn't even that busy. Such a disappointment!

WHw-katpe7Os1qtRMchYcw.text: Excellent place to go for a romantic dinner! Came here on a date with my boyfriend for some steak dinner. The atmosphere of the restaurant is very welcoming and relaxing. We've been to Flemings in Tucson before and we didn't like the steak nor the service there. We've decided to try the one in Phoenix, it's totally different!  We walked in and got greeted and seated because it wasn't too busy. We came about an hour ish till closing time. Our waitress, Jennifer, was amazing and friendly. She was very attentive and she was very patience giving us time to look through the menu because we were indecisive of what to order.   We've decided to order the Burrata with Prosciutto for starters and a medium rare Tomahawk Steak to share.  The starter dish have the charred campari tomatoes, prosciutto, wild arugula, and toasted garlic crostini. It was a light appetizer and it goes well with wine. The tomahawk Steak cooked perfectly! We were afraid of their seasonings for the steak back in Tucson, which we think it was way to salty, but they made it perfectly here in Phoenix.   It was a great date night and I am very impress with the service and delicious dinner.
