UhytsR65OH1c1_O368e-lw.text: I'm at a loss for words. While we love to splurge and eat like royalty , this place was comparable to an outback steakhouse nonetheless. I will Note, this was our FIRST time Here. For such a moderately fancy restaurant, we had such high expectations, but little did we know that our experience would be the exact opposite. At first glance, the restaurant looks wonderful, but the service on the other hand, is such a disappointment. We were uncomfortable and Fleming's left a bad taste in our mouths. We were treated Like outsiders and judged from The start. From The moment we walked, were seated, it was a complete disaster.we were not welcomed properly and absolutely not acknowledged for being there on such a special occasion. I never felt so relieved to finally pay the bill, get it over with, and leave. For our first date night in  about 6 MONTHS  (since I had a baby) I will never come back here again. I don't want a refund,or anything to do with this restaurant, I would just like to say, have more class. We will be sticking with Durant's, for they are a reputable steakhouse.  *Only giving 2 stars because my creme brulee was delicious & put a much needed smile on my face  *

KUJEIyGJ6GfPeSSEJ0mgZg.text: We have dined here several times and continue to return.  The food is delicious and the service is always top tier.    We have mostly dined here for special occasions but recently increasing our visits for regular date and dinner nights.  The last several times we've dined in the bar for Happy Hour, ordering from both the Happy Hour menu and the regular menu.   Most recently we tried the $50 filet and lobster special which comes with a salad and a desert.  Our filets and lobster were perfectly prepared.  We love the Fleming's salad with the lemon vinaigrette dressing.  For desert we gravitate to the lava cake or the berries & cream.    For special occasions such as birthdays and anniversaries the staff provide cards and a special treat!

9KwwGRjWSEXBg7Szr5iDyQ.text: I've lived in the area for over seven years and have dined here at least twice per year.   It has always been a wonderful experience!   Last Sunday, our servers were excellent. The bartender knows how to make a righteous Long Island iced tea. Our filet mignons (mine a "petit") and side of mashed potatoes were fantastic.  Unfortunately, our side of asparagus was nearly inedible. The asparagus was pencil-thin and so stringy that our steak knives couldn't cut through the stems. That item should have been left off the menu for that evening. When you spend $160 (before tip) for a meal, everything should be perfect.  Having said that, it was very nice that we were given four delicious chocolate truffles for our anniversary.

IZ89xwIG5y5TmhdAcL_cWQ.text: My wife and I have been here 6/7 times in the last year.  We love the prime rib but will settle for a petite filet and that is amazing as well.   You have to start with the Ahi Tuna Poke (crazy good)  Their wine selection is a little expensive but very good.  It is nice that they bring out an iPad with all the selections so you can choose the appropriate wine for dinner.    This restaurant does an amazing job to accommodate and allergies and the chef will come to the table and ask what they have to do to make sure you have a great dining experience.

FKqJkKEgjVoB7qWxW1ipgw.text: As you walk in you see huge wine and champagne bottles and you're greeted by the from of the house staff. I checked in my reservation and headed to the bar to enjoy some grey goose and cranberry. Its 4pm and it's dark and not busy at all at this time, which is really nice.  We were upstairs here and Bobby came on over and greeted us. She was very helpful in her recommendations, as well as, kept the drinks coming. I loved that she mentioned items from the local curated menu. I like when there's a bit of local items on any menu. That's a must!   Appetizer - I had the the beef flemingtons, which were filled with smoked cheddar cheese, mushroom duxelle, and Madeira sauce. So amazing and I can eat these by themselves. It's like a little pastry puff and so light and fluffy.   Main course - I ordered the 16oz prime New York strip, medium. It was almost like cutting into butter. That is how freaking tender this steak was. I had to add the Truffle poached lobster with a touch of bearnaise sauce and and drop of caviar. I've never had caviar before and it didn't live up to my expectations. But the lobster was so good and the sauce sent me over the moon. I can't have steak with out my mash potatoes, so I ordered the Yukon mash potatoes, which were whipped to perfection. Also, ordered the grilled high country asparagus because I feel better about myself when I have a vegetable at any meal. It kind makes me feel like I'm being an adult and making the right decisions in life lol.   All in all, you can't go wrong by choosing to go here. You're making the right choice! The atmosphere is relaxing and not filled with the hustle and bustle like many restaurants. When I dine out, I pay for service, as well as, the atmosphere and the quality of the food. This place is exceptional. If you're ever here request Bobby, she's amazing (not sure if I spelled her name right), and Alma the manager was so nice and hospitable. I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Certified angus beef ribeye
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States

N3UXYso4XSg4XcfwuuX6BQ.text: Fleming's is expensive. So very, very, expensive. But for that you get truly incredible food and also a genuine experience.  Our server, Steve, was phenomenal. Such a personable guy, and incredibly knowledgeable about the menu and the full wine list. We were never left wanting for anything.  The bread basket included a variety of rolls along with a cracker. I'm a bread snob because I bake my own bread, but all of the offerings were excellent.  We ordered the pork belly appetizer. It was served on a bed of grits, and a lovely savory glaze atop. Along with that, I had the blueberry lemon drop cocktail, which was sweet and perfect.  For our main dishes, my husband ordered the wagyu strip (a special offering for the month of December) while I had the petite filet mignon. We shared two vegetables sides: heirloom carrots and Brussel sprouts. Steve brought us several samples of red wine early on, and we agreed on a Duckhorn merlot, which paired perfectly with our food. Everything was delicious. So many restaurants cannot cook steak; Fleming's has mastered it.  We were too full for desert, but that menu looked incredible, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. pork belly on grits appetizer
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. 8 oz petite filet mignon
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. heirloom carrots (top) Brussels sprouts (below)

_6KDjLHF7zz6D0UaHAaQIA.text: Amazing steak and service. This place is pricey but you pay for the service and ambience. Everything here was amazing. I enjoyed appetizers and drinks as well. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States

ZdAZJY_SdW71PGfkuXoQOA.text: My husband and I went to Fleming's for dinner & dessert this evening.  We had two fantastic ladies that served us ... they both were so helpful.  My husband and I got the bone-in ribeye Steak 20 ounce, a salad with baked potato ... hands down the steaks were sooo incredibly delicious... the flavor was superb!!  Megan H. was our waitress (she's top notch ... Janet L. was fantastic as well.   This is our first time here and we can't wait to go back!   Oh and the Lava Cake was the best I've ever had!!  Thank you

gnEwUPkxze7OJLU2tt7Bxw.text: While pricey, you cant beat the food and service. We came for our 11th anniversary and had a wonderful experience. The 3 course summer meal was delicious and the bone in rib eye was very tasty. Our server was by enough to make sure we were taken care of, but not too much to be bothersome. He came up with excellent suggestions and made my 7 year old feel special and that his opinion mattered. The only thing I would change is the dessert for the 3 course meal was supposed to be similar to a s'more, but really was a glorified chocolate pudding with a pinch of Graham crackers and a toasted marshmallow, for a restaurant of this caliber I expected a little more, but I still ate it as I like chocolate pudding.

5mViiI7fR_S0U2NzfvphLw.text: This is our favorite restaurant because of Paul! The best service every time we visit. The food is the best and always cooked to perfection! The managers are excellent and take pride in their restaurant. Ask for Paul the number 1 server in the restaurant! Thank you, James

TLgZwleFbeAF6_GQwflnog.text: We decided to have an early Valentine's Day dinner...hubby has to work on Thursday.  We haven't been here in a while, so we were looking forward to a very nice steak dinner, and we weren't disappointed.  To start, hubby got the chopped salad, and he loved the vinaigrette dressing on it.  I went with the lobster bisque, and it was amazing!!  The huge pieces of lobster were so tender, it was divine.  We both had the filet mignon, I got the herbed horseradish butter on it, and they were both melt-in-your-mouth perfect.  The seasoning was on point, and the knife literally slid through them, like they were going through butter.  As our sides, hubby chose the Fleming's potatoes (he loved them) and I got the rainbow carrots, which are slightly carmelized and cooked in garlic butter.  To end the meal, hubby got the key lime pie (which he orders wherever they have it) and they served it with a side of chantilly cream.  Our server was Megan, who was attentive, knowledgeable and friendly.    I am really looking forward to our next special night out, so we can head back here again...everything was so delicious!!

ss2tbsLEXtHdsdpvBpZONg.text: Great place Rather expensive and you would expect that  Everything was very good Chefs special was a great call

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States

belSXXE7nMRLrqnaQz-PxQ.text: Always have a great time when we dine here. Ethan our server took great care of us. The manager even helped de-shell our lobster. Foley's were cooked perfectly and the creamed spinach,lobster Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes really filled in the gaps.

l2QPP8BYFXTatDAEnp8isg.text: Fleming's provided us with a phenomenal experience and incredible service, complemented by an exquisite meal. My wife and I enjoy our walk on the fine dining side from time to time and were pleased with our dinner at this locations. While Fleming's missed nothing in their performance this night, I can't say they "wowed" me to the point to give a full five stars. Steaks and deserts were extremely well prepared, but I was underwhelmed with the side of asparagus.   We enjoyed the special evening, and may return, but there are likely other options in the Phoenix area I would venture to first before coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Table setting. Beautiful steak knives.
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Filet Mignon* 8 Oz. Wonderfully prepared!

dpA6r8nfWy_JijnMO8uXJw.text: Let me qualify this review, Flemings is our favorite steak house in San Diego.  There is little variation in quality of food or service, down town location to La Jolla.   The food was perfect at this AZ location.  Flawless and hot.  The wine is 4X market price, if you got one glass of wine, you paid Bevmo bottle price.  The service is not what we experience in other Flemings locations.  Our server, although he did accommodate our request, had a flat affect, and very slow service.  We weren't in a hurry, our service was not the quality that we are accustomed to.  When we spend nearly $500 for our meals, our service should include smile and personality.  We had neither.  We certainly will continue to go to our favorite Flemings restaurants in the locations that give us more than perfect dining experiences.   Probably not return to this location.  PS:  After giving this review more thought, it actually wasn't the waiters fault for our slow to no service.  Actually the Flemmings in San Diego have two servers, or a server and a helper on each table.  We've never felt over served, just attentive service.

nzjg7BgwBM9a-ufF85LoqA.text: From start to finish this place did not disappoint. I'm really upset I didn't get any pictures of the food but that is because it was so good I had to devour it immediately. From the moment we walked through the door we were greeted with such a pleasant experience. Our host Alex was extremely friendly and accommodating. Our server Thomas was very friendly and extremely efficient. We ordered a Caesar to split before the meal and it was very tasty! Then we all ordered filets. All of the steaks came out perfectly cooked and extremely juicy. I ordered the lobster Mac and cheese as a side and that could have been a meal by itself. The presentation of the lobster Mac was awesome with the lobster tail as a decoration on the plate. I can't say enough on how positive our whole experience was and I can't wait to go back! I didn't even mention the wine... the wine was so smooth and decently priced! Thank you for such a wonderful experience!

YjWJ0byG8Hp_bW2GpCiBOg.text: I love Fleming's. My husband and I have been on a quest to find the best steak in the Valley, and so far Fleming's is it for us! Service is typically great, and in the few instances where it wasn't stellar, we've always had the opportunity to tell a manager because one stops by every. single. time. you visit. (Love!) and they always do what they need to in order to make it right.   My ONLY complaint with Fleming's is that their mashed potatoes are terrrrrrrible. Their texture is like glue. Like - really bad. I mean, the cafeteria at my work has better mashed potatoes. Bad. It seems a bit sacrilegious for a steakhouse to have bad mashed potatoes, so this always makes me feel just a wee bit sad. I would encourage them to meet up with the J&G Steakhouse folks to see how they keep their mashed potatoes light, fluffy and buttery, and then this would be the absolute perfect steakhouse experience. :)

AaZO3YrZOHIyotnL_gLuYA.text: Every quarter, a friend and I have been getting together for the past 3 years to hit Fleming's Happy Hour for a burger and a glass of beer or wine (house wine or beer special).  Nothing extra, nothing fancy. We have been there enough that with tax and 20% tip the bill should come to maximum $30 for one (the burger is $15 I think--pricey visit, but hey! located middle of where we both are coming from).   Never had any problems with our bill till our last visit when I looked at my credit card and saw the visit was $56--which means a waiter/bartender tacked himself an extra big, fat tip of $25 on my card. Maybe it's cause I was using a black card and he foolishly thought I didn't go thru my receipts or maybe it's cause we are seniors and he assumes (like too many younger men) that we are old and doddery and would go thru credit card statements but I do.  Religiously.  My credit card company took off $25 off the bill, Flemings didn't dispute it nor did they attempt to contact me to find out why--but I know one thing:  we won't be going back to Fleming's ever again no matter where they are located.   See how you can ruin your reputation and business with greedy waiters and bartenders?  Same thing happened to my son recently at Carrabba's, also, but Capitol One credit card actually caught that huge added tip, called him and Carrabba's sent him a $25 credit for there.  We will be going back to Carrabba's--but Flemings?  Hell, NO!

oyX01KFQGqCOXGntsMTRzg.text: Ok, I decided to give Fleming's another chance. It was my birthday and Chase the manager of the restaurant called me and told me to please come in so we did.  It was the Garth Brooks concert tonight and it was packed.  I had the most fantastic waiter Brad Estridge.  I am serious, I have never had such a great experience.  The manager Alex came over and made sure everything was to our satisfaction.  I have to say, I will always ask for Brad, he went beyond and made my birthday so special.  Thank you Chase.

uUZ_i1wgS79e5cdq2X-Wwg.text: When I went to Arizona this was considered the best of the best for their steaks. They were so right! I had the aged rib eye steak and the meat was so juicy! The BBQ shrimp was to die for. I felt they should of created a dip for the spicy sauce of the shrimp.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Steak and love!

MXuBwgAKK9MyVLlrp8dplg.text: Very disappointing. I've eaten here before and remember it being very good. We went to celebrate my birthday (party of 4). My daughter and I each ordered a glass of wine - same size but mine came out larger and we were charged for the larger size but after pointing it out when the bill came they corrected it. 3 of us ordered their special steak meal with crab "legs" all medium. All 3 steaks were different doneness. The crab leg was barely a few small bites. The hassle beck potato was overcooked and barely edible.  My son ordered the wagu beef meal - not very tasty and he ordered it med rare and it was more well done. The dessert was nothing special. For $75 a person with only 2 glasses of wine ..so not worth it.

T2y22NXai3H94AohG-kyDg.text: We are not from Phoenix and decided to give Fleming's a try for our anniversary celebration. We were not disappointed. Our server was Steve and he did an excellent job. In fact everyone was very friendly and helpful. The steaks were cooked to perfection and the Fleming potatoes are a must have. The chocolate lava cake is to die for. Excellent in all ways.

gZ_5N2DwOPjxUtEEJC8s3g.text: This place is so fancy! We got some gift cards from a coworker and it was a fabulous event! Very romantic even though we had our newborn with us. It's True we did see a fruit fly or two but nothing worse than my own kitchen ;-) the food was good and the atmosphere even better! We sat in one of the big round booths and enjoyed it immensely!! Our waitress was very sweet and took excellent care of us!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Birthday dinner! Yum!

2P_d8afb47ClyBwlhc2S_A.text: We went back twice since this review  and it was a little better. There is  serious  problem with the timing of the food. Again, I got my salad much much earlier than my husband. We tried the Chilean sea bass and it was ruined by the southwestern broth, not to our liking and we were sad to see most of the dry aged steaks have been removed from the menu. Not really liking the new menu items.

bsPcCh1KT-uwJeZUgA9Byw.text: Great Restaurant- Great Food- however the service was a bit slow for a high end Restaurant and for a $240+ tab for just 2 people I would have expected better

gAXy80Avreb0oFfDVmb5Dg.text: My new favorite place! Bartenders are awesome and super friendly! I m not so sure about the bar food but dinner was great. I m giving it 4 stars because I returned my steak for being over cooked. They nicely offered to make another and was good. I enjoyed it! My favorite is the chocolate martini shot with a truffle! Amazing! It's a perfect desert!

pKARp7MGbAxPEcvMpNxByQ.text: Went here on a date and had a great time. The atmosphere and decor was very classy. When I entered the restaurant I was greeted immediately and sat down at a booth.  I received a wine list on an ipad and I thought that was pretty neat.  Vincent was our server he was very knowledgeable on the different cuts of meat an told us all the great deals that were going on. We chose to get an appetizer which was the BBQ shrimp which was amazing!! The sauce just melted in your mouth!! I got the taste of season entree and my date got a steak that he loved with a side of potatoes.  We had four different people stop by our table to make sure everything was ok. We overall had an amazing time and the food was great. The prices are up there but worth it. We want to check out the happy hour, it looked like a bunch of good deals.

Z-06GlG4frsQuamAP1XjNQ.text: We love this place!  It is our anniversary and special event spot.  Staff is friendly and knowledgable, food is consistently excellent!   I have found new favorite wines from their list and I began adding glazed pecans to my salad at home!  The prime rib is tender, juicy, and delicious.  Their food leaves an impression!  It's pricey, but a great spot for a fancy dinner date!

OgKTRYiwoWq1ZkjDVHpqxA.text: So disappointed! We made reservations to celebrate my birthday, first time out in a long time..... Show up at 6:55 to be told the reservation was for yesterday and it would be a 30-45 minute wait. After showing the women the email confirmation I was told "technology makes mistakes" we are full and will get you back soon. Very sad excuse Flemings, but that's ok.... I will go take my money where it is appreciated!

PC7sKt79RLw9BsIIKJwK1Q.text: My parents and I came here for the first time to celebrate Father's Day. Upon walking in, I immediately liked the decor and atmosphere. We had made a reservation and were promptly seated. Our waitress was very attentive and the food was delicious. I will definitely return!

7IT3DR7-BA82s6SYSSqs8Q.text: Great atmosphere, the service was phenomenal. I had the Aged ribeye and Shanna had the Surf and Turf. Food was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Surf and Turf, delicious.

WO-uYayrBMZzv1Mv4SpHSA.text: Love going to Fleming's for their happy hour (5-6-7).  $7 wine and great appetizers.  We typically have the bacon cheeseburger for dinner, which is the same as the regular menu item for half the price.  As usual, food was great the and the service was stellar.  Thumbs up to Charles...he really took care of us.  We will certainly be back.

mbQtRrTiTDEkGyA1x42dxg.text: We looked up a Steak House that would be different from the typical or only other options that were available in Surprise . I'm the one that looked it up on Yelp and their Website, well...Let me tell you! As they say in Texas, big hat, no cattle . Our steak was horrendously salty, my wife had steak and lobster tail, she normally is very liberal with salt, she complained how salty it was... Very disappointed as I was celebrating my 60th birthday, I thought myself to wait a few days before posting a review, so I have an opportunity to cool off and don't come out with guns blasting. The reason that I gave it 2 stars is because the steak was tender and the ambiance was ok, the service was just ok. The fact that management would not even offer a birthday cake for the guy picking up the bill is appalling...after all the other people would also order something else...hello?! Anyway, I have learned that in business it's easier to keep a client than get a new one. I would insist in not going even if I was a guest, save you money and go some place else, they obviously don't have a qualified Chef in the kitchen.

VZX0Fd0C2taWssl8tBPMxA.text: I feel a bit snobby with this review but my experience was so-so with Fleming's. It wasn't awful, I just had expectations that they were unable to fulfill.    So why only 3 stars?  For starters the hostess wasn't that personable and barely looked at us.  We walked up and were immediately met with a very curt, "Hello, do you have a reservation?" We did have a reservation and were seated immediately.  Yes, I know it's a bit picky for me to point out but If I am spending $250 for dinner you better believe I feel I deserve a bit more eye contact and a smile.    They made sure to have a gluten free menu available for me and the fact they had their wine list on an ipad was kind of cool.  :)    Our waiter, Jeff, was very attentive and quite helpful.  He wasn't pushy but still made sure he was around enough to follow up with us throughout the night.  I guess the only "coaching" I would have for him was that he didn't remember I  could not have any of the food with wheat in it.  He proceeded to recommend the chocolate lava cake to us 2 times.  We told him after the first time it has wheat in it, no.  He asked again later on to which we reminded him that we could not and why.    The appetizer was good but it was obvious the sauce for the appetizer was reheated from a microwave.  The salad was great.  The steak- meh.  The only reason why it gets a "meh" is because it was not cooked right.  Seasoning was good, it was a great cut, they just didn't cook it to my specifications.  I asked for medium, I got medium rare.  I didn't say anything though because I was starving and ate most of it anyways, although I left quite a bit on my plate (a lot of the rare parts.)   The restaurant did feel very "chain-y."  Like a glorified, expensive, Macaroni Grill but a steak house version.  But then again I knew what I was getting into when I suggested the place for Valentine's weekend.  I knew it was a chain, that some of the food would not be made from scratch and was reheated-microwaved-processed-at-a-central-kitchen food, but the reviews made me still want to give it a shot.   If you are really into chain restaurants (Olive Garden, Macaroni Grill, Claim Jumper, etc.) and wanted a higher end chain restaurant experience, then definitely check them out.  If you are more of a foodie and like a fine dining experience where other patrons get that fine dining attire is not jean-shorts, where dishes are fresh and from scratch, I suggest avoiding.

HGcomYCkGp0YuSHUQpeyUg.text: Came here for happy hour with my housemates, which is a really good deal at $6/appetizer.  We sat out on the patio which was quiet and relaxing.  Unfortunately for myself, I ordered the crispy pork belly which wasn't so crispy and it was 98% pure fat.  I guess I should have known that already, but it didn't even taste good.  I ended up leaving about a third of the dish on the plate.  My housemates, however, were smarter and ordered the burger which is also $6 and that looked delicious.  I had food envy all night.  Although I'm sure the burger was good, I'm still giving 2 stars because I think everything on their menu should be just as good.

Q0WhQ6KzSit53nv5wOU8KA.text: We dined here a couple nights ago for early Valentine's Day. She ordered a petite sirloin with the Flemings potatoes. She wasn't wild about the potatoes but her steak was cooked to her preference. I would have liked to see some char and grill marks. I had the sirloin with the scallops. Steak was 5 oz and very good but the scallops were very disappointing as the 3 were about the size of a quarter, much smaller than the scallops I buy from Sams or Fry's. They appeared to be pan seared but had very little color. Service by our waitress only, seemed to be lacking but the rest of the staff picked up for her. All in all it was a pretty good dinner for $175 for the 2 of us. We don't do this often as our steaks over mesquite at home rock too

zTDk4cpiDdENcGelEHc5MA.text: Oh my goodness, what a wonderful first-time at Fleming's in Peoria!  It was a gorgeous mid-Feb evening, so the 3 of us passed on sitting in the inviting and tastefully decorated bar/dining area (busy but comfortable) and chose a table on the patio.    The wait staff welcomed us with with smiles, water, menus, and great home-made potato chips. Drinks were ordered and we perused the menu without feeling rushed. However,  the waitress was at the table in a jiffy to answer questions and when we were ready, take our order.    Dinner was divine!  We shared the delicious Heirloom tomato and beet salad and ordered rib eyes and filet mignon.  The steaks were wonderful: tender, and well-seasoned. And our sides, Fleming's potatoes and creamed spinach, were tasty and garnished nicely.    When coffee was ordered,  I off-hand mentioned to the waitress that we were celebrating my dad's 89th birthday.  So were surprised when the coffee was served with a complimentary mini-box of chocolate truffles - a perfect dessert for a perfectly memorable evening.  Fleming's is pricey but provides a good dining experience.  Our service was great and the dinner was delicious.  The ambiance is sophisticated but comfortable with an attention to detail that makes this chain restaurant a standout.  Finally, this Fleming's is conveniently located for those on the far west end of the Phoenix metro area who don't want the long drive to downtown Phoenix or Scottsdale.  Looking forward to dining at Fleming's again!

xZIhSpCqGxChuTt3v2SjtQ.text: Phenomenal service and food. Charity was our waitress and she killed it. She checked in regularly and was so attentive. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a top shelf steak and seafood selection.

hJZZAtSZPDcd6Iq3UaEW4A.text: The absolutely Best Service and Best Food !  Not 1 thing to complain about.  First had cocktail at bar, then seated at reservation time.  Ashley was a wonderful waitress.  Pork belly, omg!   French Onion soup, perfection.  Flemings potato potatoes a must.  Asparagus perfect and NY strip was melt in your mouth delicious!  Coffee and berries and cream dessert was wonderful!

5EOTp81xTDr50NdHZ6uqBw.text: We have eaten at Flemings in Glendale many times, usually dropping $200-$300 for an evening for 4.  This evening we went to just have a prime burger in the bar. The chips that were given out were cool and very greasy.  The fries that came with the burger were cool and very greasy as if they had been laying out for some time.  I ordered my burger without a bun since I have a wheat allergy and it was as greasy as the fries.  I had one bite and didn't eat the rest.  A great disappointment. It will be a while before we go back.

ZmW_eXW-7seDOAwJehfayg.text: Had dinner here a few nights ago. It was very busy but the hostess and our server Allie did a great job and were very attentive throughout the evening. Our steaks were done perfectly and the side of sauteed onions was terrific. A bit pricy but know that going in. On this night, it was well worth it.

sYeD-p0XUInuspAQzDi1ug.text: Went to Fleming's to celebrate our anniversary and was not disappointed!  Steaks to perfection, and wonderful staff.  The manager even gave us a $25 gift card as an anniversary present!

umXt3vUyBRlaqVa5cOvDgA.text: Excellent dinner! Excellent service. Had the piccino filet cooked to perfection. Service was very friendly and professional. She knew how to strike up a conversation and make you feel good.    Little hint- don't eat too much of the great bread   -  you'll ruin your appetite!

pAJiPVZ4sc2g_svAcTPBrQ.text: Sides were delish... Cuts of meat were good, cooked my steak a little over a med-rare... But my prime rib was good... And on Sundays they have a prime rib dinner special... Creme brulee was great too...

LxMdXjPeocKkwLJ0ngLjiw.text: When we dined at the Chandler location, we had an utterly excellent experience, and we stoked to hear that they would soon be opening a location at the new Park West center in Peoria.   We checked it out soon after it opened, and of course, it's a clone of their other location. Though the service wasn't quite as stellar, it was still very nice.   Being unemployed, and dining on someone else's ticket, I went cheap this time and got the cheapest entree on the menu -- the beef Flemington. It's basically a beef wellie.  Unfortunately, it arrived woefully overcooked. Our server graciously offered to have a new one made for me. The second one was also overdone, just not as badly. I was hungry, so I didn't say anything. Nonetheless, they took it off of our bill.   However, everything else was perfect. I will chalk up those couple of things as an off-day, or perhaps they hadn't quite ironed out the wrinkles yet. I'll need to check back after they've been open for a year or so.

GfLB4HXnNeAMYOiEFxVbuA.text: Great place for Happy Hour or to spend a special night. Staff is always pleasant and food/drinks are excellent. Never disappointed.

s-6hH47o_HYoRl9c8aSH2w.text: The service, staff, food and drink are fantastic. We rarely make it out of the bar into the dining room since Chase, Susie & Kate take such good care of their customers. If you don't see it on the menu Chef Jeff will do what he can to whip it up for you.   The Happy Hour rocks and everything else on the menu will blow you away.

E7GyUHo2wrSXvLvbuXF60g.text: This place gets one star because of the service expected for these prices and the service and food received. We had a dining credit through an email and a gift card given by flemings from a previous birthday visit. Called ahead to make sure that we could use both together. This was my first visit and my boyfriend's second. Will not be going back!! The waitress spent most at her time at the table next to us and was not very personable at all. I work in a restaurant, so I don't expect her to kiss my feet but at least try to be a little less cold when I am paying 40 for a steak (not including a side). Bad service can ruin the whole meal. Our drinks were often empty, the bread that they serve while the spreads are very good, you need superman strength to cut through the crust on the bottom (with a steak knife). I had the filet and salmon from the two course summer menu. My steak was tasty, but as soon as I got to the thicker part of my salmon, I could tell right away that it was undercooked. Let the waitress know and instead of letting me finish my steak, she took the whole plate and I sat there watching my boyfriend eat his steak. To make up for it the manager offered a free dessert, now who will make up for our server's crappy attitude????  When we tried to pay, our server informed us that we could not use two promotions together, and I told her that I called ahead of time. She had to check with the manager, came back to the table for the check and I asked what the manager said "Oh I forgot to ask him, hold on". Really it was a Monday night not busy at all. Manager said he would honor it this one time, I informed our server to tell the hostess about their policies. You are paying a champagne budget and getting Mcdonalds service. If you want better food and service for your money go to The Yard House in Westgate.

zrxbQPbXAnletYIcBUP_TQ.text: Great service, good food, solid menu, fair wine list... I'd go again

9bcBVm6ON6antmwfcsk3ow.text: Had a private business lunch here yesterday. Was really delicious! Highly impressed with the fillet of Oscar. I had never tried that fish before but the waiter recommended it and he was spot on. Flemming's did it right!

er4PveCP8E4YVvM2_iWTIQ.text: After my first visit on Valentine's day, I'm underwhelmed.  My wife has been to Flemming's so many times that she has literally ordered everything on the menu. It's one of her favorite restaurants, in no small part because steak is one of her favorite things.  After my last Valentine's day experience at Bella Luna, I have lowered my expectations for Valentine's day service. But why can't we just go to the Four Seasons every year? I digress.  So we made our reservation three or four weeks in advance and arrived a few minutes early. It took 10 - 15 minutes to be seated, which gave us time to walk around outside and take some self portraits in our dressy clothes.  They seated us in an awkward two-person table that is nestled in the corner of one of their half-walls.  Okay, time-out. If your restaurant has fewer than 5% of your tables in the tiny, two-person variety, then you shouldn't have them at all. Stop screwing us over! The table wasn't even large enough to lay a single closed menu on. Look, if you're one of those tiny French restaurants with only fuck-you tables, then fine. I'll chalk it up to French peculiarities. But when we are the only couple at a restaurant in a two person table, well, I start dropping stars and f-bombs.  Okay, so our server was pleasant, but the food and service came slow. At the end of the meal he gave us his business card and asked us to visit again. We also received a a $25 gift card for eating over V-day weekend, and received a thank-you e-mail the next day that I found to be a pleasant surprise.  The food was good, although I wish they had the V-day blue-cheese crusted fillet Mignon all the time, and not just on one day a year. Bread was nice, wine selection was good. No beer on tap, but I understand it's a steakhouse. Not much else to say, other than looking forward to using the $25 gift card on our next visit.

T0FHnMyJs5TvWy7Bm910JQ.text: Great food, service was good as well. Went for my GFs birthday and they added a litttle extra touch for letting them know as much.

h30Qj6jdDSdP5dcyxUbHGA.text: Great place to celebrate a romantic or special occasion.  Fresh oysters, wonderful wine list and amazing service.  Not a place to bring children.

1qhE49EKQIz_7auLSFQbYA.text: The 11 oz. medium-well fillet was by far the best I have had, hands down.  The green beans were meh, but the garlic mashed potatoes were delicious.  A few Crown and Cokes and viola, $$$$, lol.  Expensive but worth it.  Will definitely be back.  Wonderful atmosphere, service, and most importantly, food.

7DP_2xqtZkCxutFibpGwyA.text: I received a $50 gift Cert from my work as a Christmas gift and I couldn't wait to try this place as I have heard good reviews from friends. My Girlfriend and I had a reservation for 6 pm, and it arrived about 5 minutes late, got stuck behind a stupid train near Grand... Grrr. but they had the table ready for as soon as we got there.  The Server was Awesome the whole night, There was another person assisting the waiter as well with refills and bread, he was also awesome. The bread & butter are AWESOME, they serve the freshly baked bread with 2 butters, if I remember right I think he said it was tomato butter and a feta butter, they were both SO good, I couldn't choose a winner, they are both great for different reasons.  We opted to get the Special they are running, the Sunday Prime Rib Dinner, it includes a Salad, Prime Rib with 1 side and a dessert, all for $29.99 a person. It was SUCH a good deal for this service level and quality of food. Normally just a steak at this place is $35-45 without anything else included.   My GF doesn't like salad too much so we asked if we could pay more and get a soup, and he said actually the French onion soup can be swapped at no extra charge, Or you can get the special soup of the day Lobster Bisque for an extra $5 , my GF ordered the French Onion, and I got the lobster Bisque. Both soups were AWESOME, there was a LOT of lobster in this soup, they don't skimp out. It was a great creamy soup, and the French onion was enjoyed very much by my GF, it had a LOT of cheese  on it, which she loves, it's her favorite part of course.  Within about 3 minutes of finishing the soup, the Prime Rib arrived, And we were both impressed with how big it was ! they don't hold back here ! it came with Au jus of course, and also a wonderful creamy horseradish sauce, and also a mustard horseradish sauce that was good, but I prefer the other one more.  We both ordered the Prime Rib to be cooked to Medium, and it was PERFECT medium. We both LOVED this Prime rib, it was fork, or even Spoon tender, really no need for a knife because the beef was so tender.  I ordered the Flemings Potatoes for my side, which are VERY thin sliced  potatoes layered with a cream sauce, cheese and jalapenos, but it's not spicy at all, just the flavor of the jalapenos, then it is topped with cheese and baked, it was AWESOME. My GF got the Garlic mashed potatoes, it was a bowl of Mashed Taters topped with a bunch of roasted garlic that you mix in, she loved them, I tried a bite and they were good also, just not as good as mine !  We both could not finish, I have probably at least half my Meat left, probably more than half and about 2/3 of the potatoes are left.   It came with Dessert also, they told us it came with a White Chocolate bread pudding, and my GF doesn't like bread pudding usually so he said she could replace with any of the other desserts and there was no charge for this. She opted for the Chocolate Lava Cake, but he told is will take about 20 minutes for that dessert, he asked if that was okay and we said yes. it actually took less time than that, it wasn't a long wait at all. The Bread pudding was INSANELY good, it wasn't super mushy like normal bread pudding, this was caramelized on the bottom of the bread portion, it was basically little dice sized cubes of bread, in a dome shape placed on top of a puddle of delicious creamy vanilla and white chocolate sauce, they also brought the table a bowl of Chantilly vanilla whipped cream, you KNOW that was good.  This is bread pudding for people who dont normally like bread pudding. If you try a bite of this, and you DONT like it, there is something wrong with you ! My Lady enjoyed her Chocolate Lava cake, it was much larger than mine, it came with the cake, a big scoop of ice cream in an awesome little crisp type of sugar cookie, and also a little pot of chocolate sauce, she loved it and was very happy with it.  I tried hers as well, I also liked it but I liked mine a little bit better.   I don't drink Alcohol at all, and my Gf didn't feel like drinking so it was Mango Iced tea for both of us, and they never let it get empty.    Over all it was pretty much the perfect dining experience, I couldn't even say one thing that went bad or that we didn't enjoy. It was my first time, but clearly won't be my last ! and to make sure of that, on the receipt they gave us an offer, if we go to their website and tell them how the experience was, they will give us a $25 dining credit for our next reservation there. So we will be back FOR SURE ! and Hopefully SOON !  Next time the Bone in Rib eye is all mine !

avHuSykKpNaLGx1gniF3qA.text: Good location within the somewhat upper scale Park West complex. The exterior of Flemings is nice although not all that impressive but the interior is very nicely done with deep warm colors that contrast with the white table settings. Everything ordered was excellent. The BBQ shrimp appetizer was tasty prepared with top quality shrimp. The NY strip was easily one of the best steaks I have had the pleasure of eating. The mushrooms and garlic mash were excellent companions as well. We closed with creme brulee with Chantilly whip and a glass of desert wine. The total was just under $200 including tip, my wife's filet and two cocktails. The service was also excellent. All considered I was happy with what I received for the money. I will be back.

9wLvy-Fz0ajCtNyzwtafpA.text: Cooper in the Bar was wonderful! Great service and food was delicious.

Kt7PimcNdlpKuxdnDv6UGQ.text: We went to Fleming's for date night and had a wonderful time. Our server was very attentive and the food came out cooked to order and timed correctly. We both had filets and shared Fleming's potatoes and grilled corn for the side. They have an excellent drink menu and impressive wine list. The wine list is on an iPad at the table, and show recommended food pairings.  We shared carrot cake for dessert - so wonderful!  This is one of our favorite restaurants and we usually eat here every 3 - 4 months. The service has always been excellent, with a nice personal (but not fake) touch.

cvQQMJg5hRIQESyBiphO8g.text: My husband and I checked out Flemings for happy hour on Friday night before going to see "Book of Eli". It was pretty busy that evening (the line was out the door when we left at 7:30), but our service at the bar was fine and we didn't have to wait long for our drinks or food. The only negative about how busy Flemings was the evening was that people were seat hawking around the bar, which is a tad annoying.  The happy hour deal at Flemings is "5 for $6 until 7". You can pick from five martinis, 5 wines by the glass, and 5 appetizers. The food is really where you are getting the deal. For drinks, there are a hundred happy hours in the Valley with better drink deals. My husband's Fat Tire beer was also $6 which is a ripoff since he gets it cheaper at other bars that we have been to. I did try two of the martinis on the happy hour list - the Margatini and Tropical Breeze. I'll admit that I like the "girly" martinis over classic ones, so both of the ones I had at Flemings were right up my alley and I really enjoyed them. We ordered three of the appetizers from the happy hour list - the calamari, crab cakes, and shrimp. The calamari was decent, but it actually needed salt because it was pretty bland. Also, it needed more of the sweet chili sauce as there was practically none on any of the pieces. I didn't try the shrimp, but my husband said they were fine. Nothing to write home about, but not bad. The crab cakes were definitely the highlight of the evening - by far the best crab cakes I have had in the Valley. They were practically perfection.   3.5 stars, but I'm rounding down to three because the happy hour deal is good for food (not so much for drinks) and nothing I tried aside from the crab cakes makes me want to have a full dinner at Flemings.

YvOeadsGEA2S-ompep7hNg.text: I had a great dining experience here. I came here for a private dining event, so as soon as we let the hostesses know what we were there for, we were ushered into a private dining room. We felt like such VIPs!  The decor and ambiance is very fancy, yet understated.  The service was great and the food was amazing!  Our hosts had already chosen a set menu for us, although we were able to choose our entree from a list of three. I chose the petite filet mignon. Tender, juicy, flavorful steak. It was fantastic. We were also served creamed spinach and parmesan and peppercorn mashed potatoes. Everything was scrumptious and cooked to perfection.  The cheesecake dessert was hands down the best part of dinner. I had to physically force myself to stop eating it. It had a crisp graham cracker crust, fresh blueberry sauce, rich cream cheese filling, and white chocolate shavings. Amazing!  As a starving grad student, this restaurant is a little bit rich for my blood, but I'd surely come back for a special occasion. 5 stars.

a921qbKcsqX4nZHmHDZNtA.text: My wife and I looked forward to dinner here, thanks to restaurant week.  She had never been to Flemings, we normally go to Capital Grille or Donovans.   The evenings started off problematic, as this looks like no high-end steakhouse.  The tables were densely packed (too many tables) and there was a dull roar to the main dining room, and the side rooms were no better.  The service.  The waitress took our order, two filet mignons medium rare, sides for me spinach and greenbeans, the wife potatoes and greenbeans.  A bottle of Titus Vinyards Andronicus to go with.  She asked if we would like the bottle decanted, which of course we said yes, expecting her to come back with it and open it.  Nope, first she brought the wrong bottle of wine.  Second she didn't bring the bottle until after our salads.  The entree comes out and the runner informs us of one medium rare filet and one medium. Huh?  And the sides are identical, spinach and greenbeans.  After this correction we eat, it's just OK. (I am sitting down to a Fry's filet as I write this and it's better).  We finish our  entrees and are looking forward to the desert (which we ordered at the start), but it took her 20 minutes to bring out.  Very disappointing evening, we won't be going back.

gvFBJfg2p9zeqlixtgMefg.text: WOW, talk about an awesome steak.  We had reservations and were seated within minutes.  Nice decor, not really a place I'd take my toddler to but it was date night after all and the kiddo was at home - yippee!    But I digress.  I don't know much about wine but it looked like a pretty large selection and you can go through them either on the menu or on the iPad.  Way cool.    We both got rib eye - the hubby with bone mine without - his rare, mine medium well and he said that his was perfection. Mine was, too.    It didn't come with any sides so we shared a side of mashed potatoes.  The only thing I'd dock them a few points for is the food is really expensive.  I guess I can understand why my rib eye was almost $50 but $10 for a side of mashed potatoes?  Eeesh.  You can't go wrong getting a badass piece of juicy mouth watering steak here but I don't think I would come here for a while.  A $165 meal is probably something we do once every several years.  See you again in a few more years Flemings.  It was nice meeting you!  (It was our first time coming here)

YWnL5yPqnBtxr2Nvo9oeuA.text: Outstanding steak and service. Yes it is pricy but well worth the treat. I would recommend this steak house in any city!

9l3FeKVjaE8ssBAQb2rYiQ.text: I thought it was OK.  For the prices I have experienced much better steaks at both Morton's and Donovan's.  I have the 14oz Bone In Filet.  It was $64.  It had a random crab cake on top which I promptly removed.  The steak was good, but not as flavorful as I would have hoped.  The Flemings potatoes were amazing and I would recommend them.  We also ordered the Lava Cake.  Again, it was OK.  The cake was a tad dry and it was already open when we got it.  I expected more from them honestly.  Service was really good and place was clean.  They were playing younger hip hop music which I found inappropriate and awkward.   We will likely return back to Morton's or Donovan's for our Steak nights.

Hu3PSBJPN_eHzu75z_dsRg.text: Came here for the first time with some lovely ladies for steak and cocktails after work one night and it was amazing!  What can I say about such a superb place?  Our waitress was the most cheerful and sweetest lady ever.  Even when we were mulling and being indecisive over which cocktails to get, she gave friendly suggestions on what's delicious [she has excellent recommendations --- I wish I remember her name].  We all had the prime rib and every steak came out cooked perfectly.  Not exactly up to Mr. W's steak-perfection but the closest thing to a perfectly cooked steak prepared by another person.    Even though we wandered in a little after 9PM on a weekday, we were given such great service and a really satisfying meal.  I would definitely be back!

kFMoe5x7AN7szSbDvEmZ2Q.text: Went here for a Friday happy hour. Go early, because it gets busy! We first started off in the bar, at a rather high table. I asked about a lower table, but was told happy hour is just in the bar. (The booths were all taken). After more people arrived, they opened up seating in a room off of the large dinning room. Our waitress was kind enough to offer us a table in that room. (Why not seat people there to begin with, if the bar is full, and someone is more comfortable with a lower table. My Mom at 5 feet tall, does not do well on high bar stools.) Now in nice comfy chairs!   So was not able to find a happy hour menu anywhere. Not on line, even stopped by to pick up a menu, but they do not give out "Happy Hour" menus. Gladly give you a copy of their main menu. Really??  Two different happy hours, think the hours were 5-7. Certain items on that menu, and 8-10. Not 100% sure on the times. We were at the early one, ordered calamari, which was very good. A type of spreadable cheese, and toasted bread. We also ordered lobster wraps, but paid regular price for them, since they are featured on the later happy hour. Price difference was just a few dollars. They were good, but I don't think I would order them again. They featured burgers on both happy hours. They were very, very good. Done perfectly. Order medium, get medium! Choice of three different cheeses, and lettuce, tomatoes, and onion on the side. Reasonable prices. Birthday celebration, was given a box of truffles with a candle. Very nice gesture! Wait staff was nice, especially tentative at filling water glasses!  It seems quite a few people enjoy dinning in this establishment, when we were leaving the dinning room was getting pretty busy.

U9dU50gwSq-CQvgRNkwV7Q.text: Disappointing. While the filet was good, and cooked a perfect medium rare, the Chipotle mac n cheese was somehow undercooked, with bits of hard pasta throughout. the double cut fries (what does that even mean?) were well seasoned and quite good. The wine list was extensive,  but lacking in French wines for my taste.  The main problem was service. while I was about to place my wine order, the server just turned and walked away. Seriously? Could you just let me put the order in and then do whatever it was you went off to do?

Gpfhzj3_bRh92hqf1wHVxA.text: Amazing experience. We wanted something special for our 5 year anniversary and this was exactly that! Food was beyond good, and service was above par. From the moment we walked in we were addressed by name and congratulated, to the anniversary card on the table after being seated, to the server addressing us by name. Food and service weren't rushed, which I loved as it gave us time to enjoy the evening. The manager Marc came by, addressed us by name and gave us a gift card for next time in congratulations. The server came over with a camera and took a picture, which we got in a frame with a box of truffles to take home. Such a small gesture and so thoughtful to commemorate something special to us. As we walked out the hostess once again addressed us by name and congratulated us. If you are look for upscale, white table cloth, dining, this is the place to go! We will be back :)

iLgqrgotuh3_LX8eSCk81g.text: One of the best steak dinners I've had in the Phoenix metro area. I appreciate attention to detail and this location did a great job of that. All of our food and drinks were delicious and well prepared. I loved the touches that were included: the drawn butter for my lobster, the chantilly cream with our creme brulee, and the decanter with the martinis. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because there were people in the restaurant wearing baseball caps on a Friday night eating dinner. I definitely don't expect to see that when having a $300 meal on date night.

GP6cfi0M0Rus3zzlmxXqhg.text: If you know food & wine, and if it's not spot on the experience is ruined, then don't go here.     Best have a reservation. Long wait for the bar even.  Thankfully we did have a res and a booth, as requested in the reservation.  Nice a la carte selections but the wine list was seriously lacking.  Lots of blends and over priced bottles but nothing that struck our fancy.  I settled on a Toso Malbec that was nice.  We both order starters, steaks and sides.   I sent back the lobster bisque. It tasted like starchy baby food.  Worse ever and at $14 for a little cup of it, it was surely going back.  Steaks were cooked perfectly but were unremarkable. The 'generous portion of king crab' atop my steak was a joke for the $14 additional price tag.  It was good but laughable after I specifically asked the waitress about the portion. I really wanted crab with my steak. It was just one bite worth of crab.    We enjoyed the wine, steaks and the Fleming's potatoes.  The bill was about $250 with tip and the waitress brought a box of truffles as a thank you for dining with them on Valentine's Day.   This is supposed to be a high-end steak house and we just didn't get it.  We've had so much better overall elsewhere.  I really wanted to like it but it feel short. I see where they pay attention to detail, push desserts and try to make you feel special but the food quality just wasn't there.

AsMkg8ysnvnt8dzRRjs5QQ.text: My parents and I visited Fleming's for Easter brunch. They were staffed well and everyone was very friendly and professional. Unfortunately the food was a tremendous disappointment...down to the dessert. We won't be coming back. What a shame as this was to be a special treat for my parents.

oUl6_lfq08F0ZMpcDSZr9g.text: So here is our story. Booked reservation online, arrived 45 early to have cocktail prior to dinner. Checked in with hostess to advise we would wait for reservations. Meanwhile line was forming. We drank our bottle of wine and beers while waiting for booth. We watched from bar area while several parties were served. We questioned the hostess as to why we continued to sit at bar while walk ins were being served. We were told that because we wanted a booth they were waiting on table to open. Note that almost an hour pasted we still had not been seated to our reservation. Finally I asked my fiancee to inquire. The hostest clearly had let our table(s) go.  We were seated about 10 mins after that in the floor area at at a table, when we were told previously our wait was because of a reservation for a booth, mind you several walk ins were seated prior to us. Okay meal time ( as reservation and dress don't mean anything here) we were presented with food for that was not indented for outnumbered table (calamary and pasta mushroom pasta) we explained we did not order and we don't eat bread (pasta/breading). The server simply left the order anyways because the manager wanted to make things right. So food Sat there unate. Finally we order our meal. We explained to server our issues with seating and food. He apologized and brought salad. While we waited for food. We  ordered steak and brussels (shared side). The steak was great the side was small and the bill was outrageous. Long story short. We dressed for this destination, made reservations for booth, arrived early. We did everything right and they did everything wrong. Not recommend for date night left upset and feeling discriminated. Not a good look Flemmings.

X_JBGuWU4GerZTB0L6HR2Q.text: Great Dinner, The King Crab legs were amazing and well priced!

LY3xJ3uSCNaRDlr5QZn5zQ.text: Monday night during spring training and the place was packed full of Dodgers and fans including 90 yo Lasorda! Made reservation for 7pm and got there a little before 7. They must have seated every walk up first as we waited 20 minutes for a table. Then when our steaks arrived they were all mixed up and none of the 4 of us got what we ordered cook temp wise. Seems the waiter Steve and the food delivery guys were not on the same page. His response was "I cant do everything". At least the manager voluntarily came by and comped our bottle of mid priced wine. When you have both food and service issues 3 stars is pretty good.

jRsDqy9105_24IkjGHDIxg.text: The service here is wonderful! They are attentive and very friendly.  The food is not special especially for the prices they charge. In fact we ordered the special lobster tail and filet which was very disappointing. The lobster tail was a poor quality flat piece of nothing.  The steak was good but nothing to rave about.  I would not recommend Fleming's and will not go there again.

029YqCx7IUm1DyLKS7vR3A.text: Hello my AZ peeps , if your looking for a great happy hour with great tasting food and prices then Flemings is the place to be , but there's a catch ,get there early right at 4 because this hot spot gets jacked packed !!!   If your looking to wine and dine be prepared it's pricey on the dinning side . As always don't take my word for it check it out for yourself !

gVs8yEBM8Mil06FPZMz5RQ.text: Hello first time and boy was I glad the atmosphere was top notch and the food was done just right great time with my family and will return another d

phnvMg9nJf8dfdbn9iz5Vg.text: For an upscale steakhouse, it was okay, but it was not great tonight.  We had a filet mignon which was good and a 14 ounce Ribeye which was not that good.  The Flemings potatoes were great.  The Flemings salad was terrific.  The asparagus was fine.  All in all, for over $150, it was okay, but it was not great.  The server was outstanding.

MkwBlT4WNqsEf2IWYdnOzw.text: Had thanksgiving dinner at this location,  to say the least, the turkey meat was dry anf cold, the saladbtasted old, the brie cheese bites where wet and foul.... The bread taste cheap! The sweet-potato mash potatoes where the only highlight of the meal.

I5fG2lUvR690ta9P60KJIQ.text: Great steak and service. Fleming's potato are really good . Dessert was the best part .

VRVAT95N1RfZkePICzO8MA.text: I was attending an educational dinner lecture in the conference room. The hostess put a dessert in my to go bag, then brought out a dessert to the table. I definitely don't need 2 desserts but it is definitely unsanitary to remove a dessert from a to go box and take back to kitchen for the next table to eat. In fact, my sister is a chef that was trained at the culinary institute. When I told her this, she was disgusted at this display of food. It's against health code violations to do this. I'll definitely will not be back knowing that my food maybe left over or re-used from another table.

HIuA9YMWoVAZ6Nc2EYfYHA.text: Food- Excellent steak and seafood varieties. I thought the filet mignon and scallop were delicious.  Lobster Mac and cheese was on the money. Diverse wine selection. My whiskey old fashioned was also top notch.   Service- was typical for a steakhouse. However there were some very nice  touches that made our visit more special. When we made a reservation they asked of we were celebrating anything and my wife mentioned that it was our anniversary.  There was a card at our table when we arrived signed by some of the management.  The manager also came by and gave us a $25 gift card for our next visit, and the server gave us a box or truffles on the way out.   Location- Outside of the main city but very nice building, plenty of parking, and right next to a cigar shop.  I skipped desert and got myself a fine hand rolled Nicaraguan cigar infused with honey.  Yes please!  Price- For Arizona I thought this place was a pricey, especially since its in the suburbs, however we had an excellent experience. There also isn't much competition at their location so they can charge a bit more since they probably aren't as busy as other steakhouses.

8Vz7CaqeClxlKZLcr0Rv_w.text: Went here for my birthday and had a great time. Our hostess was wonderful, precise, and informative about the food on the menu. I got crab cakes and the crab meat was succulent and filling. The brussell sprouts had bacon in them and very delicious. I would highly recommend this restaurant for birthdays, dinner, anniversary, or just a nice outing with friends. They also gave me a birthday card, a box or truffles, and a platter with fruit, truffles, and cake. I will be returning soon Flemings!!!!
