du7-yEzDNrMJFtnr2xQz5w.text: Ok will admit only one visit for our 24th anniversary and they went out of there way to make it great. food was great Steak to die for and service beyond approach but will go back for the 25th

U2wm_YWbIJtJuCzg1pD2gw.text: We have dinned at the Scottsdale Fleming, it was excellent service and outstanding food.  I was so dissapointed that this Glendale location does not measure up!  The decor and atompshere is there but just not the same.  Looks like it, doesn't feel like it.  We were greeted immedately and seated as our reserved table for 6 (Saturday night - before Mother's day).  The wine list was fancy (electronic tablet).    Our server was just NOT attentive at ALL and made the experience basically SUCK. -She never mentioned the specials for the day (the list on laying on the table, someone discovered it later) -She brought the wrong beverage -She has to come back to ask was we ordered because she couldn't read her handwriting -Never was around to grab her attention  Now to the food, two of our group stressed that they needed they meats cooked well done.  One of the filet mignons was to be butterflied to make sure it is well done and the other sliced filet migon was to be well done.  Well, the ladies got their filets and they are still oozing blood.  Come on a butterflied filet migon and a SLICED filet migon not well done?  Really???  Especially on the sliced one, when you slice it and see blood and pink = NOT well done.  We had to send the 2 plates back.  The guest of honor had to sit was watch some of start to eat.  Don't get me wrong, my steak was perfect and tasted great.  You are a steakhouse, getting steaks cooked to the right temperature is your forte!    I am surprised that a Manager was not send out to appoloize or at least talk to the table when we had to send back 2 of the 6 main entrees.  He came by at the end to do a quick hello and how was everything...  Well, it sucked but nothing you can do now at this point!

flis619GqwHxSzVxKApATg.text: Great Job to Randy Canada and his team for taking care of us! Great food and Great service!

K_Bmq9_Y9OBKVLBHIBNtVQ.text: We sat at the bar and had a nice evening of dining on small plate entrees and wine. The wait staff, bartender and manager were all very attentive. Although expensive, you will truly enjoy your dining experience at Fleming's.

ddcrf6IthzRhvYROvdWnwQ.text: Took my wife to celebrate our Anniversary... As always food was very good, I had the Wagyu Strip and the wife had the Filet special. Both excellent.  We did have a wine hiccup, however, it was made right.  Our servicer was Tiffany. She was very friendly and attentive.  I recommend Flemings in Peoria for any occasion. We have been to Flemings across the country numerous times.

styLFhcz6aGdbxlcFBTy9A.text: This was the best steak ever.  The sides were delicious and the service was wonderful.  Will definitely return.

MwFqioSgP4iO6jyDvg1QCw.text: A little rough to the start even though we had reservations. The place wasn't packed and you could see a few tables for 4 open, so kinda frustrating making you wait for 20 minutes. We waited in the bar for few minutes, it was like they wanted us to just sit there and not be seated in the dining room area.  Th food was ok but amazing like your other steak houses. The service was not excellent the waiter tried to up-sale  the wine list even though we knew our wines. After insisting on what we wanted he backed off.  We did have a bug in one of our wine glasses and told the waiter he didn't even apologize. He just walked away and got us another glass.  When the food was being served as they placed the plates down my mother grabbed her plate and burned her hands that she had to place her hands around the water glass. No apology even from the manager who placed her plate down just a " be careful the plates are hot" and walked away.

4zd06NfTRghMhdgTHyFM6w.text: This place is a hazard. If you walk in be careful if your wearing heels. The "wooden" floor is slippery. As we were being led to the seating area I slipped and fell on the floor. As I laid there trying to grasp what had just happened to me the girl at the reception desk just stared at me and as she standing there holding the menus instead of rushing to help me up she proceeds to tell me "oh well believe it or not this happens a lot". As I gathered myself she leads us to the table to sit down, you would think she would then inform a manager of the situation but instead she doesn't bother saying a word.  Once my waitress came over and asked how my evening was with no clue well you can imagine how angry I felt then. I explained how their first impression was not that great. Having a reservation didn't matter we still had to wait and now this happening well you can imagine. Once informed SHE did  let a manager know what had happened. Which then of course the manager Alma tried to play off that no nothing like this has ever happened before she didn't know why the receptionist would say anything like that. Etc.  Tried to see if I needed medical attention and she would write an incident report.  Needless to say dinner wasn't all that enjoyable seeing as I was in pain. They comped my meal trying to make amends. The next day I woke up w a stiff neck a sore thigh and a banged knee. In the following days I ended up at the chiropractor needing an adjustment and will need to be going for the next couple of weeks to help with the stiffness.  And a nasty bruised   I finally got a call back from the "adjustor" from corporate which she then informed me that they have "no med pay" policy and it's a third party agency if I want to file a claim and "MAYBE" get money reimbursed for the chiropractor other wise I could inform her of the cost and maybe she could issue me some "gift cards " for the inconvenience. Right. Cause I really am anxious to go back to that place.   Basically they don't admit anything wrong had happened. I called the restaurant and spoke to a manager named Chase. And asked if something was being done so that this doesn't happen to someone else and if it had happened before why wasn't it taken care of before. He did admit it had happened before and that Now they were looking into putting a rug.  But who knows if that's True or not. Not really willing to go look for my self.  So be careful don't find yourself in the same situation. Note: I was wearing heels. Yes, I do know how to walk in them. NO I was not drinking. And Nothing was spilled on the floor.

gl0CPY_fj5i-48cI8u6hNA.text: Decided to end our vacation with a really nice date night. Referenced Yelp for ideas and was happy to find a highly-rated steakhouse. Making reservations online was simple. We were warmly greeted at the door and shown to a lovely table. Our greeter asked if we preferred the white table cloth or if we would prefer a black table cloth. She showed us the tablet with the various wine lists and shared our waiter's name. Daniel came by shortly and was extremely friendly and helpful with suggestions. He shared with us the additional specials offered that evening. I selected the sliced filet with lobster cakes. My husband chose the 12 oz. filet with the porcini mushroom rub. Both steaks were cooked to perfection with amazing flavor. We had selected the signature potato side which was perfect for sharing. Our meal was preceded by an amazing warm bread loaf with a variety of cheese spreads. Extremely delicious! My husband also raved about the salad he ordered. I saved space for the creme brulee which was perfectly prepared with fresh fruit and whipped cream. The meal was very pricey at over $200 when you added wine/drinks but the experience and quality was well worth the price paid. Certainly an "occasion" restaurant. We were pleased to learn that there were other "Fleming's" across the country and nearby our hometown in Tampa, FL, as well! An unforgettable evening! Thank you so very much!

h6yd-gx1JZYFIEMdaf9B7w.text: When I called to make a reservation for 5:30, I was told the next available table would be 6:45pm. Took it. We showed up at 5;30 and we were seated right away. Uhm?  I was put off as soon as we walked in.....The bar area had loud music and a fricken TV on. Now when I go to a restaurant, especially when you pay $50 for a piece of meat, I expect QUIET. Folks were dressed as though they just got off the milk wagon.... I had the 14 ounce ribeye which was nothing to get excited about. The French onion soup was salty but digestible. The bread came with two types of butter which were good. One was made with parmesan cheese and the other with bacon. The mashed potatoes were no different from what I make at home. The presentation of my plate with just the meat, could have been better. They don't have gingerale but they can make it with Sprite and bitters! Uhm? My husband had the spinach salad which I thought was oily. It came with a deep fried something or other, I asked my husband what did it tasted like, he responded "like you don't want to try it" Uhm? He had the surf and turf, he liked it. The shrimp had a very light batter, which was good.The sauce over the sliced beef was strange to me. Service was good. Since it was our anniversary, they gave us two boxes of truffles, which was nice but again strange to the taste,  and a waxy texture. I don't understand why folks like this place. I suppose if you can't cook, this would be amazing. I will not be returning.

i32R-d1FwbJE6MWuJHg8iw.text: I'm/we're getting more and more disappointed as each visit passes. When we first went for Fathers Day our food was out of this world and our service was the same. It was all so amazing we couldn't wait to go back. After last nights visit which would be our 3rd, the chances of us returning are slim. The order's continue to get messed up and still served and the service was just terrible. We had to ask to clean our plates away as the served our dessert....Really? Our waitress was clearly preoccupied with friends. What was just a short time ago an A+ restaurant has now dropped to a D. Spending $200.00 on average for dinner I seriously expect much better.  So disappointed

bqx48_BPGeTmK-M0oQ5NTQ.text: Beautiful dine in restaurant food was amazing me nor my husband did not have to touch the salt or pepper not once as the steak and lobster was perfectly seasoned. The service was stellar never an empty glass. There was a person for a different service which was nice for example one person came to refill your water etc. another to bring your food another to add sherry to your soup and of course your waiter who made sure you had everything and remove any plate that was in your way or not being needed. Even the supervisor came to greet you to make sure everything was exceptional. The price is steep but for good reason the food quality is above and beyond just like the service.  We spent around $215 including tip for those of you wondering about price range that didn't include wine. Do yourselves a favor and at least try it once you won't be disappointed. I always ask myself this question once I try a new place. "Would I go here again?"  The answer is yes.

fD-NDu5ehw4Y1Z8sENsHMg.text: 5 for 6 til 7 is the best Happy Hour! All the small plates are delicious and you won't find a better burger at twice the price.  In the dining room I love the Delmonico and Fleming's potatoes.

K_qbG7pK8IxSAnMq1t0pEQ.text: My brother and I were in the mood for a good steak and came to Fleming's.  The place was crowded but we managed to get a table in the bar area.    The ambiance:  typical steak house wood and leather.  Pretty and warm.    The service:  Our server was very good. Once or twice we kind of felt like we had been forgotten and our server admitted that she thought we had been taken care of, but generally it was really good.  The food:  We got the special which was a filet and vegetables.  We ordered some extra mashed potatoes on the side.  I have to say that I have had better steak.  It was not as tender as I would have expected and the flavor was seriously lacking.  My brother asked me halfway through the meal what I thought and, being tactful and not wanting to make him feel that this wasn't such a great choice, I pointed out the positives.  He said he was underwhelmed. Gotta say that we both pretty much thought we had much higher expectations for the price point and the reputation.  I have been to other Fleming's and felt I had better food.  The vegetables and potatoes were good but not fabulous.    Fleming's, you didn't wow me on this trip.  Maybe next time...

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Flemings potatoes
Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. Prime ribeye special!

ciyjtQki7BAe5SQyGp-ZDA.text: Tonight we had Saturday night reservations for 2 for the steak and lobster special that I received an email for. Dinner included a delicious empanada and risotto appy and then your choice of the good wedge salad which has blue cheese and bacon or the Caesar salad which has a nice crouton slice.  I had the 8-ounce filet pan seared and hubby upgraded to the 12 ounce filet for only $5 extra his was $55. Server removed the lobster tail from the shell for me, it was cooked well and served with a grilled half lemon and hot butter yumm! all that and the bread and the nice bottle of Pinot Grigio, we definitely skipped on the desert. Unable to use the $25 dining credit because of the steak and lobster special but we had a lovely evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Flemings Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria, AZ, United States. 8 oz pan seared filet and lobster tail special... delicious! don&#39;t think it was on the menu we asked about it.

S7sBaYwbP0yjofeiwYVM8Q.text: Stick to steak if you are going here...everything else is hit or miss. Place is not cheap, they nickel and dime you to death for sides, drinks, sauces, etc. We had asked for a shrimp side to go along with our steak and lobster, since one member of our group did not care for lobster. Instead, we received steak and shrimp...minus the lobster tail (which another member of our group would have gladly consumed)...have no fear though, we were charged full price for the steak and lobster (which we did not get), plus an up charge for the shrimp thus saving the restaurant money, but not me. An additional side included Brussels sprouts, which were way undercooked and poorly seasoned. Desserts were average at best. Like I said, steak was good, but not much else.

C1N6nuVqBYvAojfyORNdZA.text: We don't often splurge on a $100 per person meal but for this birthday celebration, I'm glad we did!  We went with another couple and Flemings was amazing.  The wine was great, service perfect and the filets were exactly as we ordered them.  Had the chipotle mac & cheese as a side and it was something Bobby Flay would be proud of, just the right amount of spice in a great comfort dish.  Had the homemade ice cream for dessert and it was fantastic.  They generously gave the birthday girls a box of truffles and a card signed by the staff-very classy touch.  We'll be back!

xfMs18_8eE5MKtZedc5-0A.text: Another great dining experience courtesy of the Peoria Flemings. My wife and I like to celebrate special occasions, and the joint always gets our business. The wine list is on and iPad and extensive. If your not electronic savvy they also have the list printed. The wine in my opinion is overpriced, slightly. I wouldn't say however it's excessive so don't feel like you're getting ripped off. I usually start with their clam chowder, which I did this time as well. Big pieces of clams were good to see and taste! I also decided to get their boneless New York Strip - Dry Aged vs a Filet Mignon which I have had numerous times and have never been disappointed. The splurge for the dry aged cut was worth it. It was gigantic and cooked to my perfection. For $57, I would recommend that if dining as a couple, cutting it in half and sharing it. I would have been plenty for two, especially after you have at that point gorged on a starter or two, bread, and their sides!! Lastly if you don't already, sign up with Open Table to ensure you make a reservation. They get busy fast, with the busiest time always seeming to be around 7pm.

eghV5NVNObcTqFerk-FLdA.text: This restaurant does everything right.  The food is excellent and the service is very attentive with the wait staff being both friendly and accommodating.  The food is delicious with a good selection and fair prices for excellent quality. The icing on the cake may be the management. They go out of their way to make you feel special and appreciated,  This is a spot we will return to time and time again.  Way to go Flemings! We are pleased with what you offer in value and service.  Thank you!

2Cv2FHwl5Wi_JJpRXJ4_tA.text: A return trip this past Friday with my parents.  Upping my previous 4-star review to 5 as the hostess with the attitude seemed to have had a refresher in customer service.  Again, everyone else on staff was excellent, the food delicious as always.

BDbNAnPsyeaazDlp3xRUGg.text: The ambiance in this place alone is so romantic and upscale. It's hard not to feel a little sexy when you go here. I've had a filet mignon, asparagus, potatoes, and cheesecake. The steak melts in your mouth the way only perfectly cut and cooked top of the line beef would. Asparagus was tender and flavorful and the potatoes where creamy and fluffy. The cheesecake was just that, cheesecake, nothing spectacular or memorable about it. All in all I love this place, it's the ideal place for celebrations or a special night out.

nqx9LT1O7Z38LTGdPltMrw.text: The food was great but the service was sub par. Ruths Chris has much better service for about the same price. I was very disappointed.

8ltkgYUE0XuRgjrrp_HhbA.text: We have been going to Flemings since they opened in Peoria. The experience and the food used to be incredible. Over the last 18 months however they have fallen off a cliff. Tonight was probably the last time we will be there. They are very aware their happy hour is one of the busiest times they have yet the seating area is very limited. In the past I have seen them open up the back area to seating. We received a gift card from the management for a less-than-stellar experience on our last occasion and tonight they would not accept that card and made us wait in the waiting area for an open table which never occurred. The less than Stellar experience occurred during a wine pairing which the food was not only cold but the wine was late on every course. Two hours after leaving we received a phone call asking if we had paid our bill. This is just atrocious and I believe we are finally finished with trying to trust that Fleming's will improve on these experiences. Very very very poor management and chef experience. By the way the dining room was empty except for about 3 tables. I don't know if it is a management issue however whoever is running the restaurant certainly does not know what it is they are doing.

0BJOXORF7ZXVueMt8rC9hQ.text: MMMMMM.... The food is great! My husband and I love this place. The food is great and so is the service. We have eaten in the dinning room and in the bar both places are wonderful! It is more informal in the bar but still very nice. They have a fantastic selection of wine. We like to go to their happy hour. They have great deals on appetizers and drinks. Their burgers are to die for! All kinds of burgers besides ground beef...they have portabella mushroom, crab cake and a prime rib burger! The rolls just melt in your mouth.   The regular menu has a wonderful selection. The steaks are beyond good, and they always have a nice selection of seafood. The side dishes are awesome. We have tried almost all the sides and keep finding new favorites! You have to try the Flemming's potatoes, and the mushrooms, yummy! I got the Sea bass the last time I went and the waiter said it was swimming off the coast of California the day before! It was very good! My husband got the cajun spiced ribeye which was excellent as usual. There is a good prix fix menu too, that changes with the seasons.  Definitely save room for the dessert. They have a great Chocolate lava cake that they serve with ice cream. I take some of my dinner home (they box it up so nice) so I can still eat dessert.  A great place for a nice dinner or a special occasion.  Go on line and make a reservation and sometimes you can get a deal.

TI2Asi9CRhm-6B2IM8Hlvg.text: Nice to have a real dining experience in the west side. Steven was a fabulous waiter and had an extensive knowledge of their wine list. Speaking of wine list they have a nice selection of wines by the glass which works well with us as I like whites and husband likes reds. We started with Sauteed Prince Edward Island Mussels which were exceptional and it got only better from there. No rush through in 45 minutes to get you out the door atmosphere here, the wine and meal was served to be savored and enjoyed (as it should be). It is not cheap but sometimes you get what you pay for. And I did not want to go out and have another tough steak and under cooked vegetables and be shoved out the door.

GkALsDz45Ql3QwZpA4u8JA.text: Flemmings is a fancier steakhouse chain. I would say its somewhere in between The Keg and Carvers. We arrived around 5pm Sunday with no reservations and were promptly seated. They have a huge wine selection and a small wine cellar. There are cherry wood walls from floor to ceiling. The overall look is an elegant steakhouse. I'm not sure if it was because it was Sunday, the proximity of Sun City, the time of day, or that only older folks still have money stashed away but I would have to guess the average age was somewhere around 63 up in there. Not that that has any weight on the review or I'm anti aging but it was just a mere observation.   They brought out some fresh baked rosemary bread and two different kinds of butter right after we sat down. The bread was awesome. Hot and soft inside and a slightly crunchy outside. One butter was whipped and the other was more of a spread. They both were good. I know its just bread but it was very tasty.   Most everything on the menu is ala carte. The steaks ranged from 30-50 bucks, the sides were from 7 and up and salads about the same. There were a couple of prix fixe summer options but neither looked very enticing. However, on Sundays they have a prime rib option. You get to choose a salad, side, prime rib, and a dessert for around 27 dollars. We both decided to go try it out.   My caesar salad came out first. The salad was a good size. The dressing was flavorful. Not overbearing and not non existent either. However, much of the lettuce was yellow/not good. My wife had the same thoughts on hers. The croutons they had in that salad could seriously break some teeth. Our first thought was for as fancy and ballerific this place shoots for they should hit you with a bomb salad from the jump. Without a doubt the salads were the worst part of the entire dinner.   Not long after we received our meals. We were served some nice thick slices of prime rib with three dipping sauces. The prime rib was cooked to perfection. There was a aus jus sauce, a horseradish sauce, and I can not remember the third. I would have liked the horseradish sauce to be stronger and the aus jus to have more flavor but all three were ok. The meat had a good amount of fat on it which is typical for prime rib. It also had a nice char on the edges. I ordered mash potatoes with blue cheese. They basically threw in a huge chunk of blue cheese that was soft and melting in the middle of the potatoes. It was simple and awesome. My wife enjoyed her meal as well. She commented on the fat ratio of the meat and wished she would have ordered it a bit more rare.   For dessert I ordered the lava chocolate cake. The waitress gave me a heads up that it took 20 minutes before we ordered so I could put it in earlier. The dessert looked awesome. There was a fortune cookie type boat filled with vanilla ice cream standing next to a chocolate cake with mint and a raspberry on top with a side of cream. As I cut into the chocolate cake there was an oozing of hot melting dark chocolate pouring out of the side. The flavor of the hot chocolate, mixed with the soft hot chocolate cake, and ice cream all together was mouth watering goodness. It was so large the wife and I shared it and took her cheesecake to go.   The service was also on par. The server kept never let our glasses go empty, the waitress was informative, and the manager came by to ask us how everything was.   I can't comment on the value of anything except for what we had and for a prime rib dinner like that under 30 bucks was definitely a value. I was so full I just wanted to take a nap right there at the table. So if you are looking for a nice Sunday meal and in the mood for some prime rib I would have to recommend giving Flemmings a go.

P2toYX_cz98rc3VCqOqinA.text: Went back tonight. Service from Tiffany was spot on. We didn't have to ask for anything she anticipated everything perfectly. Food was very very good. We will definitely go back again. I am glad it was so much better than the last visit.

kUwQVaag6OwixRcnSHgIlQ.text: Amazing wine and food ! This restraunt is always packed but well worth the wait.

t-ffXZyFKDhbNP318fcrxw.text: Had the pleasure of dining at Fleming s last night with a friend. What a pleasure. We made our reservation online and arrived a bit early. Rather than acting inconvenienced, they were very pleasant as they seated us without wait. With their extensive wine list, presented both in a menu form and on an iPad and with the broad menu, it took some time to make decisions. While deciding we enjoyed our cocktails with their house bread, hot from the oven with several custom butters.   We started by sharing a Tenderloin Carpaccio that was perfect. We had the Caesar salad that was nice and crisp and very tasty followed by our entres.   My friend had the lamb which she was very happy with. My rib eye, is one of their signature dishes and I know why. Because they have perfected it. All their steaks are hand cut and wet aged. It came to the table right from the grill, nice and hot. The flavor was exquisite and it melted in your mouth. We had the Fleming s famous potatoes as a side dish that was more than large enough for two. Sadly we didn't get to try their desserts...we failed to plan ahead and overindulged before we got there.   I would have to consider Fleming's to be one of the TOP steakhouses in the Phoenix area in every respect. The ambience was great, the staff were obviously well trained and seemed to actually enjoy their work, and of course the food quality would be hard for anyone to beat.

2qWPayPOizBSNW90SgkHgg.text: Walked into this place after the place next door was packed and we were starving. Didn't know what Fleming was except that they had food. Well we were in for a surprise.  This place is a steak house and an expensive one, not the kind of place you just walk over too unless you don't care about spending 200 dollars on one meal. The steak was good. But everything is al carte meaning you have to order a steak and any sides separately. I usually don't like that and this place was not the exception. Maybe it was how we were introduced to this restaurant so I'll have to update when we actually plan to come here as part of a special occasion.

vr6fWFXF7TMj_7fHCy5piA.text: This is our favorite date night/BEST EVER Happy Hour/meeting place for friends who enjoy good food and drink!  Love Love Love the artwork. The bar staff make you feel like you are at Cheers.  Food is ALWAYS amazing.

Tx6tqppavmh6zzFWPzDJQA.text: Cant complain about the prices if you like fine dining. This place is yummy so i expect to pay a good price for an amazing meal. If you dont like what they serve you tell them. they take great care of their customers. My husband and I went there for our Anniversary and they treated us like royalty. We did go to Costco and got the gift cards at a discounted price. Every bit helps. As we were leaving they took our picture then put it in a cute frame and gave us a Anniversary card and A box of truffles. Seriously who does that? Flemming's did. They have a customer for life with my family

47tGci4rueNWj0_ETTvn9Q.text: I can't say enough about the food and service at Fleming's. The wife and I have been here at least 10x never had a bad meal. If you love filet than this is the place for you! Don't forget to tell them if your celebrating a special occasion. We just went for our birthdays and each of us received a box of truffles(amazing) and a $25 gift card for our next visit.

YHp--tzgoatqBo35_LyBmw.text: They are tops on my list!  My daughter planned my birthday dinner here, a small affair.  The staff, from the manager on down, could not have been more attentive.  The food was excellent, service was superb, and the ambiance was one of the nicest I have experienced since leaving Southern California.  They made sure to honor my birthday with a card, present, and chocolates.  The manager stopped by to give his personal birthday wishes, as well as to check on our dining experience.  They are top notch all the way.

TcBhlpKxnxSDVuO5F3CESA.text: The management team and owner of Fleming's are very professional and excellent to work with.  The way they conduct business is exactly how they run their restaurant - Nothing short from PERFECT!    I've been very impressed!  I highly recommended this restaurant.

UXS9Txie1QBED64H2fqn2w.text: Fleming has a special going rite now where if you make your reservations on line you get $25.00 off of a ticket of $150.00 or more and a $25.00 gift card for your next visit.  My wife and I along with her cousin and his wife headed out to Fleming's on Sunday night since Sunday is the only night that they serve prime rib.  $36.99 get's you a generous cut portion of prime rib, a starter salad, a side, and a dessert.  A smoking deal considering how things can add up here if you order Ala-cart.  The dinning experience was spread out over about a two hour period starting with some bread and wine.  The waiter was very knowledgeable about the wine selections (there is an extensive wine list)  and tentative to our needs. The Riesling that my wife selected (per the waiters recommendation) was perfect for her taste.  The tomato basil spread along with the wiped butter for the bread was very delightful and a great way to start off the meal.  We all ordered the prime rib and a different side so we could each sample the different side dishes.    I started with the wedge salad with blue cheese dressing.  The lettuce was fresh and crisp and the blue cheese dressing was creamy.  I really enjoyed it.  A little while later they brought out our prime rim meals with our side dishes, the prime rib is cut about 1-1/4" thick.  The prime rib came with three side sauces.  One was aju, another was creamy horse radish, and the last was a ground mustard sauce.   The three sauces were ok but I like straight horse radish with my prime rib, so I requested some and the brought it out.   For the sides I got the mac & cheese, my wife got the Fleming mash potatoes, her cousin ordered the grilled asparagus, and his wife got the onion rings.  WARNING!!!!!  The side dishes are HUGE.....  The onion rings were stacked about 12 inches tall, the mac & cheese was a large bowl, the Fleming potatoes could have been a meal on there own and there was enough asparagus to share.  Every thing tasted great.  The dessert's were great, chocolate lava cake, creme Brulee, and carrot cake.  All tasted fantastic.  So by now I am sure you are wondering why only 4 stars.  Well there was a couple small pieces of bone that I bit into on my first bite of the prime rib and I had to spit them out.  My wife also had the same thing in hers.  Also as a Prime rib the eye (the center of the prime rib) was though and a little chewy.  Not what I expect with a prime cut of meat.
